original: de dang de dag sangs rgyas kun mkhyen gyi //
analyzed: de dang de dag sangs rgyas kun mkhyen gyi //
translated: They are the holders of the Dharma of all the Omniscient Buddhas.

original: chos rnams rtag tu 'dzin par byed pa yin //
analyzed: chos rnams rtag tu 'dzin par byed pa yin //
translated: They are the holders of the Dharma of all the Omniscient Buddhas.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other verses,

original: gang chos thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po sgrub pas 'dzin pa de de @137b bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gang chos thams cad bsdus pa'i ngo bo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi sgron ma ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po sgrub pas 'dzin pa de de @137b bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi mdzod 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: those who hold the lamp of omniscient wisdom that includes all the Dharmas, who accomplish the king of samadhis, are the holders of the Dharma treasury of the Tathagatas.

original: de dag ni sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i rgyu glu'i dbyangs snyan pas chos ston pa la mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: de dag ni sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i rgyu glu'i dbyangs snyan pas chos ston pa la mkhas pa yin /
translated: They are skilled in teaching the Dharma with the sweet melody of song, which is the cause for bringing joy to all sentient beings.

original: tshul khrims kyi nor can yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi nor can yin /
translated: They are the ones with the wealth of discipline.

original: bslab pas phyug pa yin /
analyzed: bslab pas phyug pa yin /
translated: They are the ones who are rich in training.

original: don dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' bas dur smrig dmar po'i chos gos 'chang ba yin /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos la mngon par dga' bas dur smrig dmar po'i chos gos 'chang ba yin /
translated: They are the ones who wear the red Dharma robes of the ultimate Dharma.

original: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa can yin /
analyzed: khams gsum nas nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa can yin /
translated: They are the ones with the intention to definitely leave the three realms.

original: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa /
translated: They are the ones who are always in equipoise.

original: shin tu dul ba /
analyzed: shin tu dul ba /
translated: They are the ones who are very disciplined.

original: gdul dka' ba'i sems can thams cad 'dul par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gdul dka' ba'i sems can thams cad 'dul par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the ones who tame all difficult to tame sentient beings.

original: shin tu bag med pa rab tu gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams chos bstan pa'i sgras rab tu sad par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu bag med pa rab tu gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams chos bstan pa'i sgras rab tu sad par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He awakens the realm of beings who are very heedless and deeply asleep with the sound of the Dharma teaching.

original: zab mo'i sgras rab tu sad par byas nas theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zab mo'i sgras rab tu sad par byas nas theg pa gsum la rab tu 'god par byed pa'o //
translated: Having awakened them with the sound of the profound, he establishes them in the three vehicles.

original: ser sna med pa'i sbyin bdag chen po'o //
analyzed: ser sna med pa'i sbyin bdag chen po'o //
translated: He is a great lord of generosity without miserliness.

original: sems can thams cad la bde ba dang / yid bde bskyed par byed pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa sbyin par byed pa'o //üîΩchos kyi rnga'i sgras sems can thams cad bsdus nas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gyi 'khri shing rgyas par gyur pa ye shes kyi ral gris gcod pa la mkhas pas the tshom thams cad bcad nas the tshom med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la rab tu dgod
analyzed: sems can thams cad la bde ba dang / yid bde bskyed par byed pa'i longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa sbyin par byed pa'o // chos kyi rnga'i sgras sems can thams cad bsdus nas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gyi 'khri shing rgyas par gyur pa ye shes kyi ral gris gcod pa la mkhas pas the tshom thams cad bcad nas the tshom med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la rab tu dgod
translated: He gives the perfection of wealth that produces happiness and mental pleasure for all beings.

original: pa'i phyir nges bar 'byung ba'i chos ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i phyir nges bar 'byung ba'i chos ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Having gathered all beings with the sound of the Dharma drum, he cuts through the thickets of doubt of all beings with the sword of wisdom. He teaches the Dharma of definite emergence in order to eliminate all doubts and establish them in the doubt-free dharmadhatu.

original: chos la gus pa chos la dga' bas phyin ci log la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam du zhugs par mthong nas de dag la snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gus pa chos la dga' bas phyin ci log la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams 'khor ba'i 'dam du zhugs par mthong nas de dag la snying rje chen po'i sems bskyed nas 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Out of respect for the Dharma and love for the Dharma, they see that sentient beings have entered into error and are sunk in the mire of cyclic existence. They generate the mind of great compassion and teach them the noble path of the eightfold path.

original: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por 'khyams pa'i sems can rnams bsgral ba'i phyir chos kyi gru legs par sbyar nas zag glan byas te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen por 'khyams pa'i sems can rnams bsgral ba'i phyir chos kyi gru legs par sbyar nas zag glan byas te /
translated: In order to liberate sentient beings who wander in the great ocean of cyclic existence, they construct the ship of the Dharma and set sail.

original: mdo sde sna tshogs kyi skud pas yang dag par bcings nas /
analyzed: mdo sde sna tshogs kyi skud pas yang dag par bcings nas /
translated: They bind it with the ropes of various s≈´tras.

original: shes rab skya ba 'dzin pas legs par bzung ba /
analyzed: shes rab skya ba 'dzin pas legs par bzung ba /
translated: They hold it well with the rudder of wisdom.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rlung gis bskyod nas ded dpon chen po'i mgon dang bcas pas mngon par 'dod pa'i pha rol gyi 'gram lta ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / lam gyi mchog la yang dag par zhon nas mgon med pa'i sems can thams cad theg pa chen po'i gru der bcug nas gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba yon tan thams cad kyi @138a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi rlung gis bskyod nas ded dpon chen po'i mgon dang bcas pas mngon par 'dod pa'i pha rol gyi 'gram lta ba'i ye shes kyi tshogs dang / lam gyi mchog la yang dag par zhon nas mgon med pa'i sems can thams cad theg pa chen po'i gru der bcug nas gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba yon tan thams cad kyi @138a * //
translated: The wind of generosity, discipline, patience, and diligence stirs them, and with the captain of the great vehicle as their guide, they set out on the path of the accumulation of merit and wisdom, and they reach the other shore, the state of omniscience.

original: 'byung gnas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par byed de /
analyzed: 'byung gnas mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer pha rol gyi 'gram du phyin par byed de /
translated: They board the ship of the Great Vehicle and take all beings who are without a protector to the other shore, the city of nirvana, which is free from all harm and is the source of all good qualities.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma nyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin ma nyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po thos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who hears the king of concentrations called ‚Äúthe nature of all phenomena just as it is‚Äù will reach the other shore.

original: de nyid sman pa'i rgyal po bla na med pa'i dbang po chos kyi sman byin pas thams cad kyi nad gso bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pas rgol ba rnams pha rol tu song ba /
analyzed: de nyid sman pa'i rgyal po bla na med pa'i dbang po chos kyi sman byin pas thams cad kyi nad gso bar byed pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rig pas rgol ba rnams pha rol tu song ba /
translated: He is the king of physicians, the unsurpassed lord, who gives the medicine of Dharma to all and heals their illnesses. He has gone beyond all worldly knowledge and is victorious over all opponents.

original: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
analyzed: phas kyi rgol ba thams cad 'joms par byed pa /
translated: He conquers all adversaries.

original: rgol ba'i dbang po /
analyzed: rgol ba'i dbang po /
translated: He is the lord of opponents.

original: rgol ba'i dbang phyug / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi shes pas dpa' ba /
analyzed: rgol ba'i dbang phyug / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi shes pas dpa' ba /
translated: He is the master of opponents. He is courageous with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: bdud kyi sgra'i stobs 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi sgra'i stobs 'joms pa'o //
translated: He conquers the power of the sounds of MƒÅra.

original: sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / mgon dang / gling dang / snang bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi skyabs dang / dpung gnyen dang / mgon dang / gling dang / snang bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is the refuge, the protector, the defender, the island, and the light for all beings.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa yongs su skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i chos ston par bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / sgom pa yongs su skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa'i sgrib pa med pa'i chos ston par bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the diligence that is never weary of listening to, contemplating, and meditating on the sublime Dharma. He is the unobstructed teaching of the Dharma that delights all beings and fulfills all their wishes.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are skilled in knowing the mental behavior of all sentient beings.

original: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms shing byang chub kyi snying por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par ston pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed kyang sems can gyi 'du shes kyang bskyed parüîΩmi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad 'joms shing byang chub kyi snying por nye bar 'gro ba dang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la sogs pas rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par ston pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed kyang sems can gyi 'du shes kyang bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They destroy all the ma·πá·∏çalas of MƒÅra and, by displaying various miracles such as approaching the seat of awakening and turning the wheel of Dharma, they tame sentient beings without ever giving rise to the notion of a sentient being.

original: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su gyur la /
analyzed: yongs su brtag pa nye bar bzung na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can thams cad sangs rgyas su gyur la /
translated: If we consider this in detail, even if all the sentient beings of all the world systems were to become buddhasüîΩand were to begin to describe all the qualities of meditative absorption for many quintillions of eons, they would not be able to know the end of those qualities.

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan ma lus pa brjod par brtsams pa de dang ldan yang yon gyi mtha' shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan ni dpag tu med pa'o zhes
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du mar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan ma lus pa brjod par brtsams pa de dang ldan yang yon gyi mtha' shes par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan ni dpag tu med pa'o zhes
translated: This shows that the qualities of meditative absorption are immeasurable.

original: bstan to // ting nge 'dzin rgyal po yon tan rgya mtsho yi //
analyzed: bstan to // ting nge 'dzin rgyal po yon tan rgya mtsho yi //
translated: The qualities of the ocean of the King of SamƒÅdhisüîΩ

original: yon tan ma lus rab kyi mthar thug pa //
analyzed: yon tan ma lus rab kyi mthar thug pa //
translated: 1. The qualities of the ocean of concentration,

original: dpag med sangs rgyas kyis kyang brjod mi spyod //
analyzed: dpag med sangs rgyas kyis kyang brjod mi spyod //
translated: the king, are not all declared even by the infinite Buddhas,üîΩwho have reached the ultimate of goodness,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i blo bzhin mtha' mi shes //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i blo bzhin mtha' mi shes //
translated: because they are infinite like the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan dang gzungs kyi phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan dang gzungs kyi phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa bdun pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the thirty-seventh chapter, on the qualities of concentration and the benefits of retention, in the Ornament of the Mahayana Sutras.

original: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis @138b zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: // / de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis @138b zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the Bodhisattva Maitreya,üîΩMaitreya, you should learn this teaching of the Dharma,

original: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu bstan par bya ba'i bar du ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang rgya cher rab tu bstan par bya ba'i bar du ni bshad zin to //
translated: retain it, preserve it, and expound it extensively to others.üîΩBy this, you should cultivate the power of patience.

original: des bzod pa'i stobs bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: des bzod pa'i stobs bsgom par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par 'gyur ba mtshon pa yin no //
translated: This and the rest is an indication of what is to be explained.

original: bstan par bya ba ni rtag tu goms pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: bstan par bya ba ni rtag tu goms pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: What is to be explained means by the application of constant practice.

original: mang du bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mang du bya ba ni bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: What is to be done extensively is what is to be explained.

original: chos don du gnyer ba ngang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos don du gnyer ba ngang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One who is devoted to the Dharma and so on.

original: chos la don du gnyer ba ni chos nyan pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa'o //
analyzed: chos la don du gnyer ba ni chos nyan pa'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brtan pa'o //
translated: Seeking the Dharma is being devoted to spiritual teachers in order to hear the Dharma.

original: chos 'dod pa ni bsgom pa la mngon par brtson par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'dod pa ni bsgom pa la mngon par brtson par gyur pa'o //
translated: Desiring the Dharma is being intent on meditation.

original: chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos yongs su 'dzin pa ni chos nyid mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Upholding the Dharma is making the Dharma manifest.

original: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas mchod pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa ni sangs rgyas mchod pa la brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Practicing in accord with the Dharma is being intent on making offerings to the Buddhas.

original: de ltar rab tu zhugs pas gnas gsum la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu zhugs pas gnas gsum la brtson par bya'o //
translated: Thus, having entered into this, one should strive in three things.

original: gsum gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: What are the three?

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa ni byas pa dang ma byas pa'i sdig pa rnams spong zhing zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa ni byas pa dang ma byas pa'i sdig pa rnams spong zhing zad par byed pa'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the afflictions is the abandonment and exhaustion of the sins that have been done and those that have not been done.

original: bsod nams kyi dbang du gyur pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs bdag por gyur pas 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi dbang du gyur pa ni bsod nams kyi stobs bdag por gyur pas 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Being under the power of merit is engaging in the power of merit.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pas ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi bde ba la reg par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pas ma chags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la sogs pa rnams bskyed par bya ba'i 'jig rten gyi bde ba la reg par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not touch worldly happiness, such as the roots of virtue of non-attachment, etc., by one who desires the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: don de dag gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don de dag gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify those meanings,

original: sngon gyi sbyor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis gdul ba'i skye bo rnams 'dun par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩbskal ba stong du ji ltar ngas spyad pa //
analyzed: sngon gyi sbyor ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis gdul ba'i skye bo rnams 'dun par bya ba'i phyir / bskal ba stong du ji ltar ngas spyad pa //
translated: in the melody of verses of past practice, in order to inspire the beings to be trained,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, As I practiced for a thousand eons, and so on.

original: mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni rna gtod du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan par gyis zhes bya ba ni rna gtod du gzhug pa'o //
translated: Listening means directing the ears.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'di tshol ba'i tshe ngas sngon bskal ba stong phrag mang por sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po la mchod pa byas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'di tshol ba'i tshe ngas sngon bskal ba stong phrag mang por sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag mang po la mchod pa byas so //
translated: When seeking this samadhi, I made offerings to many hundreds of thousands of buddhas for many thousands of eons in the past.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa'i rdul gyi tshogs pas mang ba'i bskal ba yang 'das pa na de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa'i rdul gyi tshogs pas mang ba'i bskal ba yang 'das pa na de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs kyi dbang phyug ces bya ba byung ngo //
translated: After an eon as numerous as the atoms of anincalculable number of buddha-fields had passed, there appeared a Tathagata called Lord of the Assembly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bye ba stong phrag drug cu byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de'i dge slong gi dge 'dun ni bye ba stong phrag drug cu byung ngo //
translated: The community of monks of that Tathagata numbered six hundred thousand times ten million.

original: de'i tshe sa chen po 'di yang bde zhing lo legs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sa chen po 'di yang bde zhing lo legs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan par gyur ro //
translated: At that time, this great earth was endowed with the qualities of happiness, good harvests, and so on.

original: de la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyang bde ba dang ldan par gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyang bde ba dang ldan par gyur ro //
translated: All the beings living there were endowed with happiness.

original: des shing brtul zhugs bzang la nyon mongs @139a * //
analyzed: des shing brtul zhugs bzang la nyon mongs @139a * //
translated: They were gentle, of good conduct, and had few defilements.

original: chung ; / zhes bya ba ni bde ba thams cad dang ldan du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur cing tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan par gyur to //
analyzed: chung ; / zhes bya ba ni bde ba thams cad dang ldan du zin kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag po'i dbang gis nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur cing tshul khrims la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis brgyan par gyur to //
translated: Even though they were endowed with all happiness, by the power of the Tathagata as their Lord, they were free from defilements and were adorned with the qualities of morality and so on.

original: de yi dus nas bdag byung ba ni //
analyzed: de yi dus nas bdag byung ba ni //
translated: From that time on, I have appeared.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i dus nas chen po'i bdag po'i rgyal po'i sras me tog mchog ces bya ba byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i dus nas chen po'i bdag po'i rgyal po'i sras me tog mchog ces bya ba byung ngo //
translated: In this and other passages, it is said that from that time on, there was a son of the king of the great lord, called Supreme Flower.

original: de'i bu yang lnga brgya yod de /
analyzed: de'i bu yang lnga brgya yod de /
translated: He had five hundred sons,

original: gzugs bzang zhing lta na sdug pa skyes bu'i mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs bzang zhing lta na sdug pa skyes bu'i mtshan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: handsome, pleasing to the eye, adorned with all the marks of a great man.

original: de nas rgyal po des de bzhin gshegs pa de la me tog dang 'bras bu sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i skyed mos tshal stong phrag brgya snyed longs spyod dang yongs su spyad pa'i phyir phul lo //
analyzed: de nas rgyal po des de bzhin gshegs pa de la me tog dang 'bras bu sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i skyed mos tshal stong phrag brgya snyed longs spyod dang yongs su spyad pa'i phyir phul lo //
translated: Then the king offered to that Tathagata a hundred thousand gardens filled with various flowers and fruits for his enjoyment and use.

original: 'chag pa la sogs pa'i sar yang gos rnam pa sna tshogs bting ngo //
analyzed: 'chag pa la sogs pa'i sar yang gos rnam pa sna tshogs bting ngo //
translated: And on the paths for walking and so on, he spread various kinds of cloth.

original: rgyal po'i bu de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pas me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pas me tog dang / spos dang / mar me dang / dri dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang /
translated: The prince, endowed with the path of the ten virtuous actions, made offerings to the Bhagavat with various flowers, incense, lamps, perfumes, ointments, powders, Dharma robes, parasols, victory banners,

original: ba dan rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / sil snyan gyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs pas bcom ldan 'das de la mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: ba dan rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang / sil snyan gyi khyad par rnam pa sna tshogs pas bcom ldan 'das de la mchod pa byas te /
translated: and flags, and with various kinds of musical instruments.

original: thal mo sbyar nas mdun du 'dug par gyur ro //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas mdun du 'dug par gyur ro //
translated: He joined his palms together and sat in front of the Bhagavat.

original: de nas dge slong rnams dang / lha la sogs pa yang ci zhig ston par 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: de nas dge slong rnams dang / lha la sogs pa yang ci zhig ston par 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Then the bhik·π£us, devas, and so forth thought, ‚ÄúWhat will he teach?‚Äù

original: zab mo'i chos ston par 'gyur ro snyam nas dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: zab mo'i chos ston par 'gyur ro snyam nas dga' bar gyur to //
translated: They thought, ‚ÄúHe will teach the profound Dharma,‚Äù and they rejoiced.

original: sa'i bdag po de'i bla na med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mkhyen nas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: sa'i bdag po de'i bla na med pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa mkhyen nas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di ston par mdzad do //
translated: Knowing the unsurpassed superior intention of that lord of the earth, he taught this samƒÅdhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena.

original: chos bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sa chen po 'di rnam pa drug tu g-yos par gyur to //
translated: By the blessing of the teaching of the Dharma, this great earth shook in six ways.

original: nam mkha'i dkyil nas yang yid du 'od ba'i me tog sna tshogs kyi char bab par gyur to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dkyil nas yang yid du 'od ba'i me tog sna tshogs kyi char bab par gyur to //
translated: From the middle of the sky, a rain of various beautiful flowers fell.

original: sa chen po 'di las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin padma'i khyad par mang po byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: sa chen po 'di las rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin padma'i khyad par mang po byung bar gyur to //
translated: From this great earth, many special lotuses made of various jewels appeared.

original: de nas de'i bsam pa lhag par bzang ba'i ngo bo thugs su chud nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: de nas de'i bsam pa lhag par bzang ba'i ngo bo thugs su chud nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: Then, understanding the excellent nature of his intention, he gave him a prophecy of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin 'di yang bshad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ting nge 'dzin 'di yang bshad do //
translated: The Blessed One also taught this samƒÅdhi.

original: don de'i tshig rnams te don dang tshig gi dbye ba rnams phye nas /
analyzed: don de'i tshig rnams te don dang tshig gi dbye ba rnams phye nas /
translated: The words of that meaning, having distinguished the divisions of meaning and words,

original: de yi don tshig rnams kyang mnyan par gyis //
analyzed: de yi don tshig rnams kyang mnyan par gyis //
translated: Listen to the words of that meaning!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdon ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / don ni don dam pa'o //
translated: In this way,üîΩMeaning is the ultimate.

original: tshig @139b ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: tshig @139b ni rab tu gnas pa ste /
translated: Words are well-established.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate non-abiding nirvana, he says:

original: srid pa thams cad srid pa med pa ste //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad srid pa med pa ste //
translated: All existence is non-existence,

original: kun brtags srog dang smig rgyu 'dra ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: kun brtags srog dang smig rgyu 'dra ba yin // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: like a mirage, imagined to be life.

original: srid pa thams cad de /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad de /
translated: All existence is non-existence.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur bas na srid pa'o //
translated: Since it comes into existence, it is existence.

original: de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin te ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: It does not come into existence, because it is unborn.

original: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las skye ba med pa nyid do //
translated: It does not arise from itself, from another, from both, or without a cause.

original: de la brtags pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'i //
analyzed: de la brtags pa'i ngo bos ma skyes pa'i //
translated: Here, it is unborn by the nature of the imagined.

original: brtags pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa yang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The imagined is the form of the apprehended and apprehender.üîΩThe Proponents of Mind Only say that ultimate production exists by the nature of the dependent.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bos ni don dam pa'i skye ba yod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bos ni don dam pa'i skye ba yod do zhes bye brag tu smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa ba rnams zer ro //
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, SautrƒÅntikas, and YogƒÅcƒÅras say that ultimate production does not exist by the nature of the dependent.

original: don 'di shes par byed 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: don 'di shes par byed 'dod pa ni /
translated: The one who wishes to understand this meaning says:

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo yis //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo yis //
translated: By the nature of the imagined,

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: All phenomena are unarisen.

original: gzhan gyi dbang la brten nas ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la brten nas ni //
translated: Based on the dependent,

original: mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye //üîΩzhes gsungs so zhes zer na /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye // zhes gsungs so zhes zer na /
translated: the conceptions of humans arise.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: If you say that, that is illogical,

original: gzhan gyi dbang yang skye ba med par sgrub par byed pa'i mdo sde yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang yang skye ba med par sgrub par byed pa'i mdo sde yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are s≈´tras that prove that the dependent is also unarisen.

original: de yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa dgongs pa nges par 'grel ba'i mdo las /
translated: The noble S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa dang / don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa la dgongs nas ngas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang /
translated: Thinking of the lack of entityness of character, the lack of entityness of production, and the ultimate lack of entityness, I teach that all phenomena are natureless, unarisen, unceased,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: originally peaceful,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩchos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa gang zhe na /
translated: and naturally nirvƒÅ·πáa.üîΩWhat is the lack of entityness of character of phenomena?

original: gang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang kun brtags kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the imputed character.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir ming dang brdas rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid de ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ming dang brdas rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid de ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: Because that characteristic which is established by name and symbol is not the intrinsic identity.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas dang / rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the aggregates, elements, media, etc., are empty of the conditioned and the unconditioned, of intrinsic identity and general identity, it is called ‚Äúidentity-unreality in terms of characteristic.‚Äù

original: de la chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ni chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ni chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therein, the identity-unreality of the production of things is the relative identity of things.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir de ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because that arises from other conditions,

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //üîΩrang gi ngo por med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no // rang gi ngo por med pa de ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: but not by intrinsic identity.üîΩThat which does not exist by intrinsic identity is unproduced.

original: ma skyes pa ni rang gi ngo bor med pa'o zhes bya bas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes @140a * //
analyzed: ma skyes pa ni rang gi ngo bor med pa'o zhes bya bas skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa zhes @140a * //
translated: That which is unproduced does not exist by intrinsic identity. Thus it is called ‚Äúidentity-unreality in terms of production.‚Äù

original: brjod do // don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: brjod do // don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate naturelessness?

original: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is the perfected nature of phenomena.

original: de nyid la don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called the ultimate naturelessness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is it so?

original: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni don dam pa'o //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the ultimate.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is called the naturelessness of that is called the ultimate naturelessness.

original: dper na nam mkha' ji lta bu ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' ji lta bu ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: For example, like space, the naturelessness of characteristics.

original: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bu ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgyu ma byas pa ji lta bu ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Like a magical creation, the naturelessness of production.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad kyis stong pa tsam dang / thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa de bzhin du don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' gzugs thams cad kyis stong pa tsam dang / thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa de bzhin du don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid blta ste /
translated: Just as space is the mere emptiness of all forms and is omnipresent, so the ultimate naturelessness should be seen.

original: chos bdag med pas rab tu bsgos pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos bdag med pas rab tu bsgos pa'i phyir dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is thoroughly saturated with the absence of self in phenomena and because it is omnipresent.

original: lung 'ba' zhig tsam gyis de skad smra ba ma yin gyi rigs pas kyang ji ltar skye ba med pa yin pa de ltar bsgrub par bya yis //
analyzed: lung 'ba' zhig tsam gyis de skad smra ba ma yin gyi rigs pas kyang ji ltar skye ba med pa yin pa de ltar bsgrub par bya yis //
translated: We do not say this merely on the basis of scripture, but we can also prove it through reasoning.üîΩThose of you who follow wisdom, listen attentively!

original: rna ba gtod la shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams nyon cig /'bras bu 'byung ba na rgyu'i ngo bo 'byung ngam /
analyzed: rna ba gtod la shes rab kyi rjes su 'brang ba rnams nyon cig /'bras bu 'byung ba na rgyu'i ngo bo 'byung ngam /
translated: When an effect arises, does the entity of the cause arise?

original: gzhan zhig 'byung ngam /
analyzed: gzhan zhig 'byung ngam /
translated: Or does something else arise?

original: rang dang gzhan gnyis las 'byung ngan /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gnyis las 'byung ngan /
translated: Or does it arise from both itself and something else?

original: rgyu'i bya ba la ma ltos par skye bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyu'i bya ba la ma ltos par skye bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Does it arise without depending on the activity of a cause?

original: yod pa 'am /
analyzed: yod pa 'am /
translated: Is it existent?

original: med pa 'am /
analyzed: med pa 'am /
translated: Is it nonexistent?

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo 'am /üîΩrgyu du ma las 'bras bu gcig gam /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo 'am / rgyu du ma las 'bras bu gcig gam /
translated: Is it the entity of both?

original: du ma zhig skyed pa 'am ;üîΩyang na du mas du ma skyed par byed /üîΩyang na gcig gis gcig skyed la /
analyzed: du ma zhig skyed pa 'am ; yang na du mas du ma skyed par byed / yang na gcig gis gcig skyed la /
translated: Does a single cause give rise to a single effect or to multiple effects?üîΩOr do multiple causes give rise to a single effect or to multiple effects?

original: du ma yang skyed dam /
analyzed: du ma yang skyed dam /
translated: Or does a single cause give rise to a single effect and also to multiple effects?

original: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rgyu zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Does an effect arise from a cause that has disintegrated?üîΩOr does it arise from a cause that has not disintegrated?

original: yang rgyu ma zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur na de lta bu'i phyogs de dag thams cad kyang rang gi phyogs la gcig tu chags pas bsgos pa'i rtogs pas snying po med pa la snying por brtagsüîΩpar yang dag par mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: yang rgyu ma zhig pa las 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur na de lta bu'i phyogs de dag thams cad kyang rang gi phyogs la gcig tu chags pas bsgos pa'i rtogs pas snying po med pa la snying por brtags par yang dag par mtshon par bya'o //
translated: But all of these positions are to be understood as being like the example of the barren woman‚Äôs son, which is imagined to be substantial by those who are completely attached to their own position.

original: de lta na yang 'bras bu rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur na 'bras bu yang rgyu bzhin du 'grub pa'i phyir de skyes pa ma yin te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'bras bu rgyu'i rang bzhin du gyur na 'bras bu yang rgyu bzhin du 'grub pa'i phyir de skyes pa ma yin te rgyu'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: If the effect were to exist in the nature of the cause, then the effect would be established in the same way as the cause, and therefore it would not arise, just like the nature of the cause.

original: skyes pa dang bral bar khyod rang 'dod pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gtso bo ni rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: skyes pa dang bral bar khyod rang 'dod pas 'bras bu'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i gtso bo ni rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya bas so //
translated: Since you assert that it is free of arising, the primal substance that is the nature of the effect is the cause.

original: de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin du rgyu nyid du mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa'i phyir bong bu'i rva bzhin du rgyu nyid du mi rigs so //
translated: But since it does not arise, it is illogical for it to be the cause, just like the horn of an ass.

original: rang dngos bzhin du de gzhan min //
analyzed: rang dngos bzhin du de gzhan min //
translated: It is not different from what is of its own nature.

original: rgyu ni rgyu ma yin par 'gyur //üîΩma skyes nyid phyir gang gi ci //
analyzed: rgyu ni rgyu ma yin par 'gyur // ma skyes nyid phyir gang gi ci //
translated: The cause would not be a cause.üîΩBecause it is not arisen, what would it be of?

original: rgyu ma yin pa gang rgyur 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa gang rgyur 'gyur //
translated: What is not a cause would be a cause.

original: zhes @140b bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes @140b bya ba yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: gzhan dag kyang gnyis pa la ltos pas brjod par bya ba yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang gnyis pa la ltos pas brjod par bya ba yin /
translated: Others say that the second is also described in dependence on the first.

original: gnyis pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas yin na de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na de med la /
analyzed: gnyis pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas yin na de yang rgyu yod pa'i dus na de med la /
translated: If the second is a substance that is the effect, then when the cause exists, it does not exist.

original: de yod pa'i dus na ni rgyu med pa de ci la ltos nas gzhan nyid yang dag par khas len par byed /
analyzed: de yod pa'i dus na ni rgyu med pa de ci la ltos nas gzhan nyid yang dag par khas len par byed /
translated: When it exists, the cause does not exist. In dependence on what would you correctly assert that the second is different from the first?

original: ba lang gi rva la ltos nas rta'i rva gzhan zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: ba lang gi rva la ltos nas rta'i rva gzhan zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
translated: You cannot say that the horn of a cow is different from the horn of a horse.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyus mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu skyed par byed pa yang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: The cause that is desired generates the effect that is desired, and it is different from the effect.

original: mi mthun pa'i dngos po'i don yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dngos po'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù is a thing that is not in accordance with it.

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang 'dod pa'i rgyu las ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu yang 'dod pa'i rgyu las ma yin te /
translated: The effect that is desired does not arise from the cause that is desired,

original: gzhan yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yin pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is different from it, like something that is different from it.

original: smras pa ngo bo nyid kyi dngos med na //
analyzed: smras pa ngo bo nyid kyi dngos med na //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality of non-entity,

original: gang phyir gang la gzhan zhes brjod //
analyzed: gang phyir gang la gzhan zhes brjod //
translated: then how can one say that something is other?

original: ba lang rva dang mi yi rva //
analyzed: ba lang rva dang mi yi rva //
translated: The horns of a cow and the horns of a human,

original: rta ru gzhan zhes brjod mi nus //
analyzed: rta ru gzhan zhes brjod mi nus //
translated: one cannot say that one is other than the other.

original: gang yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen //üîΩmig gi rnam shes skyed pa la //
analyzed: gang yang mig la sogs pa'i rkyen // mig gi rnam shes skyed pa la //
translated: Also, the conditions of the eye, etc.,

original: gzhan dag yang dag skyed min te //
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag skyed min te //
translated: are not the correct producers of the eye consciousness,

original: gzhan phyir re lde la sogs bzhin //
analyzed: gzhan phyir re lde la sogs bzhin //
translated: because they are other, like a wall, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i mig gi blo yi rgyu //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i mig gi blo yi rgyu //
translated: The cause of the desire for the eye consciousness

original: mig blor mi 'dod gzhan nyid bzhin //
analyzed: mig blor mi 'dod gzhan nyid bzhin //
translated: is not accepted as the eye consciousness, because it is other.

original: snga nas yod pa ma yin bzhin //
analyzed: snga nas yod pa ma yin bzhin //
translated: Just as it is not existent from the beginning,

original: ji ltar bum pa gos sogs bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa gos sogs bzhin //
translated: like a pot, cloth, etc.

original: gnyi ga las skye bar yang mi rigs te //
analyzed: gnyi ga las skye bar yang mi rigs te //
translated: It is also not correct that things are produced from both self and other,

original: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas lhan cig mnyam du gnas pa mi srid do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i ngo bo dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can yin pas lhan cig mnyam du gnas pa mi srid do //
translated: because existent and nonexistent natures are characteristics that are mutually exclusive, so it is impossible for them to coexist simultaneously.

original: de nyid kyis na brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis na brjod du med pa'i phyogs kyang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: For that very reason, the position that things are inexpressible is also not tenable.

original: brtags pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin la tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa dang / gang yang 'di ma yin zhes bya bar gyur pa ni de yin zhes bya bar 'gyur bas gcig spangs par 'gyur ba de ni tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin la tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ma spangs pa dang / gang yang 'di ma yin zhes bya bar gyur pa ni de yin zhes bya bar 'gyur bas gcig spangs par 'gyur ba de ni tha dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The nature of things that is not imagined is not abandoned, because the conception of difference and non-difference is not abandoned.  And if it were not this, it would be that, so one would be abandoned and that would be different.

original: de spangs pas ni tha mi dang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de spangs pas ni tha mi dang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And by abandoning that, it would not be non-different.

original: dngos po rnams kyi gnas pa gzhan ji lta bu zhig gnang na yod pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi gnas pa gzhan ji lta bu zhig gnang na yod pa yin /
translated: What is the other mode of existence of things that exists?

original: gang rgyu med pa las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang rgyu med pa las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not tenable that things arise without a cause.

original: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
analyzed: rgyu med gzhan la mi ltos phyir //
translated: Because it is not dependent on another, without a cause

original: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa 'am med par 'gyur //
translated: it would be either eternally existent or non-existent.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de lta bas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de lta bas na /
translated: And as it is said:

original: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: bdag las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from self, not from another,

original: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min //
analyzed: gnyi ga las min rgyu med min //
translated: not from both, not without cause,

original: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
analyzed: dngos po gang dag gang na yang //
translated: Nowhere do any things

original: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba nam yang yod ma yin //
translated: ever arise at all.

original: zhes bya ba la bdag las skye bar ni grangs can 'dod do //üîΩgzhan las skye bar ni @141a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bdag las skye bar ni grangs can 'dod do // gzhan las skye bar ni @141a * //
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas assert that things arise from self.

original: bde bar gshegs pa kha cig dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa kha cig dang bye brag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some of the Sugata‚Äôs followers and the Vai≈õe·π£ikas and so on assert that things arise from other.

original: gnyi ga las skye bar ni spyod pa pa dang / phyogs kyi gos can pa dag 'dod do //
analyzed: gnyi ga las skye bar ni spyod pa pa dang / phyogs kyi gos can pa dag 'dod do //
translated: The CarvƒÅkas and the VaiyƒÅkara·πáas assert that things arise from both.

original: rgyu med pa las skye bar rang bzhin rgyur smra ba 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las skye bar rang bzhin rgyur smra ba 'dod do //
translated: The SvabhƒÅvavƒÅdins assert that things arise without a cause.

original: da ni 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni 'bras bu rang gi ngo bo spyad par bya'o //
translated: Now, the nature of the effect will be examined.

original: yod pa skye ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa skye ba yang ma yin te /
translated: An existent does not arise,

original: yongs su rdzogs pa yang skye ba'i don dgos pa ma yin te nges par grub zin pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa yang skye ba'i don dgos pa ma yin te nges par grub zin pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: because it is pointless for a completed thing to arise again, just like the nature of something that has already been established.

original: gzhan du yod pa de yang skye bar 'gyur na ni skyes zin pa nyid yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yod pa de yang skye bar 'gyur na ni skyes zin pa nyid yang skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that which exists elsewhere arises, then that which has already arisen would arise again.

original: med pa las skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa las skye bar yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical for something to arise from what is nonexistent,

original: nges par brtags pa na bong bu'i rva bzhin du skye ba 'jug pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par brtags pa na bong bu'i rva bzhin du skye ba 'jug pa'i gnas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when examined, there is no basis for the arising of something, like the horn of an ass.

original: gzhan du na med pa thams cad gang ci yang rung ba las skye bar 'gyur bas des na rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na med pa thams cad gang ci yang rung ba las skye bar 'gyur bas des na rgyu dang 'bras bu nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, anything could arise from anything, and thus cause and effect would be indeterminate.

original: so sor nges pa'i nus pa yod bas de ltar ma yin no zhe na de ni bden na dngos po'i nus pa so sor nges pa de dag kyang 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i nus pa yod bas de ltar ma yin no zhe na de ni bden na dngos po'i nus pa so sor nges pa de dag kyang 'ga' zhig las 'ga' zhig 'byung bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you say that it is not so because there is a specific potency, that is true, but those specific potencies of things arise from something,

original: thams cad ni ma yin pas med pa dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin pas med pa dang khyad par med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and they are not different from nonexistence.

original: gang gi rgyu ni yod pa las //
analyzed: gang gi rgyu ni yod pa las //
translated: Because it arises from an existent cause,

original: 'byung phyir med las 'byung ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung phyir med las 'byung ma yin //
translated: it does not arise from nonexistence.

original: zhes pa'o // gang yang med pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu rkyen phrad cing reg pa med pas de'i phyir de dag las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pas 'bras bu gang la nus pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gang yang med pa'i 'bras bu dang rgyu rkyen phrad cing reg pa med pas de'i phyir de dag las so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu dang 'brel pa med pas 'bras bu gang la nus pa nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, because the effect and the cause and conditions do not make contact or meet, therefore, since there is no connection between them, from what effect would a specific potency arise?

original: dus dang mtshams nges pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: dus dang mtshams nges pa'i nus pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas thams cad las thams cad skye bar 'gyur ba ni bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
translated: It is difficult to refute the position that everything arises from everything, since there is no potential that is limited to a specific time or occasion.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la brjod pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur bas gnyi ga las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs gnyi ga la brjod pa'i skyon dang ldan par 'gyur bas gnyi ga las skye ba yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the faults mentioned in the context of the positions of existence and nonexistence would apply to the position of arising from both, arising from both is also illogical.

original: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ni mi srid pas gnyi ga dang gcig ni phan tshul 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig la rang bzhin gnyis yod pa ni mi srid pas gnyi ga dang gcig ni phan tshul 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Since it is impossible for a single thing to have two natures, both and one are mutually exclusive.üîΩMoreover:

original: de yang / yod las ma yin med las min //
analyzed: de yang / yod las ma yin med las min //
translated: It does not arise from what exists or what does not exist.

original: rkyen ni don la mi rigs te //
analyzed: rkyen ni don la mi rigs te //
translated: It is illogical for conditions to have an object.

original: med na'ang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
analyzed: med na'ang rkyen gyis ci zhig bya //
translated: If it does not exist, what do conditions do?

original: yod na 'du rkyen gyis ci zhig bya ;
analyzed: yod na 'du rkyen gyis ci zhig bya ;
translated: If it exists, what do conditions do?

original: / yod min med min gnyi ga yang //
analyzed: / yod min med min gnyi ga yang //
translated: It is neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: gang tshe chos ni 'byung med pa //üîΩskyed byed rgyu ni de ltan //
analyzed: gang tshe chos ni 'byung med pa // skyed byed rgyu ni de ltan //
translated: When a phenomenon does not arise,

original: ji lta bur na rigs pa yin //üîΩbsdus pa dang ni so so yi //
analyzed: ji lta bur na rigs pa yin // bsdus pa dang ni so so yi //
translated: how could a cause that produces itüîΩbe logical?üîΩThe effect does not exist in the conditions

original: rkyen la de 'bras yod ma yin //
analyzed: rkyen la de 'bras yod ma yin //
translated: either collectively or individually.

original: rkyen dag la yang de ci ltar //üîΩgang yang rkyen la de yod min //
analyzed: rkyen dag la yang de ci ltar // gang yang rkyen la de yod min //
translated: How could it be in conditions?

original: zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It does not exist in conditions.

original: gal te rgyu @141b mang pos 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed na yang /
analyzed: gal te rgyu @141b mang pos 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed na yang /
translated: If a single effect is produced by many causes,üîΩthen from causes that are of a different nature, a single effect would arise.

original: de lta ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can rgyu rnams las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig pu zhig 'byung ba na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa na rgyu'i dbye bas 'bras bu'i dbye ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ni ngo bo tha dad pa'i rang bzhin can rgyu rnams las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gcig pu zhig 'byung ba na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyus 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed pa na rgyu'i dbye bas 'bras bu'i dbye ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If co-operating causes produce a single effect, then the diversity of effects would not be due to the diversity of causes.

original: de lta bas na dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na dbye ba med par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, there would be no diversity.

original: rgyu la dbye ba yod na yang 'bras bu'i dbye ba 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu la dbye ba yod na yang 'bras bu'i dbye ba 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there is diversity of causes, the diversity of effects would not be obtained.

original: gang yang dbye ba yod pa las dbye ba 'byung bar 'gyur na ni dbye ba med pa las kyang dbye ba med par 'byung bar rigs te /
analyzed: gang yang dbye ba yod pa las dbye ba 'byung bar 'gyur na ni dbye ba med pa las kyang dbye ba med par 'byung bar rigs te /
translated: If diversity were to arise from diversity, then diversity would also arise from non-diversity,

original: med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that it does not arise without a cause.

original: 'dir ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dir ni de ltar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But that is not so here.

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sna tshogs pa rnams rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i sna tshogs pa rnams rgyu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the various things that are different and not different would arise without a cause.

original: de ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas dngos po thams cad rang dbang du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i dngos po gzhan ni gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bas dngos po thams cad rang dbang du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since there is no other thing that is not that, it follows that all things would arise without a cause.

original: yang gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad bdag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gal te rgyu'i rang bzhin tha dad pa dag las 'bras bu'i rang bzhin tha dad bdag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the nature of the effect arises from causes that are different,

original: rgyu'i bya bas ma dris pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i khyad par de lta bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i bya bas ma dris pa bsgrubs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo'i khyad par de lta bur 'gyur te /
translated: then the nature of the effect would be established without the activity of the cause.

original: ji ltar yul dang / dbang po dang / yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na yul gyis ni rnam pa skyed par mi byed kyi dbang pos kyang ma yin yid la byed bas kyang ma yin no //üîΩdbang pos ni yul so sor nges par 'dzin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yul dang / dbang po dang / yid la byed pa'i tshogs pa las rnam par shes pa 'byung ba na yul gyis ni rnam pa skyed par mi byed kyi dbang pos kyang ma yin yid la byed bas kyang ma yin no // dbang pos ni yul so sor nges par 'dzin te /
translated: For example, when consciousness arises from the aggregation of object, faculty, and attention, the object does not generate the aspect of the object, nor does the faculty, nor does attention.

original: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The faculty apprehends the object as a particular, but not the other two.

original: de bzhin du de yid la byed pas ni rtogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur gyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de yid la byed pas ni rtogs pa'i ngo bor 'gyur gyis gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is by attending to that that it becomes the nature of realization, not by anything else.

original: rgyu'i byed pa'i khyad par tha dad du zin kyang 'bras bu'i ngo bo tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa'i khyad par tha dad du zin kyang 'bras bu'i ngo bo tha dad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though the causal activity is distinct, the nature of the effect is not distinct,

original: dbye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the nature of nondifferentiation.

original: de ni gang gi tshe mi'i gzhung khas blangs nas gnas pa rnams dang 'dra bas ji ltar na 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig pu tha mi dad pa khyad par sna tshogs par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de ni gang gi tshe mi'i gzhung khas blangs nas gnas pa rnams dang 'dra bas ji ltar na 'bras bu'i ngo bo gcig pu tha mi dad pa khyad par sna tshogs par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: But when one accepts the human system, how can the nature of the effect be one and undifferentiated, yet have various distinctions?

original: sna tshogs pa dang / gcig nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa dang / gcig nyid ni phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because variety and oneness are mutually exclusive.

original: yul gyi rnam par snang ba yang rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pas yul la sogs pas ji ltar byed pa de bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i yid la byed bas kyang da dag dang 'dra bar de dang tha mi dad pa'i yid la
analyzed: yul gyi rnam par snang ba yang rnam par shes pa las tha mi dad pas yul la sogs pas ji ltar byed pa de bzhin du de las tha mi dad pa'i yid la byed bas kyang da dag dang 'dra bar de dang tha mi dad pa'i yid la
translated: And since the appearance of objects is not different from consciousness, just as the object and so on are, so too is mental attention, which is not different from it.

original: byed pa'i rtogs pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa'i rtogs pa skyed par byed do //
translated: and the effect is produced by the operation.

original: de dag kyang ma 'dres par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma 'dres par gnas pa yin no //
translated: And these are not mixed up.

original: de bas na skyon 'di yod na mi rung ngo zhes 'bras bu las tha @142a * //üîΩdad pa'i bye brag rnams su 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩde lta na yang rgyu'i bya ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas de'i 'bras bu rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skyon 'di yod na mi rung ngo zhes 'bras bu las tha @142a * // dad pa'i bye brag rnams su 'gyur ro zhe na / de lta na yang rgyu'i bya ba'i khyad par gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pas de'i 'bras bu rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if this fault is unacceptable, then the differences from the effect are not tenable.

original: 'bras bu las ni yin pa yis //
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni yin pa yis //
translated: Even so, because of the application of the difference in the operation of the cause, the effect would be without cause.

original: khyod ni khyad par 'dod par byed //
analyzed: khyod ni khyad par 'dod par byed //
translated: But you maintain the difference from the effect.

original: dbye ba de ni gzhan min te //
analyzed: dbye ba de ni gzhan min te //
translated: And that difference is not different from the effect.

original: des na dbang phyug ci zhig byed //
analyzed: des na dbang phyug ci zhig byed //
translated: So what does the Almighty do?

original: rtogs pa'i dngos las gzhan min phyir //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dngos las gzhan min phyir //
translated: Because it is not different from the entity of the effect,

original: gzugs las de ni byung ma yin //
analyzed: gzugs las de ni byung ma yin //
translated: it does not arise from the form.

original: rnam pa las gzhan ma yin na //
analyzed: rnam pa las gzhan ma yin na //
translated: If it is not different from the form,

original: yang de'i gzugs las 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yang de'i gzugs las 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: then it would arise from the form.üîΩArising and non-arising,

original: 'byung dang 'byung ba ma yin dang // skyed dang skyed pa ma yin nyid //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'byung ba ma yin dang // skyed dang skyed pa ma yin nyid //
translated: production and non-production,

original: gcig nyid las ni dus gcig tu //
analyzed: gcig nyid las ni dus gcig tu //
translated: from one thing at one time

original: 'byung ba mi 'gal khyod kyis smros //
analyzed: 'byung ba mi 'gal khyod kyis smros //
translated: You should explain how the elements are not contradictory.

original: 'on te 'di dag gzhan min nyid //
analyzed: 'on te 'di dag gzhan min nyid //
translated: But if they are not different,

original: rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rigs //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ji ltar rigs //
translated: how can they be differentiated?

original: smras pa'i skyon du thal 'gyur bas //
analyzed: smras pa'i skyon du thal 'gyur bas //
translated: The consequence of your assertion is a fault

original: glang chen gyi ni khrus dang 'dra //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: glang chen gyi ni khrus dang 'dra // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: like the bathing of an elephant.

original: gang yang rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed do zhes zer na /
analyzed: gang yang rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu gcig skyed par byed do zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that a single cause produces a single effect,

original: de ltar na ni thams cad long ba dang 'on pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na ni thams cad long ba dang 'on pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the fault of everyone being blind and deaf would ensue.

original: mig la sogs pa rang gi rigs mthun par skyed pa'i skad cig la rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rang gi rigs mthun par skyed pa'i skad cig la rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: The eye, etc., do not produce consciousness in the moment they produce their own homogeneous kind.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa skyed pas skad cig la rang gi rigs mthun pa mi skyed pas skad cig gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa med pas de long ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par shes pa skyed pas skad cig la rang gi rigs mthun pa mi skyed pas skad cig gnyis pa la mig la sogs pa med pas de long ba la sogs par thal bar 'gyur ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: When consciousness is produced, the eye, etc., do not produce their own homogeneous kind in that moment, and since the eye, etc., do not exist in the second moment, the consequence of everyone being blind, etc., is hard to avoid.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa'i rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma nyid skyed par 'dod pa de yang tshad ma thams cad kyis gnod pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa byed pa'i rgyu gcig gis 'bras bu du ma nyid skyed par 'dod pa de yang tshad ma thams cad kyis gnod pa yin te /
translated: The assertion that a single cause, such as God, produces many effects is also undermined by all valid cognitions.

original: rgyu tshogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu tshogs pa'i rim gyis 'bras bu 'byung bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect arises in stages, in accordance with the assemblage of causes.

original: gal te rgyu zhig pa'i rjes la 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyu zhig pa'i rjes la 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the effect arises after the cause has disintegrated,

original: de lta na ni rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te zhig pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra ba yin pas rgyur rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na ni rgyu med par thal bar 'gyur te zhig pa ni nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra ba yin pas rgyur rung ba ma yin no //
translated: then it follows that it would be without a cause, because that which has disintegrated is like a flower in the sky and is not suitable to be a cause.

original: ma zhig pa las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ma zhig pa las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it arises from that which has not disintegrated,

original: de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus mnyam pa nyid du 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: then it follows that the cause and effect would occur simultaneously.

original: / ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du dus gcig tu byung ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / ba lang gi rva g-yas g-yon bzhin du dus gcig tu byung ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Like the right and left horns of an ox, they would occur at the same time, and it would not be tenable for them to be cause and effect.

original: med pa'i sngon du nus med la //
analyzed: med pa'i sngon du nus med la //
translated: Before the nonexistent, the potential does not exist.

original: nus pa'i dus su 'bras bu'ang yod //
analyzed: nus pa'i dus su 'bras bu'ang yod //
translated: At the time of the potential, the effect also exists.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig tu //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig tu //
translated: It is clear that cause and effect

original: 'byung ba gsal por 'gal ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba gsal por 'gal ba yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Occurring at the same time is contradictory.

original: yang na skyes par gyur pa'i @142b rdzas la phyis 'bras bu dang dus mnyam du yang dmigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pas dus mnyam par gnas pa mi 'ga' lo zhe na /
analyzed: yang na skyes par gyur pa'i @142b rdzas la phyis 'bras bu dang dus mnyam du yang dmigs pa yin no zhes 'dod pas dus mnyam par gnas pa mi 'ga' lo zhe na /
translated: Or, if you maintain that the effect is perceived later, at the same time as the substance that has arisen, then you would have to accept that the effect endures for a second moment.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: In that case,

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.

original: zhes gsungs pas skad cig ma gnod pas shin tu yang 'bras bu skyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pas skad cig ma gnod pas shin tu yang 'bras bu skyed par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since this is stated, it is utterly unreasonable to claim that the effect is produced in a second moment, because the moment is undermined.

original: 'on te rgyu 'gag par 'gyur ba'i dus su 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na de la yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu 'gag par 'gyur ba'i dus su 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur ba la skyon 'di yod pa ma yin no zhes dam 'cha' bar byed na de la yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: But if you maintain that this error does not exist in the case of the arising of the effect at the time when the cause is ceasing, then we reply:

original: rgyu'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang yin /
analyzed: rgyu'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba gang yin /
translated: What is called the destruction of the cause?

original: ci'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci'i rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it the nature of the cause itself?

original: skad cig las mi gnas pa'i chos zhig pa yin zhes bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig las mi gnas pa'i chos zhig pa yin zhes bya ba yin nam /
translated: Or is it the property of not remaining for a second moment?

original: yang na rgyu thams cad du dmigs par ma gyur pa yin nam /
analyzed: yang na rgyu thams cad du dmigs par ma gyur pa yin nam /
translated: Or, is it that the cause is not observed in all cases?

original: de lta na ci nyes she na /
analyzed: de lta na ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni de lta na yang rgyu dang 'bras bu dus gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the nature of the cause, then it follows that cause and effect would be simultaneous.

original: 'on te rgyu zhig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu zhig pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the cause is destroyed,

original: 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang dus mnyam pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: how could it be simultaneous with the effect?

original: yang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba res 'ga' ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang dngos po med pa zhes bya ba res 'ga' ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the so-called nonexistence is sometimes,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba nyid du gyur pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid dang / rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur te rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te res 'ga' ba nyid du gyur pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid dang / rdzas nyid du thal bar 'gyur te rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: that is not right, because it follows that it would have a cause and would be a substance, like consciousness.

original: yang smras pa /üîΩre zhig nyams pa'i rgyu las kyang //
analyzed: yang smras pa / re zhig nyams pa'i rgyu las kyang //
translated: Again, it is said:

original: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs la //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bar mi rigs la //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that an effect arises from a cause that has perished.üîΩYou assert that it arises like a dream,

original: ma nyams las min rmi lam dang // 'dra bar khyod kyis 'byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: ma nyams las min rmi lam dang // 'dra bar khyod kyis 'byung bar 'dod //
translated: not from a cause that has perished.

original: ma zhig pa las 'bras skye na //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'bras skye na //
translated: If the effect arises from a cause that has not perished,

original: de tshe 'bras bu ci ste med //
analyzed: de tshe 'bras bu ci ste med //
translated: then why is the effect not always present?

original: zhig par gyur las 'bras skye na //üîΩde tshe 'ang 'bras de gang las byung //
analyzed: zhig par gyur las 'bras skye na // de tshe 'ang 'bras de gang las byung //
translated: If an effect arises from something destroyed,

original: zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: then at that time, from what does that effect arise?

original: de lta bas na dngos po'i don rnams kyi skye ba brtags pa ji lta ji ltar dpyad pa byas pa de lta de ltar rigs pa bzod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po'i don rnams kyi skye ba brtags pa ji lta ji ltar dpyad pa byas pa de lta de ltar rigs pa bzod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the arising of things is not tenable in any way.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa'i srid pa rnams snying po med pa dngos po med pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dang bcas pa'i srid pa rnams snying po med pa dngos po med pa /
translated: Therefore, since existence with a cause is essenceless and nonexistent,

original: ma skyes pa yin na skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad ji ltar rung zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / kun brtags te mi bden pa'i kun du brtags pa tsam ;
analyzed: ma skyes pa yin na skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad ji ltar rung zhe na / smras pa / kun brtags te mi bden pa'i kun du brtags pa tsam ;
translated: how could the conventions of arising and so forth be tenable?üîΩArising is merely imputed,

original: dngos po rnams brtags pa tsam du byung ba'o //üîΩde'i phyir / gsog dang smig rgyu 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: dngos po rnams brtags pa tsam du byung ba'o // de'i phyir / gsog dang smig rgyu 'dra ba yin //
translated: things arise as mere imputations.üîΩTherefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: They are like a mirage or a cloud.

original: gsog ni smig rgyu la chu yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsog ni smig rgyu la chu yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: A mirage is not water.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: All things, such as form, are like that mirage. They are not things that exist.

original: sgyu @143a * //
analyzed: sgyu @143a * //
translated: like an illusion,

original: ma ste sprul pa dang / nam mkha'i me tog gi dri dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: ma ste sprul pa dang / nam mkha'i me tog gi dri dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: like a magical creation, and like the scent of a flower in the sky.

original: glog dang sprin 'dra ste g-yo ba dang / stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: glog dang sprin 'dra ste g-yo ba dang / stong pa nyid de /
translated: Like lightning and clouds, they are transient and empty.

original: de dag ji lta ba bzhin du brtags pa na yang g-yo ba dang / glog ltar skad cig ma'i rang bzhin dang / sprin bzhin du yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ji lta ba bzhin du brtags pa na yang g-yo ba dang / glog ltar skad cig ma'i rang bzhin dang / sprin bzhin du yongs su ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir stong ba'o //
translated: When they are examined as they really are, they are transient, momentary by nature like lightning, and empty because they are not established as having an essential nature, like clouds.

original: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'i sgo nas skye ba med par bsgrubs pas chos la bdag med pa yang bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par bstan pa'i sgo nas skye ba med par bsgrubs pas chos la bdag med pa yang bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the non-existence of a self in persons is established by the proof of non-production, the non-existence of a self in phenomena is also established.

original: bdag dang sems can srog kun med /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can srog kun med /
translated: There is no self, no sentient being, no life-force.üîΩAll phenomena are without a self, without a sentient being, and without a life-force.

original: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig bdag la sogs pa rdzas su gyur pa rnams yod de /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / srog med pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta bu zhig bdag la sogs pa rdzas su gyur pa rnams yod de /
translated: What is this like? A self and so forth are substantially existent.

original: rigs pa pa dang / bye brag pa dang / spyod pa pa dang / grangs can la sogs pa'i bar dang / phyogs kyi gos can la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa khas blangs nas de bsgrubs pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba bcom par byed do //
