analyzed: rigs pa pa dang / bye brag pa dang / spyod pa pa dang / grangs can la sogs pa'i bar dang / phyogs kyi gos can la sogs pa rnams yod pa ma yin pa'i bdag la sogs pa khas blangs nas de bsgrubs pa'i phyir rigs pa smra ba bcom par byed do //
translated: The logicians, the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the NaiyƒÅyikas, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, and so on, and the VaiyƒÅkara·πáas, and so on, having accepted a nonexistent self and so on, argue to establish it.

original: de dag las rigs pa smra ba pas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag las rigs pa smra ba pas smras pa /
translated: Among them, the logicians say:

original: gang yang bdag med na las dang 'bras bu dag dang / byed pa po dang / spyod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang yang bdag med na las dang 'bras bu dag dang / byed pa po dang / spyod pa'i rnam par gzhag pa rnyed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no self, the presentation of actions and effects and of agents and experiencers would not be found.

original: byed pa po gcig nyid med na byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po gcig nyid med na byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no single agent, the consequence of the wasting of karma and the encountering of the fruits of karma not done would follow.‚Äù

original: de dag gi yod pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi yod pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma rjod par byed do //
translated: They state the valid knowledge that establishes its existence, permanence, pervasiveness, agency, and experience.

original: yod pa nyid ni re zhig legs ldan byed tshad ma 'god pa ni yod pa la sogs pa drug po'i khyad par yul du gyur ba dang / yul du gyur pa ma yin pa mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni re zhig legs ldan byed tshad ma 'god pa ni yod pa la sogs pa drug po'i khyad par yul du gyur ba dang / yul du gyur pa ma yin pa mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / nye bar 'jal ba dang /
translated: First, the existence of the self is known by the six types of valid cognition: direct perception, inference, analogy, testimony, introspection, and inference based on what is generally recognized.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.

original: sgra las byung ba dang / dran pa dang / so so shes pa dang / grub pa'i lta ba dang / grub pa'i shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / phyin ci log dang / so sor ma brtags pa dang / rmi lam gyi rmi lam ste bdag gi shes pa'i khyad par rnams kyis lus las tha dad pa'i rig par bya ba rig par 'gyur te /üîΩrang gi rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba dang / dran pa dang / so so shes pa dang / grub pa'i lta ba dang / grub pa'i shes pa dang / yid gnyis dang / phyin ci log dang / so sor ma brtags pa dang / rmi lam gyi rmi lam ste bdag gi shes pa'i khyad par rnams kyis lus las tha dad pa'i rig par bya ba rig par 'gyur te / rang gi rgyu las byung ba'i skye ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.

original: skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no //üîΩchos mi mthun pa ni zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no // chos mi mthun pa ni zhig pa'i bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.

original: de la yod pa la sogs pa khyad par drug ste /
analyzed: de la yod pa la sogs pa khyad par drug ste /
translated: The self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.üîΩThe self is known by these six types of valid cognition, which are different from the valid cognitions of the body.

original: yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / @143b rdzas dang ldan pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / spyi'i khyad par zhes bya ba las drug po de dag gi yul la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams ni yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / @143b rdzas dang ldan pa dang / 'bras bu dang / rgyu dang / spyi'i khyad par zhes bya ba las drug po de dag gi yul la rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las rnams ni yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The object of these six categories is substance, quality and action, which are the objects.

original: yul du ma gyur ba ni spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba'o //
analyzed: yul du ma gyur ba ni spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba'o //
translated: The non-object is the generality, particularity and inherence.üîΩThese two are the objects of knowledge.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga yang shes bya ste yul lo //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga yang shes bya ste yul lo //
translated: The knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.

original: gang dag mngon sum la sogs pa la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩgrub pa'i lta ba ni rtsis kyi bstan bcos dang 'brel pa ste /üîΩgrub pa rnams kyi lta ba yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gang dag mngon sum la sogs pa la de skad ces bya'o // grub pa'i lta ba ni rtsis kyi bstan bcos dang 'brel pa ste / grub pa rnams kyi lta ba yin pa 'am /
translated: The knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.

original: grub par byed pa'i lta ba yin pas grub pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grub par byed pa'i lta ba yin pas grub pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.üîΩThe knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.

original: spobs pa'i shes pa ni grub pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: spobs pa'i shes pa ni grub pa'i shes pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The knowledge of the six categories is called the knowledge of the six categories.

original: sang nga'i phu bo 'ong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sang nga'i phu bo 'ong ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The

original: yang na ni drang srong rnams kyi shes pa yin pas grub pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ni drang srong rnams kyi shes pa yin pas grub pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, since it is the cognition of the seers, it is called the cognition of the perfected beings.

original: yid gnyis ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.

original: phyin ci log ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Error is the erroneous.

original: rmi lam ni dang po'i rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi rkyen gyi rmi lam mo //
analyzed: rmi lam ni dang po'i rmi lam gyi gnas skabs kyi rkyen gyi rmi lam mo //
translated: Dream is a dream that occurs as a condition of the first dream state.

original: rmi lam gyi rmi lam ni rmi lam gyi nang du rmi lam gzhan byung ba'o ;
analyzed: rmi lam gyi rmi lam ni rmi lam gyi nang du rmi lam gzhan byung ba'o ;
translated: A dream within a dream is another dream that occurs within a dream.

original: /'di dag bud med rnams dang dmangs rigs rnams ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i phyir rnam phug pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: /'di dag bud med rnams dang dmangs rigs rnams ngo mtshar bskyed pa'i phyir rnam phug pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are taught by the Buddha in order to generate wonder in women and the lower castes.

original: snang bar byed pa bas tshad ma 'god pa ni lhas byin ngas yid ches pas rab tu sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: snang bar byed pa bas tshad ma 'god pa ni lhas byin ngas yid ches pas rab tu sbyor bar byed de /
translated: The statement of the means of valid cognition that illuminates the means of valid cognition is made by Devadatta, who is devoted to the means of valid cognition.

original: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa'i rkyen gcig pa dang / du ma'i mtshan ma can yul sna tshogs kyi rkyen de dag nyid la mtshan ma gcig dang rab tu sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gcig pu gang yin pa de ni bdag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg pa'i rkyen gcig pa dang / du ma'i mtshan ma can yul sna tshogs kyi rkyen de dag nyid la mtshan ma gcig dang rab tu sbyor ba'i mtshan ma gcig pu gang yin pa de ni bdag ces bya'o //
translated: The self is that which is the single sign of those very conditions of various objects, which have the sign of being the single or multiple conditions of form, taste, smell, and touch.

original: bdag ces bya ba'i tshig ni lus dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa bsdus pa las tha dad gyur pa'i yul te /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba'i tshig ni lus dang / dbang po dang / yid dang / blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa bsdus pa las tha dad gyur pa'i yul te /
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is the object that is different from the collection of body, sense faculty, mind, intellect, feeling, and so on.

original: sgra gcig pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra gcig pa'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of the single word, it is like a pot.

original: de bzhin du 'tsho ba dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'tsho ba dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, this living body is not without a self,

original: srog la sogs ba dang bral bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs ba dang bral bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir bum pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because it would follow that it would be devoid of life and so on, like a pot.

original: de ltar yod par smra ba'i tshad ma brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar yod par smra ba'i tshad ma brjod nas /
translated: Having stated the valid cognition of the proponents of existence in that way,

original: rnam phug pas rtag pa nyid dang khyab pa nyid kyis chad ma brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rnam phug pas rtag pa nyid dang khyab pa nyid kyis chad ma brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: in order to state the permanent and the all-pervading, he says:

original: ngas dang po ma'i mngal nas byung ma thag pa'i yul rig pa'i shes pa de nyid phyi ma'i dus tha ma'i yul rig pa'i shes pa yang de nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngas dang po ma'i mngal nas byung ma thag pa'i yul rig pa'i shes pa de nyid phyi ma'i dus tha ma'i yul rig pa'i shes pa yang de nyid yin te /
translated: The consciousness that is aware of objects immediately upon leaving the mother‚Äôs womb is the same as the consciousness that is aware of objects at the end of life.

original: rang gi shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang po'i rang gi shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rang gi shes pa yin pa'i phyir dang po'i rang gi shes pa bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it is one‚Äôs own consciousness, it is like the consciousness that one has at the beginning.

original: khyab pa'i tshad ma yang de nyid yin te /üîΩsa dang @144a * //
analyzed: khyab pa'i tshad ma yang de nyid yin te / sa dang @144a * //
translated: The valid knowledge that is the pervasion is this:

original: chu dang ; me dang / rlung dang / yid ces bya ba rnams ni rtsod pa'i yul du gyur pa yin te /üîΩring du gyur pa na gnas na yang nga yi bdag dang 'brel ba yin te /
analyzed: chu dang ; me dang / rlung dang / yid ces bya ba rnams ni rtsod pa'i yul du gyur pa yin te / ring du gyur pa na gnas na yang nga yi bdag dang 'brel ba yin te /
translated: Earth, water, fire, wind, and mind are the objects of dispute.

original: thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / shugs dang bcas pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang ; phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye ba nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid kyi la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thogs ba dang bcas pa nyid dang / shugs dang bcas pa nyid dang / gzhan nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid dang ; phan tshun yang dag par sbyor ba'i rnam par dbye ba nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid kyi la sogs pa bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even when they are far away, they are related to the self because they are obstructed, they have force, they are different, they are not different, and they are distinguished by being mutually combined, like one‚Äôs own body and so on.

original: de dag gis ni yod pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni yod pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: They prove that the self is existent, permanent, and all-pervading.

original: gal te de ltar rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid yin na yang byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / srog dang / gsod pa la sogs pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid yin na yang byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid dang / skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / srog dang / gsod pa la sogs pa 'gal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the self is permanent and all-pervading, then it is not contradictory for it to be an agent, an experiencer, to be born, to age, to die, to be a living being, to kill, and so on.

original: de ltar na yang shes pa dang / byed par 'dod pa dang / 'bad pa rnams bdag med la mnyam du tshogs pa ni byed pa po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang shes pa dang / byed par 'dod pa dang / 'bad pa rnams bdag med la mnyam du tshogs pa ni byed pa po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, the collection of consciousness, desire, and effort, which are devoid of self, is called the ‚Äúagent.‚Äù

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par rig pa mnyam du tshogs pa ni spyod pa po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yang dag par rig pa mnyam du tshogs pa ni spyod pa po zhes bya'o //
translated: The collection of the correct awareness of pleasure and pain is called the ‚Äúexperiencer.‚Äù

original: de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen ni longs spyod do //
analyzed: de yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rkyen ni longs spyod do //
translated: The condition of pleasure and pain is enjoyment.

original: de bdag nyid la mnyam du tshogs pa ni spyod pa po nyid do //
analyzed: de bdag nyid la mnyam du tshogs pa ni spyod pa po nyid do //
translated: The collection of that in the self is the experiencer.

original: skye ba ni lus dang dbang po dang blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa rigs rnam par dag pa rnams su sngon ma thob par mngon par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba ni lus dang dbang po dang blo dang tshor ba la sogs pa rigs rnam par dag pa rnams su sngon ma thob par mngon par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Birth is the manifestation of the pure class of body, faculties, mind, feelings, etc.

original: sngon gyi de dang bral ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi de dang bral ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is the separation from those previously obtained.

original: lus dang bcas pa'i bdag dang / yid sbyor ba chos dang chos ma yin pa la ltos pa ni srog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang bcas pa'i bdag dang / yid sbyor ba chos dang chos ma yin pa la ltos pa ni srog ces bya ba'o //
translated: The life force is the connection of the self with the body and the mind, which depends on virtue and nonvirtue.

original: dgos pa'i rten dang byed pa'i rgyun la gnod pa byed pa ni gsod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa'i rten dang byed pa'i rgyun la gnod pa byed pa ni gsod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Killing is the destruction of the support of the life force and the continuity of the activity.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: sems can 'chi ba med pa'i chos can la bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par myong ba'i tshor ba 'bras bu'i rten lus dang / yul nye bar dmigs pa'i byed pa po dbang po rnams kyi rgyun gcod pa la gsod pa zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: sems can 'chi ba med pa'i chos can la bde ba la sogs pa yang dag par myong ba'i tshor ba 'bras bu'i rten lus dang / yul nye bar dmigs pa'i byed pa po dbang po rnams kyi rgyun gcod pa la gsod pa zhes rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: One posits the cutting off of the body, which is the support of the result, the feeling of the experience of pleasure, etc. , and the continuity of the faculties, which are the agents of the perception of objects, in the case of a sentient being who is not subject to death.

original: de dag la lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: We must respond to this.

original: gang rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas tshig gi don drug gis yul nyid la mngon sum la sogs pa gsungs pa de ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang rtag pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bas tshig gi don drug gis yul nyid la mngon sum la sogs pa gsungs pa de ma grub pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is stated as an object of the six categories by applying the terms permanent and so on is not established.üîΩ

original: mngon sum gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las dang / spyi dang / khyad par dang / 'du ba rnams mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six categories of substance, quality, activity, universal, particular, and inherence are not established as objects of direct perception, etc., because direct perception does not apprehend substances, qualities, activities, universals, particulars, or inherence.

original: mi 'dzin pa yang mig la sogs pa ni yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa yang mig la sogs pa ni yul so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor does inference apprehend them, because the sense faculties such as the eyes are restricted to their own objects.

original: de yang mig gis gzugs nyid 'dzin gyi ro la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang mig gis gzugs nyid 'dzin gyi ro la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The eyes apprehend only form, not taste, etc.

original: @144b dbang po lhag ma rnams don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @144b dbang po lhag ma rnams don med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the remaining sense faculties would be purposeless.

original: de bzhin du rna bas sgra nyid 'dzin gyis gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna bas sgra nyid 'dzin gyis gzugs la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, the ears apprehend only sound, not form, etc.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang rang rang gi yul 'dzin par nges pa yin no //
translated: The remaining sense faculties are also restricted to their own objects.

original: gang gis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la tha dad pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gzung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs la sogs pa de dag la tha dad pa'i rdzas la sogs pa gzung bar 'gyur //
translated: By what means are those forms, etc., apprehended as distinct substances, etc.?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that it is established by inference,

original: de lta na yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de med par ji ltar de la 'jug pa spro bar byed /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de med par ji ltar de la 'jug pa spro bar byed /
translated: then since inference is preceded by perception, how can you be so eager to engage in that which is devoid of perception?

original: bdag gi shes pa'i khyad par rnams kyis lus las tha dad pa'i rig par bya ba rig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi shes pa'i khyad par rnams kyis lus las tha dad pa'i rig par bya ba rig par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni grub pa sgrub pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe specific features of my consciousness are aware of the object that is different from the body‚Äù is an argument that proves what has already been established.

original: khyod kyi yul las tha dad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi yul las tha dad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnal 'byor pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the omniscience of the Buddha and the awareness of the yogi free from attachment are aware of all objects that are different from themselves.

original: gang yang skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes chos mthun pa'i dper bstan pa de yang bsgrub byas stong pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang skyes bu gzhan gyi shes pa bzhin no zhes chos mthun pa'i dper bstan pa de yang bsgrub byas stong pa yin te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is like the consciousness of another person‚Äù that was given as a similar example is also devoid of the probandum.

original: rnam par shes pa thams cad rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid do ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa thams cad rang rig pa'i bdag nyid can nyid do ;
translated: This is because all consciousnesses have the nature of being reflexive awareness.

original: / shes pa gzhan gyis rig par 'dod pa'i phyogs ltar na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bsgrub pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / shes pa gzhan gyis rig par 'dod pa'i phyogs ltar na thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba bsgrub pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you maintain that it is known by another cognition, then the fault of infinite regress would ensue.

original: gang dag ma lus pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag ma lus pa 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: If you maintain that all of these are just consciousness,

original: rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir de las gzhan dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lta ba ltar na ni gsal po nyid du grub pa sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir de las gzhan dag yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i lta ba ltar na ni gsal po nyid du grub pa sgrub pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and that there is nothing else apart from that, because of the ultimate of self-awareness, then the fault of establishing what is already established would ensue.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang gtan tshigs kyi gzhan dbang du gyur ba'i skye ba dang ldan pa la grub pa sgrub pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang gtan tshigs kyi gzhan dbang du gyur ba'i skye ba dang ldan pa la grub pa sgrub pa'i skyon brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in the case of others, the fault of establishing what is already established should be stated in regard to the dependent origination of the one who is under the power of the reason.

original: gang yang snang bar byed pas smras pa'i lhas byin gzugs la sogs pa dang so sor sbyor ba'i shes pas bdag gis mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang yang snang bar byed pas smras pa'i lhas byin gzugs la sogs pa dang so sor sbyor ba'i shes pas bdag gis mthong ngo //
translated: Also, Devadatta, who is illuminated, says, ‚ÄúI see form, etc., by the cognition that is applied to each.‚Äù

original: bdag gis thos so zhes bya bas byed pa po gcig nyid go bar byed pa yin pas gang dang so sor sbyor ba de nyid bdag yin no zhes zer ba de ni rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gis thos so zhes bya bas byed pa po gcig nyid go bar byed pa yin pas gang dang so sor sbyor ba de nyid bdag yin no zhes zer ba de ni rig pa ma yin te /
translated: The statement I have heard indicates that the self is the single agent of understanding. Therefore, the self is the one that is connected to each of the aggregates.

original: rtag pa dang / thams cad du rtog pa dang / gcig pu nyid de lta bu dang so sor sbyor ba ma mthong ba'i phyir mi srid pa nyid do ;
analyzed: rtag pa dang / thams cad du rtog pa dang / gcig pu nyid de lta bu dang so sor sbyor ba ma mthong ba'i phyir mi srid pa nyid do ;
translated: This is not knowledge, because it is impossible to connect the self to such attributes as permanence, omnipresence, singularity, and so on.

original: / rtag pa dang / thams cad du rtog pa dang / byed pa po dang / spyod pa po dang / rjes su sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rtag pa dang / thams cad du rtog pa dang / byed pa po dang / spyod pa po dang / rjes su sbyor ba nyid la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba dang med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the self is not seen to be invariably and necessarily related to such attributes as permanence, omnipresence, agency, experience, and so on,

original: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du brtags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du brtags pa tsam mo //
translated: it is merely imagined, like the son of a barren woman.

original: de lta na gang dang so sor sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: de lta na gang dang so sor sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, then what is it that is connected to each of the aggregates?

original: sems skad cig ma nyid la thog @145a * //
analyzed: sems skad cig ma nyid la thog @145a * //
translated: The self is connected to each of the aggregates.

original: ma med pa'i dus kyi ma rig pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas so sor sbyar ba'i rnam par 'khrul pas dngos po dang ma reg pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid dang so sor mi sbyor bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ma med pa'i dus kyi ma rig pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas so sor sbyar ba'i rnam par 'khrul pas dngos po dang ma reg pa ni dngos po'i de kho na nyid dang so sor mi sbyor bar byed ce na /
translated: But when there is no mother, the superimposition of identity by ignorance and the error of individual application do not touch reality, and one does not apply oneself to the reality of things.

original: de lta bas na bdag yod par rtog pa ni shin tu sdig pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag yod par rtog pa ni shin tu sdig pa can yin no //
translated: Therefore, the conception of the existence of a self is extremely sinful.

original: tshig gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba yang bdag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: tshig gcig nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i bsgrub par bya ba yang bdag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: The probandum, ‚Äúby a single word,‚Äù also establishes the opposite of the self.

original: tshig gi brjod bya ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: tshig gi brjod bya ni spyi yin la /
translated: The content of a word is a universal.

original: bdag ni spyi ma yin pas so //
analyzed: bdag ni spyi ma yin pas so //
translated: The self is not a universal.

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir tshig gi yul ni med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir tshig gi yul ni med pa'o //
translated: The content of a word is a non-existent, because it has the object of the exclusion of another.

original: des ni bdag ni ma yin no zhes bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni bdag ni ma yin no zhes bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the self is not that.

original: gang yang srog dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang srog dang bcas pa'i lus 'di ni bdag med pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, this living body is not without a self.

original: srog la sogs pa med pa ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pa ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir shin tu yang 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: Because it would follow that life and so on would not exist, it is utterly unrelated.

original: srog la sogs pa dang bdag la 'brel pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang bdag la 'brel pa grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the relation of life and so on to the self is not established.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te tha dad kyi dbye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde las byung ba'i 'brel pa yang ma yin te rtag pa ni rim dang cig car /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te tha dad kyi dbye ba khas blangs pa'i phyir ro // de las byung ba'i 'brel pa yang ma yin te rtag pa ni rim dang cig car /
translated: It is not a relation of identity, because the distinction of difference is accepted.

original: don bya ba byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Nor is it a relation of origination, because it is contradictory for the permanent to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de la re zhig rim gyis skyes pa'ang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rim gyis skyes pa'ang mi rigs te /
translated: In this regard, first, it is not reasonable that it arises gradually,

original: skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dus gcig tu gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa dang / skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gnyis dus gcig tu gcig la 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradictory for the nature of the producer and the nonproducer to be simultaneous in one thing.

original: lhan cig byed pa stong gis kyang 'gyur ba med pa la lhag par phan gdags par nus pa mi srid pas lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas rtags la ci zhig dgos /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa stong gis kyang 'gyur ba med pa la lhag par phan gdags par nus pa mi srid pas lhan cig byed pa la ltos pas rtags la ci zhig dgos /
translated: And it is impossible for a thousand coemergent factors to be able to benefit that which is immutable, so what need is there for a sign that depends on coemergent factors?

original: cig car skyed par byed pa yin na yang skad cig gcig la thams cad skyed par byed do zhes bya bas skad cig gnyis pa la bya ba med pas dbugs dbyung 'jug rgyun chad pa'i 'chi ba'am /
analyzed: cig car skyed par byed pa yin na yang skad cig gcig la thams cad skyed par byed do zhes bya bas skad cig gnyis pa la bya ba med pas dbugs dbyung 'jug rgyun chad pa'i 'chi ba'am /
translated: If it is a simultaneous producer, then it produces everything in a single moment, and since there is no activity in the second moment, there would be the death of the cessation of the exhalation and inhalation of breath.

original: yang na dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na dngos po thams cad mi dmigs pa'i grol ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, there would be the attainment of liberation, the nonapprehension of all things.

original: yang med na mi 'byung ba'o zhes rtog na yang rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang med na mi 'byung ba'o zhes rtog na yang rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: If you imagine that it is a non-existent non-producer, that is not tenable.

original: gang yang rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis nye bar bkod pa de dag kyang shing tu 'brel pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang yang rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs gnyis nye bar bkod pa de dag kyang shing tu 'brel pa med pa yin te /
translated: Also, the two reasons that you have adduced to prove its permanence and its ubiquity are not at all related to the probandum.

original: chos can med pa nyid de bdag ni chos can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can med pa nyid de bdag ni chos can du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subject does not exist, because the self is not established as a subject.

original: 'on te lus phyogs su byas nas dang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis dus phyi mar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de yang rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te lus phyogs su byas nas dang po'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa de nyid kyis dus phyi mar byung ba'i rnam par shes pa yang skyed par byed do zhes zer ba de yang rig pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you say that the first consciousness is produced by the body, then that very first consciousness produces the later consciousnesses.

original: de nyid las 'di yang skyes so zhes bya ba la tshad ma @145b yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid las 'di yang skyes so zhes bya ba la tshad ma @145b yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is not reasonable, because there is no valid cognition to establish that ‚Äúthis is produced from that.‚Äù

original: de la re zhig mngon sum ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la re zhig mngon sum ni sngon dang phyi ma'i dngos po la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: First, direct perception does not engage past and future things.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba nyid yin pas de med na de 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba nyid yin pas de med na de 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: And inference is preceded by direct perception, so if that does not exist, it does not engage.

original: rjes su dpag pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa nyid sngon du 'gro ba yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if inference is preceded by inference, there would be an infinite regress.

original: sbyor ba gnyis pa gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe nyid bdag dang 'brel par ma grub pa yin na thams cad du 'gro ba dang khyab pa nyid lta ga la yin /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnyis pa gzugs dang ldan pa'i phyir bdag gi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe nyid bdag dang 'brel par ma grub pa yin na thams cad du 'gro ba dang khyab pa nyid lta ga la yin /
translated: And if you say that the second syllogism is like the example, ‚ÄúBecause it possesses form, like my body,‚Äù then the example itself is not established as related to the self, so how could it be all-pervading and omnipresent?

original: byis pa'i tshig bzhin 'brel ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i tshig bzhin 'brel ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would be meaningless, like the words of a child.

original: byis pas smras pa sun 'don pa'i phyir rgal ba'i lan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: byis pas smras pa sun 'don pa'i phyir rgal ba'i lan brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to refute the objection of the child, the reply to the objection is stated:

original: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa yang med pa'i phyir de la sems can yang med de ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa de la 'gag pa yang med pa'i phyir de la sems can yang med de ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: Because that which does not arise also does not cease, therefore there are no sentient beings there, like the horns of an ass.

original: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i bdag la ni skye ba yang med /
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dod pa'i bdag la ni skye ba yang med /
translated: The self that is accepted by the other does not arise and does not cease.

original: 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no //üîΩde bzhin du gang rim gyis sam /
analyzed: 'gag pa yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no // de bzhin du gang rim gyis sam /
translated: This is the non-apprehension of the pervasion.

original: cig car yang rung /
analyzed: cig car yang rung /
translated: Similarly, that which performs an action gradually orüîΩinstantaneously

original: don bya ba byed pa de ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa de ni rtag pa yang ma yin /
translated: is not permanent,

original: khyab pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: khyab pa yang ma yin /
translated: not pervasive,

original: med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: and not nonexistent.

original: mar me dang / sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩrim gyis sam /
analyzed: mar me dang / sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa bzhin no // rim gyis sam /
translated: It is like a lamp, a seed, a sprout, a creeper, and so on.üîΩGradually or

original: cig car yang rung /
analyzed: cig car yang rung /
translated: instantaneously,

original: don bya ba byed pa las log pa de ni rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid med pa ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir med pa ma yin pa dang 'gal ba'i yod pa nye bar dmigs pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no //üîΩyang na gang rim gyis sam /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa las log pa de ni rtag pa nyid dang / khyab pa nyid med pa ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir med pa ma yin pa dang 'gal ba'i yod pa nye bar dmigs pas khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no // yang na gang rim gyis sam /
translated: The opposite of the performance of function is permanence, and the opposite of the non-existence of the non-existence of the pervader is the observation of the existence that is incompatible with non-existence.üîΩOr, that which does not perform a function either gradually or

original: cig car yang rung bas don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car yang rung bas don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: instantaneously does not exist,

original: ri bong gi rva dang / rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩrim gyis kyang rung /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang / rus sbal gyi spu la sogs pa bzhin no // rim gyis kyang rung /
translated: like the horn of an ass or the hair of a tortoise.üîΩThe performance of a function either gradually or

original: cig car yang rung bas don bya ba byed pa bdag rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: cig car yang rung bas don bya ba byed pa bdag rtag pa la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: instantaneously does not exist for a permanent self.

original: rim gyis sam /
analyzed: rim gyis sam /
translated: The performance of a function characterized by gradual or

original: cig car gyi mtshan nyid kyis don bya ba byed pa rtag pa las log pas khyab par bya ba sems can yang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no /
analyzed: cig car gyi mtshan nyid kyis don bya ba byed pa rtag pa las log pas khyab par bya ba sems can yang ldog pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no /
translated: instantaneous is incompatible with permanence. The pervaded, sentient beings, are also incompatible. This is the non-observation of the pervader.

original: yang na gang yang rdzas nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / skye ba dang / ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag thams cad bdag med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na gang yang rdzas nyid dang / yod pa nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / skye ba dang / ldan pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa de dag thams cad bdag med pa'i phyir phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Or else, all those things that are endowed with substance, existence, agency, production, possession, and so on, are devoid of self, like external pots and so on.

original: rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i nang gi bdag nyid can gyi srog dang bcas pa'i @146a * //
analyzed: rdzas nyid la sogs pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i nang gi bdag nyid can gyi srog dang bcas pa'i @146a * //
translated: The inner self, which is endowed with the qualities of substance and so on, is the life-force,

original: lus dang / yid dang / blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: lus dang / yid dang / blo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: the body, the mind, the intellect, pleasure, pain, and so on. This is a natural inference.

original: rim pa 'di nyid kyis spyod pa la sogs pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pas bdag la sogs pa khas len pa'i rgol ba rnams kyang sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid kyis spyod pa la sogs pa la yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas gnod pas bdag la sogs pa khas len pa'i rgol ba rnams kyang sun phyung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this very process, the proponents who accept the self and so on are also refuted, because their positions are undermined by direct perception and other valid means of knowledge with regard to action and so on.

original: de lta na yang chung zad tsam bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang chung zad tsam bstan par bya'o //
translated: Even so, I will teach just a little.

original: de la spyod pa pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyis sems pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bor rjes su song ba bdag gi de kho na nyid khas len par byed de gcig tu med par gyur na ni byas pa chud zos pa dang /üîΩma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la spyod pa pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyis sems pa bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i ngo bor rjes su song ba bdag gi de kho na nyid khas len par byed de gcig tu med par gyur na ni byas pa chud zos pa dang / ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The proponents of activity assert that the self is the reality of the mind that is the nature of pleasure, pain, and so on, which is the nature of that which goes and comes to rest.üîΩIf it were not unitary, then karma would perish and one would encounter the results of karma not committed.

original: gcig tu skyes bu rtag par gyur na ni byed pa po'i rang gi ngo bo ma btang bas spyod pa po nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu skyes bu rtag par gyur na ni byed pa po'i rang gi ngo bo ma btang bas spyod pa po nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were permanent, then the person would not relinquish its nature as an agent, and the person would be impaired.

original: de yang gzhon nu ma len gyis /
analyzed: de yang gzhon nu ma len gyis /
translated: This is also stated by Kumarila:

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga spangs nas ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga spangs nas ni //
translated: Therefore, abandoning both,

original: ldog dang rjes 'gro'i bdag nyid kyi //
analyzed: ldog dang rjes 'gro'i bdag nyid kyi //
translated: the self that is the nature of that which goes and comes to rest

original: skyes bu khas blang bya ba ste //
analyzed: skyes bu khas blang bya ba ste //
translated: should be asserted as the person.

original: bskyil la sogs pa'i sprul dang 'dra //üîΩzhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: bskyil la sogs pa'i sprul dang 'dra // zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: It is like the emanation of a ball of clay and so on.

original: byed pa po dang / spyod pa po nyid ni bdag la brten pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byed pa po dang / spyod pa po nyid ni bdag la brten pa yin gyi /
translated: The agent and the experiencer are based on the self,

original: gnas skabs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not based on the state.

original: de nyid ni byed pa po dang / spyod pa po nyid du shes pa stobs kyis rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid ni byed pa po dang / spyod pa po nyid du shes pa stobs kyis rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: It is the agent and the experiencer.

original: de ni bdag nyid mngon sum du byas pa na rtag pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam pa bdag gi yul yin pa'i phyir bdag shes pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid mngon sum du byas pa na rtag pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i rnam pa bdag gi yul yin pa'i phyir bdag shes pa dang ldan no //
translated: When it is perceived, it is the self, because it is the object of the self, which is permanent and pervades the past, present, and future.

original: bdag gis shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gis shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the self that knows, the self that will know, and the self that now knows.

original: bdag gis shes so zhes yul gcig gnyis su nges par byed do zhe na ;
analyzed: bdag gis shes so zhes yul gcig gnyis su nges par byed do zhe na ;
translated: It is the self that determines the object in the three times.

original: de lta bu ni shin tu tshad ma la mkhas pa'i bram ze rnams la srid pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni shin tu tshad ma la mkhas pa'i bram ze rnams la srid pa yin no //
translated: This is the doctrine of the Brahmins who are experts in logic.

original: de yang mngon sum ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dus la khyab pa'i dngos por rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum ni gnyis ka'i bdag nyid can 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa'i dus la khyab pa'i dngos por rab tu shes pa'o zhes bya bas ni 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: They say that perception is the self, which is the subject of the cognition, and that it is the object of the cognition, which is the object.

original: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa zhes bya ba ni nyams pa'o //
translated: The past is that which has ceased.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni da dung ma byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni da dung ma byung ba'o //
translated: The future is that which has not yet occurred.

original: de dag mngon sum gyis rab tu rig go zhes smras pas yod pa dang rab tu sbyor ba'i mdo'i rtsa bas gnod par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de dag mngon sum gyis rab tu rig go zhes smras pas yod pa dang rab tu sbyor ba'i mdo'i rtsa bas gnod par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Since he says that they are directly perceived, he contradicts the root text of the sutra that is applied to existence:

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma mthong bas //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma mthong bas //
translated: The future is not seen.

original: mngon sum gyur pa ci yang med //
analyzed: mngon sum gyur pa ci yang med //
translated: There is nothing that is directly perceived.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @146b la sogs pa'i yul la sbyor bas 'jug pa la rtsod pa'i skyes bus byas pa ma yin pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @146b la sogs pa'i yul la sbyor bas 'jug pa la rtsod pa'i skyes bus byas pa ma yin pas bsgrubs pa'i 'bad pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur te /
translated: Since he applies this to the object of the past and future, etc., he is not a disputant who is a human being. Therefore, his effort to prove is fruitless.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ni da ltar byung ba'i yul tsam 'dzin par nges par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ni da ltar byung ba'i yul tsam 'dzin par nges par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that direct perception definitely apprehends only the object of the present.

original: de ltar na sngon dang phyi ma dang bral ba'i da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo tsam gyis bdag rang rig par bya bar shes par bya'o zhes bya bas rnam par shes pa nyid dang / sngon dang phyi ma'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba skad cig ma rang rig par bya ba'i bdag nyid khas blangs pa ni bdag ces ming gi rnam pa gzhan brtags par zad do //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon dang phyi ma dang bral ba'i da ltar byung ba'i ngo bo tsam gyis bdag rang rig par bya bar shes par bya'o zhes bya bas rnam par shes pa nyid dang / sngon dang phyi ma'i rjes su 'gro ba dang bral ba skad cig ma rang rig par bya ba'i bdag nyid khas blangs pa ni bdag ces ming gi rnam pa gzhan brtags par zad do //
translated: Thus, the assertion that consciousness is the self that is reflexive awareness and is devoid of prior and subsequent moments is nothing but the imputation of a different name to the self.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pas bdag rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed do zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pas bdag rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed do zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If you say that the permanent self is established by inference,

original: de lta na yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta na yang mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba 'am /
translated: then even in that case, either direct perception would precede it or inference would precede it.

original: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba na rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba na rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba yin na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If inference precedes it, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: mngon sum la 'jug pa sngon du ma song bar yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa la 'jug par nus par 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum la 'jug pa sngon du ma song bar yang ji ltar rjes su dpag pa la 'jug par nus par 'gyur /
translated: And how could one engage in inference without first engaging in direct perception?

original: gzhan yang bdag tu nga rgyal ba'i stobs kyis bdag sgrub par byed na yang lus la dmigs nas bdag rid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag tu nga rgyal ba'i stobs kyis bdag sgrub par byed na yang lus la dmigs nas bdag rid do //
translated: Moreover, if you are establishing a self by the power of the pride of self, then, observing the body, you should say, ‚ÄúI am emaciated.‚Äù

original: tsho'o // dmar ser ro zhes spyi'i dbang du byas nas smra yi /
analyzed: tsho'o // dmar ser ro zhes spyi'i dbang du byas nas smra yi /
translated: Moreover, if the power of the pride of self were to establish the self, then one would speak in terms of the general, as in ‚ÄúI am thin,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am pale,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am dark,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am sallow,‚Äù

original: bdag ni bdag gi spyi'i dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag gi spyi'i dbang du byas nas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in terms of the general of the self.

original: des na 'di skad smras par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad smras par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, this is what is said:

original: mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can lus tsam la dmigs nas bdag ces bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i bdag nyid can lus tsam la dmigs nas bdag ces bya bar rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: One understands the self in terms of the body alone, which has eyes, etc.

original: de la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de la 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction in that.

original: ming tsam du byas nas byed pa po nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa skad cig ma'i khyad par can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo las gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: ming tsam du byas nas byed pa po nyid la sogs pa yang rnam par shes pa skad cig ma'i khyad par can gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu'i ngo bo las gzhan ni med do //
translated: Having made it a mere name, the agent, etc. are also not different from the nature of the cause and effect of the special momentary consciousness.

original: byas pa chung zos pa dang ; ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa de yang rtsod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: byas pa chung zos pa dang ; ma byas pa dang phrad par 'gyur ro zhes rtsod pa de yang rtsod pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The dispute that ‚Äúone would experience the results of actions not done and not experience the results of actions done‚Äù is also not a dispute.

original: de lta bas na spyod pa pas brtags pa'i bdag ni btags pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o //üîΩphyogs kyi gos can ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i ngo bo shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nye bar dmigs so zhes smras pa de ltar na yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas phye ba yod kyang gang yang gnas skabs can ni gnas skabs thams cad du rtogs pa'i
analyzed: de lta bas na spyod pa pas brtags pa'i bdag ni btags pa 'ba' zhig kho na'o // phyogs kyi gos can ba ni mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug pa dang / ldog pa'i ngo bo shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis bdag nye bar dmigs so zhes smras pa de ltar na yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbye bas phye ba yod kyang gang yang gnas skabs can ni gnas skabs thams cad du rtogs pa'i
translated: Therefore, the self that is imagined by the theorist is only an imputation.

original: ngo bor nye bar dmigs te /
analyzed: ngo bor nye bar dmigs te /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ika says that the self is perceived by direct perception, in the form of the cognition of engagement and withdrawal. But even so, although it is differentiated by the differentiation of the states of pleasure, pain, etc., the possessor of the states is perceived in all states as having the nature of being perceived.

original: de yang rdzas su yod pa'o //üîΩrnam grangs kyang rim gyis goms pa las bde ba dang / @147a * //
analyzed: de yang rdzas su yod pa'o // rnam grangs kyang rim gyis goms pa las bde ba dang / @147a * //
translated: And that is substantially real.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dbye ba yin la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs dbye ba yin la /
translated: The enumeration is also by the differentiation of the states of pleasure and pain, etc., through gradual practice.

original: de yang mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyis grub pa yin no //
translated: And that is established by direct perception.

original: de lta na yang yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dbye ba med pa chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba med do //
analyzed: de lta na yang yul dang dus dang ngo bo nyid dbye ba med pa chos dang chos can gyi dbye ba med do //
translated: But even so, there is no differentiation of the object, time, and nature, and no differentiation of the property-possessor and the property.

original: grangs dang / ming dang / mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas ni dbye ba yod de /
analyzed: grangs dang / ming dang / mtshan nyid dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas ni dbye ba yod de /
translated: There is a difference in number, name, definition, and result.üîΩFor example, like a pot, form, etc.üîΩThe pot and its form, etc. are different in place, etc.

original: dper na bum pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas bum pa dang / de'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / yul la sogs pa dbye ba yod do //üîΩgang yang yul bum pa'i yul dang / dus dang / ngo bo nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya bas bum pa dang / de'i gzugs la sogs pa dang / yul la sogs pa dbye ba yod do // gang yang yul bum pa'i yul dang / dus dang / ngo bo nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The place of the pot is different from the place of form, etc.üîΩThe time of the pot is different from the time of form, etc.

original: grangs la sogs pas ni bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dbye ba yod do //
analyzed: grangs la sogs pas ni bum pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la dbye ba yod do //
translated: The essence of the pot is different from the essence of form, etc.

original: de yang bum pa ni gcig go //
analyzed: de yang bum pa ni gcig go //
translated: The pot is one.üîΩForm, etc. are many.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni mang po'i zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni mang po'i zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the difference in number.üîΩBracelet, earring, anklet, bowl, etc.

original: gdu bu dang / rna cha dang / rkang gdub dang / kham phor zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbye ba'o //üîΩrjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni rdzas so //
analyzed: gdu bu dang / rna cha dang / rkang gdub dang / kham phor zhes bya ba ni ming gi dbye ba'o // rjes su 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid ni rdzas so //
translated: This is the difference in name.üîΩThe definition of the pot is that which holds water, etc.üîΩThe definition of form, etc. is that which is visible, etc.

original: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the difference in definition.

original: bum pa'i dgos pa ni chu len pa'i dgos pa /
analyzed: bum pa'i dgos pa ni chu len pa'i dgos pa /
translated: The purpose of a pot is to draw water.üîΩThe purpose of form and so on is to generate the effect that accords with it.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i ni rang dang rjes su mthun par bsgyur ba'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dbye ba'o zhes zer na de la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i ni rang dang rjes su mthun par bsgyur ba'i 'bras bu'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i dbye ba'o zhes zer na de la brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the classification of effect.

original: gang yang rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid rdzas kyi rnam grangs dang sbyor bar byed pa na ci sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo dang sbyor bar byed dam /
analyzed: gang yang rtogs pa'i ngo bo'i bdag nyid rdzas kyi rnam grangs dang sbyor bar byed pa na ci sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo dang sbyor bar byed dam /
translated: If one who possesses the nature of realization is connected to a substance that is a synonym, is it connected to its former nature?

original: yang na sngar gyi ngo bo yongs su gtong bar byed ces rnam par rtog par byed na /
analyzed: yang na sngar gyi ngo bo yongs su gtong bar byed ces rnam par rtog par byed na /
translated: Or does it relinquish its former nature?

original: de la rtog pa dang po ltar sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pas rtogs pa de yongs su gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ji lta bu yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas skabs yongs su btang nas gzhan zhig
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang po ltar sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pas rtogs pa de yongs su gyur pa ma yin zhes bya ba ji lta bu yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas skabs yongs su btang nas gzhan zhig
translated: If one imagines this, then according to the first conception, since there is no difference between the former and later states, how could that realization be a transformation?

original: yongs su gzung ba la brjod do //
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba la brjod do //
translated: A transformation is said to be the relinquishment of a former state and the acquisition of another.

original: de la mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med pas tshig tsam gyis yongs su gyur par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin med pas tshig tsam gyis yongs su gyur par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since it does not have an unchanging nature, it is not reasonable to say that it is transformed merely by words.

original: sbyor ba ni gang la sngon dang / phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pa de ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang la sngon dang / phyi ma'i gnas skabs su khyad par med pa de ni yongs su 'gyur ba ma yin te nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: The application of the reason is as follows: That which does not differ in terms of earlier and later states is not transformed, like space.

original: rtogs pa la yang sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa la yang sngon dang phyi ma'i gnas skabs khyad par med pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: And the non-observation of the pervasion is as follows: It is not the case that the earlier and later states of the object of knowledge differ.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na yang sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi ngo bor skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa gnyis pa ltar na yang sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su btang nas gzhan gyi ngo bor skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If, on the other hand, it is as the second option suggests, then it would be the case that the object of knowledge would give up its previous nature and arise in another form.

original: thag pa las ras yug byung ba bzhin zhes bya bas ji ltar de yongs su gyur pa yin /
analyzed: thag pa las ras yug byung ba bzhin zhes bya bas ji ltar de yongs su gyur pa yin /
translated: But how could it be transformed, just like cloth that is produced from thread?

original: sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bor gnas pa ma yin par gang gyur pa de ni yongs su gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang gi tshe mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bor gnas pa ma yin par gang gyur pa de ni yongs su gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The application of the reason is as follows: That which does not remain as an unchanging entity is not transformed, like a dream.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa yod bzhin du ras yug byung @147b bar gyur pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa yod bzhin du ras yug byung @147b bar gyur pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a cloth arising from an existing pot of unchanging nature.

original: sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor bas ngo bo gzhan zhig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa'i 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sngar gyi rang gi ngo bo yongs su bor bas ngo bo gzhan zhig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa'i 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Since it abandons its previous nature, it is called ‚Äúhaving a different nature.‚Äù This is the observation of an incompatible pervasion.

original: gang yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pas gcig tu rdzas kyi rnam grangs la dbye ba yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gang yang gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pas gcig tu rdzas kyi rnam grangs la dbye ba yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Also, since it has the nature of both, it is not a classification of substance as one.

original: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not a classification as not one.

original: de lta na yang tha dad pa dang ; tha dad pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga yang rung ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad pa dang ; tha dad pa ma yin pa dang gnyi ga yang rung ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Even so, it is not the case that the previously mentioned errors of being different or not different or both are present.

original: de lta na yang mdzes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang mdzes pa ma yin te /
translated: Even so, it is not beautiful.

original: gal te rdzas kyi rnam grangs kyi dbye ba med par khas len par byed na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas kyi rnam grangs kyi dbye ba med par khas len par byed na /
translated: If one asserts that it is not a classification of substance,

original: de ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir de las zlog pa'i dbye ba yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir de las zlog pa'i dbye ba yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then since it is not classified by any nature, how could it have a classification that is the opposite of that?

original: gcig la dus gcig tu dgag pa dang sgrub pa phan tshun 'gal ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la dus gcig tu dgag pa dang sgrub pa phan tshun 'gal ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for a single thing to be both affirmed and denied at the same time.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dbye ba med pa der de dang 'gal ba'i dbye ba dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dbye ba med pa der de dang 'gal ba'i dbye ba dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The syllogism is: ‚ÄúWhere there is no division, there is no perception of a division that is incompatible with it,

original: ji ltar de'i rnam grangs kyi rdzas rnams la thun mong ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo so sor nges pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo de'i rang bzhin ni dbye ba med la /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i rnam grangs kyi rdzas rnams la thun mong ma yin pa'i rang gi ngo bo so sor nges pa bdag nyid kyi ngo bo de'i rang bzhin ni dbye ba med la /
translated: just as in the case of the substances that are the referents of the synonyms of ‚Äòself,‚Äô which have an individual nature that is not shared by others and is ascertained as their own nature, and which have a nature that is not divided.

original: dbye ba med pa'i rdzas kyi rnam grangs gang yin pa de ni nges par gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i rdzas kyi rnam grangs gang yin pa de ni nges par gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: The substances that are the referents of the synonyms of ‚Äòself‚Äô are ascertained as being undifferentiated.‚Äù This is the perception of something contradictory.

original: yang na ldog pa dang ldan pa rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa dang ldan pa rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, the syllogism is: ‚ÄúThe thing that is not different from the nature of that which possesses a division is not different from that which possesses a division,

original: ji ltar rnam grangs kyi rang gi ngo bo las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam grangs kyi rang gi ngo bo las ldog pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin las tha mi dad pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs so //
translated: just as the nature of the thing that is not different from the nature of the referent of the synonyms of ‚Äòself‚Äô is not different from that which possesses a division.‚Äù This is an argument by the nature of things.

original: yang na gang rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na gang rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi gzugs las tha mi dad pa'i phyir de ni rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
translated: Or else, because it is not different from form, which is the nature of that which is to be inferred, it is the nature of that which is to be inferred.

original: rdzas kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of substance.

original: rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba'i bdag nyid can gyi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The nature of pleasure, pain, etc., which is not different from the nature of that which is to be inferred, is the nature of substance. This is an inference based on nature.

original: gzhan du chos 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod par gyur na yang dbye ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du chos 'gal ba'i gnod pa yod par gyur na yang dbye ba med pa yin te /
translated: Even if there were an inconsistency with a contradictory property, there would be no difference.

original: dbye ba med pa'i phyir dbye ba yang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dbye ba med pa'i phyir dbye ba yang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because there is no difference, there would also be no difference.

original: dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa'i tha snyad du rgyun chad pas 'gro ba rnams kyang 'jug pa dang ldog pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: dbye ba dang dbye ba med pa'i tha snyad du rgyun chad pas 'gro ba rnams kyang 'jug pa dang ldog pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni ldog na gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yin no //
translated: Since the conventions of difference and non-difference would be interrupted, there would be no engagement and disengagement of beings. This is the valid cognition that is contradictory when there is disengagement.

original: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa /
analyzed: de lta bas na rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo dang bral ba sngon dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin gyis dben pa /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the self is devoid of the essence of going and coming, and is devoid of the nature of prior and subsequent .

original: da ltar byung ba tsam gyi dngos po nye bar 'dzin pa /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba tsam gyi dngos po nye bar 'dzin pa /
translated: It is a mere entity that is present in the present,

original: @148a * // rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum zhes bya bas bdag med pa mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
analyzed: @148a * // rang rig pa'i bdag nyid ni mngon sum zhes bya bas bdag med pa mngon sum du grub pa yin no //
translated: and it is the nature of self-awareness. Since it is called ‚Äúperception,‚Äù the selflessness of the person is established by perception.

original: mngon sum gyis grub kyang rjes su dpag pa nye bar 'god pa ni bdag med pa rnams la pha rol po rnams kyi rang gi bya bas rgol ba rnams bzlog pa'i phyir yin pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis grub kyang rjes su dpag pa nye bar 'god pa ni bdag med pa rnams la pha rol po rnams kyi rang gi bya bas rgol ba rnams bzlog pa'i phyir yin pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Even though it is established by perception, we will present an inference, because we think that the opponents‚Äô arguments against selflessness are based on their own misconceptions, and so we will refute them.

original: bdag tu lta ba mthug po 'dzings pa'i nang du zhugs pa'i mu stegs tshad ma ngan pa'i rlung gis shing ba la bzhin bdas la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba mthug po 'dzings pa'i nang du zhugs pa'i mu stegs tshad ma ngan pa'i rlung gis shing ba la bzhin bdas la /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas are caught up in the thickets of the view of the self. They are like trees that are blown by the winds of bad logic.

original: zhi shes brag ri phye mar rlog pa'i thog lhung bas //
analyzed: zhi shes brag ri phye mar rlog pa'i thog lhung bas //
translated: They are like mountains of rock that are destroyed by the hail of peace.

original: bye mar brlag pas phyis 'byung bar ni ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bye mar brlag pas phyis 'byung bar ni ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could it arise again after being destroyed by sand?

original: de ltar na chos thams cad bdag med pa /
analyzed: de ltar na chos thams cad bdag med pa /
translated: Thus, it is explained that all phenomena are selfless,

original: sems can med pa /
analyzed: sems can med pa /
translated: without sentient beings,

original: srog med pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩgzod ma nas ni stong zhing ma 'ongs chos //
analyzed: srog med pa'o zhes bshad pa yin no // gzod ma nas ni stong zhing ma 'ongs chos //
translated: and without life force.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúempty from the beginning, future phenomena‚Äù and so on is ‚Äúpeaceful from the beginning, unborn,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po'i don med pa dang / bdag med pas bdag med pa rnam par gzhag pa yin na yang /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi dngos po'i don med pa dang / bdag med pas bdag med pa rnam par gzhag pa yin na yang /
translated: If external things are established as selfless due to the nonexistence of objects and selflessness,

original: de ltar na yang gang zag la bdag med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gang zag la bdag med pa yin gyi /
translated: then it is only the selflessness of persons,

original: chos thams cad la bdag med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag med pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not the selflessness of all phenomena,

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos sun ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i the tshom dang bral ba'i gzod ma nas ni stong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gzod ma nas zhi ba dang ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos sun ma byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i the tshom dang bral ba'i gzod ma nas ni stong zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don ni gzod ma nas zhi ba dang ma skyes pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste ;
translated: because the phenomenon of consciousness is not refuted.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams ma skyes pas na gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po rnams ma skyes pas na gzod ma nas zhi ba'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness are primordially peaceful because they are unborn.

original: ji ltar phyi rol med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol med pa de bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang ma skyes pa'i phyir gzod ma nas zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as there is no external world, consciousness is also said to be primordially peaceful because it is unborn.

original: phung po lnga stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir des na gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med /üîΩgar yang song ba med /
analyzed: phung po lnga stong pa nyid du bsgrubs pas chos thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgrub pa yin pa'i phyir des na gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med / gar yang song ba med /
translated: Since the five aggregates are established as emptiness, all phenomena are established as emptiness. Therefore, they do not come from anywhere,üîΩthey do not go anywhere,

original: gang du yang gnas pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gang du yang gnas pa med pa ste /
translated: and they do not abide anywhere.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not intrinsically abide.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtag tu snying po med //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rtag tu snying po med // ces bya ba la /
translated: The nature of illusions is always essenceless.

original: snying po med pa ste /
analyzed: snying po med pa ste /
translated: They are essenceless.

original: thams cad du phyi dang / nang gi dngos po rnams la bdag la sogs pa'i snying por gyur pa'i rdzas ci yang med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du phyi dang / nang gi dngos po rnams la bdag la sogs pa'i snying por gyur pa'i rdzas ci yang med pa'o //
translated: There is no substance anywhere that is the essence of the self and so on of all internal and external things.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of illusion.

original: gzugs brnyan tsam gyi byis pa rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan tsam gyi byis pa rnams rnam par rmongs par byed do //
translated: The mere reflection of form deceives the childish.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: But in reality,

original: thams cad dag cing rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: thams cad dag cing rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: All is pure, completely pure, like space.üîΩThis is purity, because of natural complete purity, free from clouds, fog, etc.

original: zhes @148b bya ba ni dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sprin dang / khug rna la sogs pa lta bu dang bral bas chos thams cad rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmi sngo mi ser dkar po ma yin te //
analyzed: zhes @148b bya ba ni dag pa ste rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i phyir sprin dang / khug rna la sogs pa lta bu dang bral bas chos thams cad rnam dag nam mkha' bzhin zhes bya ba'o // mi sngo mi ser dkar po ma yin te //
translated: All things are completely pure like space.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is not blue, not yellow, not white, etc.

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is free from the colors blue, yellow, white, etc.üîΩBecause the qualities of blue, etc. are based on substance, if substance does not exist, those based on it are completely nonexistent, like length and shortness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir rdzas kyi rang bzhin med na de la brten pa rnams shin tu yang ring thung med pa kho na'o zhes bya bas ming 'ba' zhig tsam mo //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i yon tan ni rdzas la brten pa'i phyir rdzas kyi rang bzhin med na de la brten pa rnams shin tu yang ring thung med pa kho na'o zhes bya bas ming 'ba' zhig tsam mo //
translated: It is only a mere name.

original: de yang nang na yang med /
analyzed: de yang nang na yang med /
translated: And that does not exist internally,

original: phyi rol na yang med /
analyzed: phyi rol na yang med /
translated: It is not external.

original: gnyi ga'i bar na yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bar na yang mi dmigs zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ba nyid yin no //
