translated: It is not perceived between the two.

original: de'i phyir sems ni dben zhing ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems ni dben zhing ste /
translated: Therefore, mind is isolated.

original: sems kyis bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyis bsam par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not an object of mental activity.

original: thams cad sgra dang bral ba ni brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad sgra dang bral ba ni brjod du med pa'o //
translated: All is free from sound, that is, inexpressible.

original: skad cig ste brdar bya ba yod pa ma yin pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid thams cad sgra dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ste brdar bya ba yod pa ma yin pas phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid thams cad sgra dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since there is no sound that is a conventional symbol, all is free from sound, whether it is of an external or internal nature.

original: bshad pa na yang yi ge 'pho ba med //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa la bshad kyang rung /
analyzed: bshad pa na yang yi ge 'pho ba med // ces bya ba la sogs pa la bshad kyang rung /
translated: Even when explained, the syllables do not move.üîΩEven when explained,

original: ma bshad kyang rung /
analyzed: ma bshad kyang rung /
translated: whether or not it is explained,

original: yi ge rnams la 'pho ba med pa ste /üîΩgzhan du 'gro ba yang med pa zhes bya bas yul gzhan du 'gro yang rung /
analyzed: yi ge rnams la 'pho ba med pa ste / gzhan du 'gro ba yang med pa zhes bya bas yul gzhan du 'gro yang rung /
translated: the syllables do not move,üîΩthat is, they do not go elsewhere.

original: mi 'gro yang rung /üîΩbshad kyang rung /
analyzed: mi 'gro yang rung / bshad kyang rung /
translated: Whether or not they go to another place,üîΩwhether or not they are explained,

original: ma bshad kyang rung bar yi ge'i ngo bo ni mi zad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bshad kyang rung bar yi ge'i ngo bo ni mi zad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: the nature of the syllables is taught to be inexhaustible.

original: de ltar na gang gis yi ge'i rang bzhin mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gang gis yi ge'i rang bzhin mi zad pa ste /
translated: Thus, one who knows the nature of the syllables to be inexhaustible,

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de ni mi zad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //üîΩsangs rgyas brgya stong dag ni gang 'das pa //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes pa de ni mi zad pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro // sangs rgyas brgya stong dag ni gang 'das pa //
translated: in accordance with the nature of the dharmadhatu, becomes one whose nature is the inexhaustible dharmadhatu.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: The verse beginning Those hundreds of thousands of buddhas who have passed into nirvana...

original: gang sangs rgyas brgya stong grangs med pa 'das pa rnams kyis chos brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu bstan kyang chos dang yi ge la zad pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas brgya stong grangs med pa 'das pa rnams kyis chos brgya stong phrag mang po rab tu bstan kyang chos dang yi ge la zad pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even though many hundreds of thousands of dharmas have been taught by the hundreds of thousands of buddhas who have passed into nirvana, there is no exhaustion of dharmas and syllables.

original: skyes pa med pa la 'gags pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa med pa la 'gags pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because what is unborn also does not cease.

original: skye ba med pa ji lta bu ni sngar bstan pa yin no //üîΩmdo sde brgya stong dag ni bshad byas kyang //
analyzed: skye ba med pa ji lta bu ni sngar bstan pa yin no // mdo sde brgya stong dag ni bshad byas kyang //
translated: The unborn has been explained above.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse beginning Even though hundreds of thousands of sutras are explained...

original: mdo sde dpag tu med pa gdul bya rnams dang mthun par bshad kyang chos thams cad yi ge med par yang shes la rnam par rtog pas de la chags par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mdo sde dpag tu med pa gdul bya rnams dang mthun par bshad kyang chos thams cad yi ge med par yang shes la rnam par rtog pas de la chags par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although he teaches the Dharma in accord with the disciples, he knows that all phenomena are without letters, and he is not attached to them through conceptualization.

original: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan kyang zad @149a * //
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa la sogs pa'i chos bstan kyang zad @149a * //
translated: Although he teaches the Dharma of selflessness, the absence of sentient beings, and so on, it is inexhaustible,

original: par mi 'gyur te nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: par mi 'gyur te nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: and it does not decline.

original: mkhas pa de ni tshig kun smra byed kyang //
analyzed: mkhas pa de ni tshig kun smra byed kyang //
translated: That expert speaks all words,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: but his mind is not carried away by them.

original: skad thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la nges pa'i tshig bsgrubs pas chos ston kyang de'i sems 'phrog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad thams cad kyis sems can thams cad la nges pa'i tshig bsgrubs pas chos ston kyang de'i sems 'phrog par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He teaches the Dharma by establishing the etymologies in all languages for all sentient beings, but his mind is not carried away by them.

original: de sems can thams cad la gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sems can thams cad la gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is without a basis in all sentient beings.

original: tshig rnams thams cad ri yi brag ca bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshig rnams thams cad ri yi brag ca bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: All words are like echoes in a mountain ravine.

original: sgra thams cad ni ri'i gcod rong dang phug gi nang gi brag cha dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya bar shes nas de dang de la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung zhing chags par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad ni ri'i gcod rong dang phug gi nang gi brag cha dang 'dra bas rang bzhin med pa'o zhes bya bar shes nas de dang de la mngon par zhen pa mi 'byung zhing chags par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood this, one does not become attached to them and does not become desirous.

original: tshig des ni zhes bya ba ni sgra gang dag gis chos thams cad yongs su bsgrags kyang de'i skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir brtan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig des ni zhes bya ba ni sgra gang dag gis chos thams cad yongs su bsgrags kyang de'i skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir brtan pa ma yin no //
translated: The words that are used to proclaim all phenomena are not stable because they are momentary.

original: ji ltar sgra skad cig ma yin zhing mi brten pa ltar chos thams cad mi brtan pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar sgra skad cig ma yin zhing mi brten pa ltar chos thams cad mi brtan pa nyid do //
translated: Just as sound is momentary and unstable, so are all phenomena unstable.

original: mtshan med ni mtshan nyid dang mtshon bar bya ba dang bral ba nyid do ;
analyzed: mtshan med ni mtshan nyid dang mtshon bar bya ba dang bral ba nyid do ;
translated: Signless means being free from characteristics and the characterized.

original: / dben pa ni dben pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: / dben pa ni dben pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Solitary means being pure because of being solitary.

original: rnam par dag pa'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bstan par 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i phyir stong pa'o zhes bstan par 'os pa yin no //
translated: Because of being pure, it is taught that it is empty.

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa drang srong de dag ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa drang srong de dag ste /
translated: The sages are the conceptual thoughts that distinguish the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams la med pa'o //
translated: It is not found in the TathƒÅgatas or the great bodhisattvas.

original: de 'gro ba thams cad du skyes par gyur ba'i sems can rnams 'dul ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de 'gro ba thams cad du skyes par gyur ba'i sems can rnams 'dul ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: He is skilled in disciplining sentient beings who have taken birth in all the realms.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i 'gro ba'i 'gro bar gyur pas lta bas byas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'dam thams cad las brgal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i 'gro ba'i 'gro bar gyur pas lta bas byas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'dam thams cad las brgal ba'o //
translated: He has crossed over all the mires of afflictions that are created by views, because he has become the realm of the unconditioned.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bar gyur pas 'bad pa med pa nyid du 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi rang bzhin shes pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bar gyur pas 'bad pa med pa nyid du 'gro ba'i don sgrub par byed pa'i tshig gi rang bzhin shes pa'o //
translated: He knows the nature of the words that accomplish the aims of beings effortlessly, because he has mastery over samƒÅdhi.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis mngon par shes pa lnga nges par bsgrubs nas thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug cing mngon par bsgrubs nas nges pa'i tshig gis ngag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das ba zhi ba rab tuüîΩzhi ba ston to zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis mngon par shes pa lnga nges par bsgrubs nas thabs la mkhas pa'i stobs kyis so so yang dag par rig pa la 'jug cing mngon par bsgrubs nas nges pa'i tshig gis ngag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das ba zhi ba rab tuüîΩzhi ba ston to zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Through the power of wisdom, he has accomplished the five superknowledges. Through the power of skill in means, he has entered into and accomplished the four discernments. He teaches the peace, the complete pacification, that transcends all the domains of speech through the power of the Dharma.

original: btags pa tsam du btags nas brjod pa yin //
analyzed: btags pa tsam du btags nas brjod pa yin //
translated: It is said to be a mere designation because it is designated as a mere designation.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this regard,

original: khams gsum pa thams cad sems dang sems las byung bas brtags pa yin pas brtags pa tsam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: khams gsum pa thams cad sems dang sems las byung bas brtags pa yin pas brtags pa tsam zhes brjod do //
translated: all three realms are designated by mind and mental factors, so they are said to be mere designations.

original: de ni brtags pa tsam @149b nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas ni phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni brtags pa tsam @149b nyid yin pa'i phyir rdzas ni phra mo tsam yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they are mere designations, there is not even the slightest substantial reality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de la ni mtha' med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gang yin pa de la ni mtha' med de /
translated: Whatever is dependent is endless.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i ngo bos stong pa nyid kyi dbus kyang med pa'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa'i phyir skye ba dang 'jig pa'i ngo bos stong pa nyid kyi dbus kyang med pa'o zhes bya bas /
translated: Since it is empty of a prior limit and an end, it is empty of a middle that has the nature of arising and cessation.üîΩThus, it is explained:

original: 'khor ba la ni mtha' ma mi rnyed de //üîΩzhes bya ba bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'khor ba la ni mtha' ma mi rnyed de // zhes bya ba bshad pa yin no ;
translated: The end of cyclic existence is not found.

original: / yongs su grub pa yang /
analyzed: / yongs su grub pa yang /
translated: The perfected is also explained:

original: gang dag sngon byung mtha' ni mtshan nyid med //
analyzed: gang dag sngon byung mtha' ni mtshan nyid med //
translated: The prior limit is without a characteristic.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la sngon gyi mtha' ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la sngon gyi mtha' ni rgyu ste /
translated: The prior limit is the cause.

original: skye ba'i mtha' nyid med pas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i mtha' nyid med pas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: Since it has no end of arising, it is without a characteristic.

original: de la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltos nas ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi mtshan nyid kyang med pa'o //
translated: In relation to that, the characteristics of the future and the present also do not exist.üîΩTherefore, because the characteristics of the imagined, the dependent, and the thoroughly established are empty, having refuted the proponents of consciousness, the establishment of the middle is:

original: de'i phyir kun brtags pa dang ; gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa smra ba sun phyung nas dbu ma nyid du bsgrub pa ni chos rnams stong pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun brtags pa dang ; gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa smra ba sun phyung nas dbu ma nyid du bsgrub pa ni chos rnams stong pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar grub ce na /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad stong pa nyid dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar grub ce na /
translated: Thus, how is it established that all phenomena are empty, and that the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and their effects are posited?

original: brjod par bya'o //üîΩdge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni rmi lam ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs la /
analyzed: brjod par bya'o // dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa ni rmi lam ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs la /
translated: It should be said.üîΩThe virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and their effects are posited like a dream.

original: las dang bya bas de ltar zhugs gyur te //
analyzed: las dang bya bas de ltar zhugs gyur te //
translated: It is said that the one who engages in actions and deeds

original: zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang / rab dang / bar ma'i dbye bas 'bras bu myang bar 'gyur ba'i dbye ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dman pa dang / rab dang / bar ma'i dbye bas 'bras bu myang bar 'gyur ba'i dbye ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there is a distinction in the experience of the fruit, due to the distinction of the inferior, the superior, and the middling.

original: chos rnams rtag tu dben zhing rang bzhin stong //
analyzed: chos rnams rtag tu dben zhing rang bzhin stong //
translated: The dharmas are always void and empty of self-existence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this way,

original: bdag la sogs pas stong pa ji ltar sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pas stong pa ji ltar sa bon dang / myu gu dang / 'khri shing la sogs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dmigs pa yin no //
translated: how is it that the seed, the sprout, the creeper, etc., are perceived as cause and effect, although they are empty of self-existence, etc.?

original: de dang 'dra bar nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus kyi mig la sogs pa yang blta'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar nang gi bdag nyid kyi lus kyi mig la sogs pa yang blta'o zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs so //
translated: In the same way, one should see the internal self-existence of the body, the eye, etc. This is the natural inference.

original: kun rdzob tu ni rgyal bas chos bshad de //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni rgyal bas chos bshad de //
translated: The Victor has taught the dharma as conventional.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this way,

original: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ni kun rdzob ces bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams ni kun rdzob ces bya ba'i sgras brjod do //
translated: the conditioned and unconditioned dharmas are expressed by the word ‚Äúconventional.‚Äù

original: don dam par ni brjod du med pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: don dam par ni brjod du med pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: In the ultimate sense, they are said to be inexpressible.

original: /'gro ba kun gyi mtshan nyid de 'dra'o //
analyzed: /'gro ba kun gyi mtshan nyid de 'dra'o //
translated: Such is the characteristic of all the worlds.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the characteristic of the pure aggregate of morality.

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan med pas mtshan nyid 'di nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas las ma gtogs pa'i chos gzhan med pas mtshan nyid 'di nyid do //
translated: Since there is no other dharma apart from the conditioned and the unconditioned, this is the characteristic of the pure aggregate of morality.

original: las dkar nag gi 'bras bu bdag nyid kyis byas pa rnams rgyud gcig tu mngon par zhen pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas @150a * //
analyzed: las dkar nag gi 'bras bu bdag nyid kyis byas pa rnams rgyud gcig tu mngon par zhen pas nyams su myong bar 'gyur bas @150a * //
translated: Since the results of good and bad actions are experienced by the one who has done them, because of the adherence to a single continuum,

original: 'bras bu rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: the results are not causeless.

original: las dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is a result that is in accordance with the action.

original: srid pa thams cad sgyu ma dbang med pa //
analyzed: srid pa thams cad sgyu ma dbang med pa //
translated: All of existence is like an illusion, powerless,

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brtags pa'i so sor nges par snang ba'i rgyu thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang 'dra ba brdzun pa stong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por brtags pa'i so sor nges par snang ba'i rgyu thams cad sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang 'dra ba brdzun pa stong pa'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that all causes that appear as the ascertained objects of the imputation of the entity of cause and effect are false and empty, like an illusion and a mirage.

original: dngos po rnams 'di lta bu shes pa de'i tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams 'di lta bu shes pa de'i tshul khrims kyi phung po rnam par dag par 'gyur te /
translated: When one knows things in this way, the aggregate of morality becomes pure.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the morality of superior wisdom.

original: chos thams cad skye ba med par bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir cung zad tsam la yang rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad skye ba med par bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir cung zad tsam la yang rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: Because he has the power of patience in the non-arising of all dharmas, he does not conceptualize even the slightest thing.

original: byang chub sems dba' rtag tu sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dba' rtag tu sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni mnyam par gzhag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is always in meditative equipoise is called one who is in meditative equipoise.

original: rgyal po des ni ji tsam chos rig pa //
analyzed: rgyal po des ni ji tsam chos rig pa //
translated: That king knows the Dharma to the extent that...

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji snyed cig gsungs pa de thams cad des don dang / tshig dang bcas pa thams cad 'dzin par nus shing brjod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos ji snyed cig gsungs pa de thams cad des don dang / tshig dang bcas pa thams cad 'dzin par nus shing brjod par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has taught this much Dharma, and he is able to retain it all, both the meaning and the words, without forgetting.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin nges par rtogs pas rgyal po de 'khor dang bcas pa rab tu byung nas tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrungs so //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin nges par rtogs pas rgyal po de 'khor dang bcas pa rab tu byung nas tshul khrims ma nyams par bsrungs so //
translated: Having understood the meaning just as it is, that king and his retinue went forth and guarded their morality without transgression.

original: rgyal po'i bu rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas legs par gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas yid rab tu mgu bas bde bar gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa la phyag 'tshal nas ting nge 'dzin rab tu rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin 'di thos nas legs par gsungs pa la mngon par dga' nas yid rab tu mgu bas bde bar gshegs pa sras dang bcas pa la phyag 'tshal nas ting nge 'dzin rab tu rtogs pas mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa
translated: And the princes, having heard this meditative stabilization, rejoiced in the good teaching, and with their minds well pleased, they bowed down to the Sugata and his sons, and attained

original: so sor thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor thob par gyur to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas through the realization of meditative stabilization.üîΩAnd there, eighty thousand living beings

original: der yang srog chags stong phrag brgyad cu dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: der yang srog chags stong phrag brgyad cu dag / ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And there, too, eighty thousand living beings, and so on.üîΩ

original: der chos bstan pas skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob par gyur to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: der chos bstan pas skye ba med pa'i chos la bzod pa so sor thob par gyur to zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: There, through the teaching of the Dharma, they attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: chos kyi rang bzhin bzang po 'di thos nas //
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin bzang po 'di thos nas //
translated: Having heard this good nature of the Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: chos kyi rang bzhin zab mo 'di thos nas ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa 'di don dam pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin zab mo 'di thos nas ting nge 'dzin yang dag pa 'di don dam pa ste /
translated: Having heard this profound nature of the Dharma, this meditative stabilization is the ultimate,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i bden pa 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par bstan to zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i bden pa 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis nges par bstan to zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: and this unerring truth was taught by the Blessed One.

original: / ji lta bu'i mi skye ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: / ji lta bu'i mi skye ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is non-arising?

original: skyes bu la ni skye dang 'gag pa med //
analyzed: skyes bu la ni skye dang 'gag pa med //
translated: ‚ÄúA person has no arising or ceasing.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And so on.

original: skyes bu ste bdag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ste bdag la skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: A person, that is, a self, has no arising or ceasing.

original: de bzhin chos 'di ste gzhan dag kyang rtag tu snga nas te thams cad du gzod ma nas dben pa dang zhi ba ni mi skye ba'i chos @150b zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin chos 'di ste gzhan dag kyang rtag tu snga nas te thams cad du gzod ma nas dben pa dang zhi ba ni mi skye ba'i chos @150b zhes bya'o //
translated: Likewise, these phenomena, and others as well, are always, from the very beginning, void and peaceful. This is called ‚Äúthe dharma of non-arising.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs nas rgyal pos mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs nas rgyal pos mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: Having realized the nature of phenomena in this way, the king attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur pas rgyal srid yongs su spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur pas rgyal srid yongs su spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu byung bar gyur to //
translated: Having attained acceptance of the fact that phenomena are not produced, he gave up his kingdom and went forth into the teachings of the TathƒÅgata.

original: bu dang bcas pa'i 'khor gzhan de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang chos 'dod pas de'i rjes su rab tu byung bar gyur to //
analyzed: bu dang bcas pa'i 'khor gzhan de'i rjes su 'brang ba rnams kyang chos 'dod pas de'i rjes su rab tu byung bar gyur to //
translated: The other members of his retinue, including his sons, followed his example and went forth into the teachings out of a desire for the Dharma.

original: lo ni brgya phrag nyi shu yongs su tshang bar //
analyzed: lo ni brgya phrag nyi shu yongs su tshang bar //
translated: For a full two hundred years

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rab tu bstan pa dang / thos pa'i dus nges par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos rab tu bstan pa dang / thos pa'i dus nges par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the teaching of the Dharma and the time of hearing.

original: de nas dus kyang gzhan du gyur pa'i tshe //
analyzed: de nas dus kyang gzhan du gyur pa'i tshe //
translated: Then, when the time had changed,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: This teaches the time of the teaching.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang mya ngan las 'das /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de yang mya ngan las 'das /
translated: The Tathagata had passed into Nirvana.

original: nyan thos rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das nas de'i chos nyam chung bar gyur /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyang mya ngan las 'das nas de'i chos nyam chung bar gyur /
translated: The Shravakas had also passed into Nirvana, and his Dharma had become weak.üîΩWhen the holders were few, there was a prince of that king who had faith in the teachings of the Tathagata.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa yang nyung bar gyur pa na rgyal po de'i bu rgyal tsha ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu dang par gyur pa cig byung ba de'i khab tu rtag tu 'ong ba'i dge slong zhig yod pa des ting nge 'dzin 'di rabüîΩtu bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa yang nyung bar gyur pa na rgyal po de'i bu rgyal tsha ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu dang par gyur pa cig byung ba de'i khab tu rtag tu 'ong ba'i dge slong zhig yod pa des ting nge 'dzin 'di rab tu bstan to //
translated: A monk who always came to his palace taught this samadhi

original: yang dag par bshad do //
analyzed: yang dag par bshad do //
translated: and explained it.

original: de yang yid du 'ong ba shin tu 'jam pa snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: de yang yid du 'ong ba shin tu 'jam pa snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: He was also pleasant, very gentle, and spoke pleasantly.

original: sngon gyi 'brel par gyur pa'i lha zhig rtag tu de'i bsngag pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: sngon gyi 'brel par gyur pa'i lha zhig rtag tu de'i bsngag pa rjod par byed do //
translated: A certain god who had a previous connection always praised him.

original: de yang dran pa dang / blo gros dang rtogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i tshig gis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa la mkhas pas chos gos dang /
analyzed: de yang dran pa dang / blo gros dang rtogs pa dang / bstan pa phun sum tshogs pa'i phyir sems can thams cad dga' bar byed pa'i tshig gis phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ston pa la mkhas pas chos gos dang /
translated: He was also a speaker of truth, and he was skilled in teaching the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and dependent origination with words that delighted all beings because of his perfect memory, intelligence, understanding, and teaching.

original: lhung bzed dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams mang du rnyed pa dang ldan pas grags pa dang ldan pa'i 'od kyis phyogs thams cad du khyab pa'i 'od 'di la yod pas dge slong de'i ming snyan pa'i 'od ces bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad rnams mang du rnyed pa dang ldan pas grags pa dang ldan pa'i 'od kyis phyogs thams cad du khyab pa'i 'od 'di la yod pas dge slong de'i ming snyan pa'i 'od ces bya'o //
translated: He had many robes, alms-food, medicine for the sick, and other requisites, and his fame spread in all directions. Therefore, the name of that monk was Ya≈õovat.

original: gzhan dge slong mang pos de'i bsod nams kyi stobs ma bzod nas dmigs pa'i lta ba can de dag la phrag dog gi mtshon rnon po snying la phog par gyur pas de ma dang pa'i sems skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: gzhan dge slong mang pos de'i bsod nams kyi stobs ma bzod nas dmigs pa'i lta ba can de dag la phrag dog gi mtshon rnon po snying la phog par gyur pas de ma dang pa'i sems skyes par gyur to //
translated: Other monks, unable to bear the power of his merit, were struck in the heart by the sharp weapon of jealousy.

original: dge slong de yang bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten thams cad las 'phags par gyur cing /
analyzed: dge slong de yang bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'jig rten thams cad las 'phags par gyur cing /
translated: And that monk, by the power of his merit, knowledge, morality, and concentration, rose above the whole world.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi mig 'phrog par byed pa mchod par byed pa'i dge slong chos smra ba de la dge slong gzhan dag gdug pa'i sems @151a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi mig 'phrog par byed pa mchod par byed pa'i dge slong chos smra ba de la dge slong gzhan dag gdug pa'i sems @151a * //
translated: When the other monks saw that the Dharma teacher was being honored and that the whole world was looking at him, they became jealous.

original: skyes par rig nas chos smra ba de bsrung ba'i phyir go cha dang / ya lad legs par bgos la /
analyzed: skyes par rig nas chos smra ba de bsrung ba'i phyir go cha dang / ya lad legs par bgos la /
translated: The Dharma teacher, knowing that the other monks had given rise to an evil mind, put on his armor and his harness in order to protect the Dharma teacher.

original: lag na mtshon sna tshogs thogs pa skyes bu rnams la bka' stsal pas de bskor nas dogs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral bas stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu ston pa'i chos rab tu ston to //
analyzed: lag na mtshon sna tshogs thogs pa skyes bu rnams la bka' stsal pas de bskor nas dogs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral bas stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / don dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa rab tu ston pa'i chos rab tu ston to //
translated: He spoke to the men who were holding various weapons in their hands. They surrounded him, and he fearlessly taught the Dharma, which reveals emptiness, signlessness, and the ultimate nirvana.

original: dmigs pa'i lta ba can gang dag yin pa de dag ni stong pa nyid bstan pa la spro ba med do //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta ba can gang dag yin pa de dag ni stong pa nyid bstan pa la spro ba med do //
translated: Those who had the view of objectification had no enthusiasm for the teaching of emptiness.

original: dge slong dag ni lag na mtshon thogs 'ongs //
analyzed: dge slong dag ni lag na mtshon thogs 'ongs //
translated: The monks came with weapons in their hands,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: saying,üîΩThis one teaches the Dharma in a way that is contrary to us. We must kill him!

original: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par byed pa dgra 'di gsad par bya ba'i phyir lag na mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pas 'brel ba'i lag pa dang bcas pas langs /
analyzed: rang dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos ston par byed pa dgra 'di gsad par bya ba'i phyir lag na mtshon cha sna tshogs thogs pas 'brel ba'i lag pa dang bcas pas langs /
translated: They came with their hands full of weapons.

original: dge slong 'di ni chos min rab ston gyis //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni chos min rab ston gyis //
translated: This monk teaches what is not Dharma,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: dge slong 'di ni bdag cag gi 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyin ci log gi chos ston gyis 'di bsad na bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni bdag cag gi 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyin ci log gi chos ston gyis 'di bsad na bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur gyis /
translated: This monk teaches a perverted doctrine that is contrary to our desires. If we kill him, merit will increase greatly.üîΩ It will not be demerit for us. Having thus resolved, they began to beat him.

original: bdag cag la bsod nams ma yin par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par bsams nas brdeg par brtsams pa dang / mthong nas dge slong mtshon gyis mi 'jigs te //
analyzed: bdag cag la bsod nams ma yin par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes nges par bsams nas brdeg par brtsams pa dang / mthong nas dge slong mtshon gyis mi 'jigs te //
translated: Seeing this, the monk was not afraid of the weapons.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He said, I am not afraid of the weapons.

original: mtshon cha sna tshogs rdeg par byed pa de dag mthong ba yang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas bag tsha ba ci yang med kyis stong pa nyid rjes su dran zhing /
analyzed: mtshon cha sna tshogs rdeg par byed pa de dag mthong ba yang 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa med pas bag tsha ba ci yang med kyis stong pa nyid rjes su dran zhing /
translated: Seeing that they were striking him with various weapons, he was not at all nervous, because he was fearless about the danger of death.

original: gang bsad pa dang / gang gis gsod pa dang / cis gsod pa de dag stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid bsad du med de /
analyzed: gang bsad pa dang / gang gis gsod pa dang / cis gsod pa de dag stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid bsad du med de /
translated: He remembered emptiness, thinking, That which is killed, that by which one is killed, and that by which one is killed, those are emptiness, and emptiness cannot kill emptiness.

original: 'chi bar 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir su zhig 'chi bar 'gyur zhes nges par sems pa'i blos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: 'chi bar 'gyur ba yang med pa'i phyir su zhig 'chi bar 'gyur zhes nges par sems pa'i blos de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phyag 'tshal nas bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs rtsom par byed do //
translated: Since there is no one who dies, who will die? With this kind of mind, he paid homage to all the Tathagatas and began the consecration of the truth.

original: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa'i bden pa dang / bden pa'i tshig 'dis mtshon cha 'di dag mand'a ra ba'i me tog tu gyur cig ces brjod ma thag tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i ltas byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa nyid yin pa'i bden pa dang / bden pa'i tshig 'dis mtshon cha 'di dag mand'a ra ba'i me tog tu gyur cig ces brjod ma thag tu ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i ltas byung bar gyur te /
translated: By the truth of the emptiness of all phenomena, and by the words of truth, may these weapons become mandara flowers! As soon as he said this, a wondrous and marvelous sign appeared.

original: mtshon cha de dag kyang me tog mand'a ra bar gyur /
analyzed: mtshon cha de dag kyang me tog mand'a ra bar gyur /
translated: Those weapons turned into mandara flowers.

original: ri dang nags tshal dang bcas pa'i sa chen po yang g-yo bar gyur to //
analyzed: ri dang nags tshal dang bcas pa'i sa chen po yang g-yo bar gyur to //
translated: The great earth with its mountains and forests shook.

original: mtshon cha 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa'i yid kyis yang de dang nye bar 'gro bar ma nus so //
analyzed: mtshon cha 'dzin pa'i dge slong de dag kyang 'jigs shing skrag pa'i yid kyis yang de dang nye bar 'gro bar ma nus so //
translated: Those monks holding weapons, with frightened minds, were unable to approach him.

original: su dag thub @151b dbang la ni dad mos shing //
analyzed: su dag thub @151b dbang la ni dad mos shing //
translated: Those who have faith and devotion to the Lord of Sages,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sems can gang dag stong pa nyid la mos pa de dag ni thub pa'i dbang po de la dad cing mos par gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gang dag stong pa nyid la mos pa de dag ni thub pa'i dbang po de la dad cing mos par gyur te /
translated: Those sentient beings who are devoted to emptiness have faith in and are devoted to that Lord of Sages.

original: de dag aa la la stong brjod nas su //
analyzed: de dag aa la la stong brjod nas su //
translated: They exclaim ‚ÄúA la la!‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: aa la la zhes bya ba ni sdig pa can la smad pas dge slong sdig pa can gyi spyod pa smad pa dang / chos smra ba la sems dang ba bskyed pas lan stong snyed brjod pa'o //üîΩras bcos brgya yis dge slong mngon par g-yogs //
analyzed: aa la la zhes bya ba ni sdig pa can la smad pas dge slong sdig pa can gyi spyod pa smad pa dang / chos smra ba la sems dang ba bskyed pas lan stong snyed brjod pa'o // ras bcos brgya yis dge slong mngon par g-yogs //
translated: ‚ÄúA la la!‚Äù is an exclamation of contempt for the sinful, a condemnation of the sinful behavior of the sinful monk, and an expression of faith in the Dharma teacher, repeated a thousand times.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe monk is attended by a hundred well-dressed women.‚Äù

original: chos smra ba'i dge slong de rang bzhin gyis bzang ba nyid dang / bdag nyid kyis byams pa chen po'i bdag nyid can du gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi mdun du tshig 'di skad ces rjod par byed do //
analyzed: chos smra ba'i dge slong de rang bzhin gyis bzang ba nyid dang / bdag nyid kyis byams pa chen po'i bdag nyid can du gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi mdun du tshig 'di skad ces rjod par byed do //
translated: In order to make it clear that the monk who teaches the Dharma is naturally good and himself an embodiment of great love, he speaks these words in the presence of the whole world:

original: sems can su dag nga la sdang byed pa //
analyzed: sems can su dag nga la sdang byed pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThose sentient beings who are hostile to me

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so forth.

original: gang dag bdag gsad par bya ba'i phyir sdang ba'i sems kyis zhugs pa de dag nges par mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur bas de dag gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyams su blang bar bya'i /
analyzed: gang dag bdag gsad par bya ba'i phyir sdang ba'i sems kyis zhugs pa de dag nges par mnar med par 'gro bar 'gyur bas de dag gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bdag gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nyams su blang bar bya'i /
translated: Those who, with a hostile mind, have set out to kill me will certainly go to Avƒ´ci Hell. Therefore, in order to save them, I will practice the bodhisattva deeds.

original: gzhan gyis ni gzung bar nus pa ma yin no zhes smras nas /
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni gzung bar nus pa ma yin no zhes smras nas /
translated: But others are not able to save them.‚Äù

original: dge slong des lo brgyad cur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mdzod bshad do ;
analyzed: dge slong des lo brgyad cur bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i stong pa nyid kyi mdzod bshad do ;
translated: Then that monk taught the treasury of emptiness as taught by the Bhagavat for eighty years.

original: / dge slong gang dag sdang bar gyur pa de dag ni pham par gyur cing 'jig rten thams cad kyis smad cing brnyas par gyur to //
analyzed: / dge slong gang dag sdang bar gyur pa de dag ni pham par gyur cing 'jig rten thams cad kyis smad cing brnyas par gyur to //
translated: Those monks who had been hostile were defeated and were despised and ridiculed by the whole world.

original: dge slong de ni gzhan dag gshe ba'i tshig drag po mtshon cha dang 'dra bas snad cing zher 'debs par byed kyang dge slong sdig pa can gyi yul de dag la yang bzod pa la goms pa'i stobs kyis bzhin gyi padma'i mdangs gzhan du gyur pa med doüîΩzhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong de ni gzhan dag gshe ba'i tshig drag po mtshon cha dang 'dra bas snad cing zher 'debs par byed kyang dge slong sdig pa can gyi yul de dag la yang bzod pa la goms pa'i stobs kyis bzhin gyi padma'i mdangs gzhan du gyur pa med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That monk, though wounded and hurt by the sharp, weapon-like words of abuse of others, still, by the power of his long practice of patience, did not change his lotus-face toward those sinful people.

original: de nas dge slong de la rgyal po'i bu bsod nams blo gros kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas dge slong de la rgyal po'i bu bsod nams blo gros kyis 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Prince Pu·πáyamatin said to that monk:

original: bdag gis slob dpon de la gang su dag gis yid mi bde ba'i rgyu sems la gnod pa ci zhig ma byas sam zhes smras pa dang / bzod pa la goms par byas pa'i stobs kyis sems la byams pa chen po shin tu brtan pa ring du goms par gyur pas khro ba dang 'khrug pas bskyed pa'i gnod pa ma mchis so zhes so //
analyzed: bdag gis slob dpon de la gang su dag gis yid mi bde ba'i rgyu sems la gnod pa ci zhig ma byas sam zhes smras pa dang / bzod pa la goms par byas pa'i stobs kyis sems la byams pa chen po shin tu brtan pa ring du goms par gyur pas khro ba dang 'khrug pas bskyed pa'i gnod pa ma mchis so zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúI asked that teacher, ‚ÄòWhat is the cause of his mental unhappiness, what is the harm to his mind?‚Äô He said, ‚ÄòBy the power of long practice of patience, I have long been accustomed to the firm, great love in my mind. There is no harm produced by anger and agitation.‚Äô‚Äù

original: gang gis bskal pa brgya stong du byang chub sems pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe bzod pa legs par @152a * //
analyzed: gang gis bskal pa brgya stong du byang chub sems pa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe bzod pa legs par @152a * //
translated: For one hundred thousand eons, when practicing the bodhisattva deeds, one should cultivate patience well.üîΩ

original: bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i dge slong snyan pa'i 'od ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid du byas pa'i dge slong snyan pa'i 'od ces bya ba gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa yin no //
translated: The one who, during a hundred thousand eons, practiced the conduct of the bodhisattva, and who, at the time of cultivating patience, made himself into one who had well cultivated patience, that monk called ≈örƒ´gho·π£a is now the BhagavƒÅn ≈öƒÅkyamuni.

original: gang gis chos smra ba'i dge slong snyan pa'i 'od srung bar byed pa'i rgyal po'i bu bsod nams blo gros gang yin pa byams pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang gis chos smra ba'i dge slong snyan pa'i 'od srung bar byed pa'i rgyal po'i bu bsod nams blo gros gang yin pa byams pa 'di yin te /
translated: The one who was the king‚Äôs son Pu·πáyamatin, who protected the dharmabhƒÅ·πáaka monk ≈örƒ´gho·π£apratibhƒÅna, that one is Maitreya.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan to //
translated: He too will become a tathƒÅgata.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs kyi dbang phyug la mchod pa byas pa'i rgyal po me tog mchog ces bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pad ma'i mchog ces bya bar gyur to zhes lung bstan to //
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa tshogs kyi dbang phyug la mchod pa byas pa'i rgyal po me tog mchog ces bya ba de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas pad ma'i mchog ces bya bar gyur to zhes lung bstan to //
translated: The one who made offerings to the TathƒÅgata Ga·πáe≈õvara, the king called Suke≈õa, he was prophesied to become the TathƒÅgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One called Padmottama.

original: de lta bur bskal pa dpag tu med pas chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pas mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bzod pa rnam pa gsum mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: de lta bur bskal pa dpag tu med pas chos mnyan pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pas mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir bzod pa rnam pa gsum mngon sum du byas so //
translated: In this way, through listening to the Dharma, reflecting on it, and meditating on it for immeasurable eons, I actualized the three types of patience.

original: de ltar ngas sngon bzod pa'i stobs bsgrubs pa bzhin du gzhon nu khyod kyang rjes su slobs shig ces zla 'do gzhon nu la gdams pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngas sngon bzod pa'i stobs bsgrubs pa bzhin du gzhon nu khyod kyang rjes su slobs shig ces zla 'do gzhon nu la gdams pa'o //
translated: Young man, you should also train in this way, by accomplishing the power of patience just as I did in the past.

original: nga mya ngan las 'das par gyur nas dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig par gyur pa'i tshe mu stegs kyi gzhung la brtson zhing zhen pa'i dge slong mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga mya ngan las 'das par gyur nas dam pa'i chos rnam par 'jig par gyur pa'i tshe mu stegs kyi gzhung la brtson zhing zhen pa'i dge slong mang po 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúAfter my parinirvƒÅ·πáa, when the sacred Dharma is being destroyed, there will be many monks who will be devoted to and will follow the scriptures of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: de dag nga'i dam pa'i chos stong pa nyid lta ba ngan pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa 'di slong bar byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag nga'i dam pa'i chos stong pa nyid lta ba ngan pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa 'di slong bar byed par 'gyur te /
translated: They will reject my sacred Dharma of emptiness, which destroys all bad views.

original: de dag ni rmongs pa'i mun nag mthug por zhugs pas bdag nyid phung par byas nas gzhan dag kyang phung bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bas de'i bag yod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni rmongs pa'i mun nag mthug por zhugs pas bdag nyid phung par byas nas gzhan dag kyang phung bar byed pa yin no zhes bya bas de'i bag yod par bya'o //
translated: They are like people who, having entered a thick darkness, destroy themselves and cause others to be destroyed.

original: gang yang nad thams cad zhi par byed pa'i bdud rtsi 'thung ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la mos pa de ni nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang nad thams cad zhi par byed pa'i bdud rtsi 'thung ba bzhin du stong pa nyid la mos pa de ni nga'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: One who is devoted to emptiness, like someone who drinks the nectar that cures all disease, is called by me a monk who has gone forth in my teaching.

original: dge slong gi dngos por bsnyen par rdzogs te /üîΩgso sbyong gi las la sogs pa yang rung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos por bsnyen par rdzogs te / gso sbyong gi las la sogs pa yang rung ba kho na'o //
translated: He is a true monk, a true bhik·π£u, a true renunciant.üîΩHe is a true bhik·π£u, a true renunciant, a true upƒÅsaka, a true ≈õrama·πáa, a true brƒÅhma·πáa.üîΩHe is a true bhik·π£u, a true renunciant, a true upƒÅsaka, a true ≈õrama·πáa, a true brƒÅhma·πáa.

original: de lta bas na lus dang srog la'ang ltos pa med par byas la /
analyzed: de lta bas na lus dang srog la'ang ltos pa med par byas la /
translated: Therefore, without regard for body or life,

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin stong pa nyid de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate the samƒÅdhi that elaborates the equality of the nature of all phenomena, which is emptiness, suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur gyi phyir ngal ba med pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / sa rnams nges par sgrub par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur gyi phyir ngal ba med pa'i sems kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / sa rnams nges par sgrub par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In order to worship and serve all the Tathagatas, one should establish the roots of virtue that are conducive to the definite accomplishment of the perfections and the spiritual levels, with a mind that is not fatigued.
