analyzed: mchod pa thams cad dang / lugs sku la sogs pa yang 'di dag nyid kyi @152b khongs su gtogs pas ma spros so //
translated: All worship and all images, etc. are included in these, so they are not elaborated here.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid bsgom pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par bsal bar mi nus pa de'i tshe 'dod chags la mi sdug pa dang zhe sdang la byams pa dang / gti mug la shes rab ni gnyen po yin no zhes bya bas mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa ni man ngag go zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid bsgom pas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par bsal bar mi nus pa de'i tshe 'dod chags la mi sdug pa dang zhe sdang la byams pa dang / gti mug la shes rab ni gnyen po yin no zhes bya bas mi sdug pa la sogs pa bsgom par bya ba la sogs pa ni man ngag go zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: When one is unable to eliminate attachment, etc. by meditating on emptiness, then the antidote is as follows: for attachment, it is the impurity meditation; for hostility, it is the meditation on love; and for delusion, it is the meditation on wisdom. Thus, the instructions are to meditate on impurity, etc. This should be applied everywhere.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i sems kyis chos nyid kyi de nyid kho na nyid rjes su tshol ba la gcig tu mngon par zhen pas tshul bzhin du bsgoms na sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur gyi tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan to
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad rnam par spangs pa'i sems kyis chos nyid kyi de nyid kho na nyid rjes su tshol ba la gcig tu mngon par zhen pas tshul bzhin du bsgoms na sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur gyi tshig tsam gyis ni ma yin no zhes bstan to
translated: It teaches that if one meditates properly with a mind that has abandoned the eight worldly concerns, and is single-pointedly focused on the suchness of reality, one will attain buddhahood, not just by mere words.

original: // sangs rgyas sras po bde gshegs 'od kyi phreng pas phreng brgyus pa'i //
analyzed: // sangs rgyas sras po bde gshegs 'od kyi phreng pas phreng brgyus pa'i //
translated: The Buddha‚Äôs son, the Sugata, strung a garland with the light rays of the Sugatas.

original: ma lus 'khor lor de yi snyan pa'i 'od kyis khyab par gyur /
analyzed: ma lus 'khor lor de yi snyan pa'i 'od kyis khyab par gyur /
translated: His beautiful light pervaded the entire wheel.

original: bsod nams ye shes dag gis de nyid ma lus gsal byas nas //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes dag gis de nyid ma lus gsal byas nas //
translated: Having illuminated all of reality with merit and wisdom,

original: de ni yang 'dir sh'akya'i mgon po shin tu mgon por gyur //
analyzed: de ni yang 'dir sh'akya'i mgon po shin tu mgon por gyur //
translated: he became the protector of the Shakyas here.

original: snyan pa'i 'od ni de nyid shes pa'i mchog ;
analyzed: snyan pa'i 'od ni de nyid shes pa'i mchog ;
translated: That beautiful light is the supreme knower of reality,

original: / ting 'dzin rgyal po yon tan ldan par grags //
analyzed: / ting 'dzin rgyal po yon tan ldan par grags //
translated: known as the king of samadhis, endowed with qualities.

original: snyan pa'i 'od kyis shin tu gsal bar byas //
analyzed: snyan pa'i 'od kyis shin tu gsal bar byas //
translated: The beautiful light illuminated everything.

original: snyan pa'i 'od 'dir thub pa'i dbang por gyur //
analyzed: snyan pa'i 'od 'dir thub pa'i dbang por gyur //
translated: Here, the beautiful light became the lord of sages.

original: snyan pa'i 'od kyi le'u ste sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: snyan pa'i 'od kyi le'u ste sum cu rtsa brgyad pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the thirty-eighth chapter, ‚ÄúThe Chapter on the Light of Beauty,‚Äù in The Commentary on the Perfection of Wisdom Called ‚ÄúThe Ornament of Clear Realization.‚Äù

original: // / da ni byang chub sems dpa' lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pas bsdoms pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad sdom pa gsum las nges par byung ba yin pas nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur bas de la mngon par brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba yin
analyzed: // / da ni byang chub sems dpa' lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi sdom pas bsdoms pa ni sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad sdom pa gsum las nges par byung ba yin pas nges par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par 'gyur bas de la mngon par brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba yin
translated: Now, since the bodhisattva who is bound by the vows of body, speech, and mind is certain to become a perfect buddha, because all the qualities of a buddha definitely arise from the three vows, one should strive at them.

original: no // de la lus kyi sdom pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: no // de la lus kyi sdom pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the vow of body,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThen the Bhagavat . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: de la lus kyi sdom pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la lus kyi sdom pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the vow of body is also of two kinds:

original: don dam pa ba dang / kun rdzob pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ba dang / kun rdzob pa'o //
translated: ultimate and relative.

original: don dam pa pa'i lus ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i lus ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The ultimate body is the dharmakƒÅya.

original: de mngon sum du byed pa dang / srung ba'i lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de mngon sum du byed pa dang / srung ba'i lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The vow of body that is the cause of actualizing that and the vow of body that protects it are called the vow of body.

original: yang dag pa'i mchog dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mchog dang / gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sdom pa ste /
translated: The terms ‚Äúsupreme‚Äù and ‚Äúchief‚Äù refer to the vow.

original: lus kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: It is the vow of the body.

original: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this,

original: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la chags pa med par 'gyur ba de ni lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩchos kyi sku nyid chos thams cad la chags @153a * //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' chen po chos thams cad la chags pa med par 'gyur ba de ni lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / chos kyi sku nyid chos thams cad la chags @153a * //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe one who possesses the vow of the body, by which the great bodhisattva becomes free from attachment to all dharmas, is called the vow of the body.‚ÄùüîΩThe Dharma Body itself becomes the wisdom free from attachment to all dharmas.

original: pa med pa'i ye shes su gyur pa ni de thob pa'o //
analyzed: pa med pa'i ye shes su gyur pa ni de thob pa'o //
translated: To attain that is to attain the Dharma Body.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang don dam pa pa yin no zhes bya bar /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku yang don dam pa pa yin no zhes bya bar /
translated: The Enjoyment Body is also ultimate.

original: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar thob par 'gyur bde ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu'i bar thob par 'gyur bde ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: In order to teach just this, he says, ‚ÄúThe one who possesses the vow of the body, by which one attains up to the eighty minor marks,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe essence is the Enjoyment Body,

original: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs pa dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul pa dang // chos sku zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid longs rdzogs pa dang // de bzhin gzhan ni sprul pa dang // chos sku zhes bya ba la /
translated: and likewise the other is the Emanation Body,üîΩand the Dharma Body is called the Dharma Body.

original: chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩlus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'thob pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni chos kyi sku'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu 'thob pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe body that is the nature of phenomena is the dharmakƒÅya.‚Äù

original: de la dang por byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bcu ni lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs dang / bzod pa'i stobs dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / spong ba'i stobs dang / spobs pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de la dang por byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bcu ni lhag par mos pa'i stobs dang / so sor brtags pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs dang / bzod pa'i stobs dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang / spong ba'i stobs dang / spobs pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers of the bodhisattvas are the power of superior intention, the power of analysis, the power of meditation, the power of patience, the power of wisdom, the power of elimination, the power of eloquence,

original: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: thos pa'i stobs dang / bsod nams kyi stobs dang / sgrub pa'i stobs te /
translated: the power of hearing, the power of merit, and the power of practice.

original: 'di dag gi bshad pa rgyas pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i 'grel pa nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi bshad pa rgyas pa ni mtshan yang dag par brjod pa'i 'grel pa nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of these should be understood from the commentary on the Praise of the Names.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; dbang po rnam par dbye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ; dbang po rnam par dbye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The ten powers of a tathagata are the power of knowledge of proper and improper conditions, the power of knowledge of the ripening of karma, the power of knowledge of various higher interests, the power of knowledge of various dhatus, the power of knowledge of superior and inferior faculties,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowledge of all paths and their respective destinations, the power of knowledge of concentrations, liberations, samƒÅdhis, and absorptions, the power of knowledge of the recollection of former existences, the power of knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: zag pa zad ba mkhyen pa'i stobs so //üîΩ'di dag gi bshad pa yang /
analyzed: zag pa zad ba mkhyen pa'i stobs so // 'di dag gi bshad pa yang /
translated: and the power of knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.

original: de nyid nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid nas shes par bya'o //
translated: Their explanations should be understood from that text.üîΩThe four fearlessnesses are as follows.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya ba la bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi zhes bya ba la bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: kye ma bdag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas pa na chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes bya bar bdag la gang gis kyang chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dge sbyong dang bram ze'i nang nas yang
analyzed: kye ma bdag yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes dam bcas pa na chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so zhes bya bar bdag la gang gis kyang chos dang ldan par rgol bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu dge sbyong dang bram ze'i nang nas yang
translated: When I declare, ‚ÄúI am a perfect buddha,‚Äù no one can oppose me by saying, ‚ÄúYou have not fully awakened to this teaching.‚Äù

original: dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
analyzed: dag par rjes su ma mthong ste /
translated: I do not see anyone in the world of gods, MƒÅras, BrahmƒÅs, renunciants, or brahmins who can oppose me with a valid reason.

original: rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa thob @153b pa 'di ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rgyu yang dag par rjes su ma mthong bas bdag bde ba thob pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa thob pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa thob @153b pa 'di ni dang po'o //
translated: Since I do not see any valid reason, I have attained security, fearlessness, and a ground of self-confidence.üîΩSimilarly, when I declare, ‚ÄúI have exhausted the defilements,‚Äù no one can oppose me by saying, ‚ÄúYou have not exhausted these defilements.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bdag zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas pa na zag pa 'di rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa na 'di ni sdug bsngal zad pa yang ma yin nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes zer ba'i gnas med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag zag pa zad do zhes dam bcas pa na zag pa 'di rnams zad par ma gyur to zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du bdag gis nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa na 'di ni sdug bsngal zad pa yang ma yin nges par 'byung ba yang ma yin zhes zer ba'i gnas med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Similarly, when I teach the path of definite emergence, no one can oppose me by saying, ‚ÄúThis is not the path to the exhaustion of suffering and definite emergence.‚Äù

original: gang yang bdag gis bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bshad pa ni 'di ni bar du gcod pa ma yin no zhes chos dang ldan par rgol ba dge sbyong dang bram ze'i nang nas zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: gang yang bdag gis bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bshad pa ni 'di ni bar du gcod pa ma yin no zhes chos dang ldan par rgol ba dge sbyong dang bram ze'i nang nas zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no // sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad thob pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi nub mo de bzhin gshegs pa mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nas nye bar bzung nas /
translated: The Dharma that I have taught is not an obstacle, but those who argue against the Dharma in a way that is contrary to the Dharma are called ‚Äúascetics and brahmins‚Äù as before.

original: gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: gang gi nub mo yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du de bzhin gshegs pa la 'khrul pa mi mnga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAttaining the eighteen distinct qualities of a buddha‚Äù means that from the night when the TathƒÅgata fully awakened to the night he attains final nirvƒÅ·πáa, the TathƒÅgata has no error,

original: ca mo mi mnga'o //üîΩdgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ca mo mi mnga'o // dgongs pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of alertness,üîΩno loss of samƒÅdhi,üîΩno loss of knowledge,üîΩno loss of freedom,üîΩno loss of the vision of awareness,üîΩno loss of enthusiasm,üîΩno loss of diligence,üîΩno loss of mindfulness,

original: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o //üîΩ'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //
analyzed: thugs mnyam par ma bzhag pa mi mnga'o // 'du shes sna tshogs mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of samƒÅdhi,üîΩno loss of wisdom,üîΩno loss of liberation,

original: kun tu ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //üîΩ'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: kun tu ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o // 'dun pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of the vision of awareness of liberation,üîΩno loss of the past,üîΩno loss of the future,

original: brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: no loss of the present.

original: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: dran pa nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any lapses in mindfulness.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any lapses in meditative absorption.

original: shes rab nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: shes rab nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any lapses in wisdom.

original: rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyams pa mi mnga'o //
translated: He does not have any lapses in liberation.

original: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: All his physical actions are preceded by wisdom and are guided by wisdom.

original: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: gsung gi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: All his verbal actions are preceded by wisdom and are guided by wisdom.

original: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi phrin las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro ba ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: All his mental actions are preceded by wisdom and are guided by wisdom.üîΩHis wisdom vision of the past is unobstructed and unimpeded.üîΩHis wisdom vision of the future is unobstructed and unimpeded.

original: 'das pa'i dus lam thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus lam thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang ; ma 'ongs pa'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus la ma thogs ma chags pa'i ye shes gzigs pa 'jug pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: His wisdom vision of the present is unobstructed and unimpeded.

original: 'di ni gzhon nu lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhon nu lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This, young man, is called the restraint of the body.‚Äù

original: thams cad du chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni lus kyi sdom pa zhes gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du chos kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni lus kyi sdom pa zhes gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Everywhere, the body that is the nature of the Dharma should be understood as the vow of the body.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni lus kyi sngom pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum ni lus kyi sngom pa'o //
translated: The three doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, are the vow of the body.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //üîΩchos dang / don dang / @154a * //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po ni lus kyi sdom pa'o // chos dang / don dang / @154a * //
translated: Great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity are the vow of the body.üîΩThe four correct knowledges of phenomena, meaning,

original: nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: words, and confidence are the vow of the body.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four establishments of mindfulness:üîΩthe establishment of mindfulness of body, feeling,

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang bzhi'o //
translated: mind, and phenomena.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa byas pa rnams spangs pa dang ; ma byas pa rnams mi byed pa dang / dge ba byas pa rnams spel bar byed pa dang / ma byas pa rnams byed pa la 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩ'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa ste rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba dbang po lnga dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi ni sdig pa byas pa rnams spangs pa dang ; ma byas pa rnams mi byed pa dang / dge ba byas pa rnams spel bar byed pa dang / ma byas pa rnams byed pa la 'dun pa bskyed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o // 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa ste rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ces bya ba dbang po lnga dang /
translated: The four right efforts are the generation of will to abandon evil that has been done, to not do that which has not been done, to increase good that has been done, and to do that which has not been done.üîΩThe four bases of magic power are will, effort, mind, and investigation. The five faculties are faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: gzhan de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'i stobs lnga po dang / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: gzhan de dag nyid stobs dang ldan par gyur pa'i stobs lnga po dang / dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The five powers are the same as the faculties, but are called powers because they have become powerful. The seven members of enlightenment are mindfulness, the investigation of phenomena, effort, joy, fitness, concentration, and equanimity.

original: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
analyzed: dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
translated: the limb of enlightenment that is right joy, the limb of enlightenment that is right pliancy, the limb of enlightenment that is right concentration, and the limb of enlightenment that is right equanimity.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad ni /
translated: The eightfold noble path is as follows:üîΩright view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: right concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lus kyi sdom pa'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i lus kyi sdom pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni lus kyi sdom pa'o zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i lus kyi sdom pa bstan to //
translated: The statement ‚Äúright concentration is the restraint of the body‚Äù teaches the ultimate restraint of the body.

original: da ni kun rdzob kyi lus kyi sdom pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni kun rdzob kyi lus kyi sdom pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the conventional restraint of the body will be explained.

original: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' srog gcod pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam srung ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnam par spong ba ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' srog gcod pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam srung ba dang / mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnam par spong ba ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: The restraint of body is the protection of the path of the ten virtues and the avoidance of the path of the ten nonvirtues, as stated in the lines beginning, ‚ÄúEndowed with which restraint of body, the bodhisattva gives up killing.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i bye brag rnams bstan pa'i phyir srang la g-yo byed pa dang zhes bya ba la /üîΩsrang la g-yo byed pa ni srang mtho dman du byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi dge ba'i bye brag rnams bstan pa'i phyir srang la g-yo byed pa dang zhes bya ba la / srang la g-yo byed pa ni srang mtho dman du byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, in order to teach the specific nonvirtues, there is the line, ‚Äúcheating with weights and sizes.‚ÄùüîΩCheating with weights is to make a scale go up and down.

original: tshad la g-yo byed pa ni bre phul mtho dman du byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad la g-yo byed pa ni bre phul mtho dman du byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Cheating with measures is to make a bushel go up and down.

original: nor la g-yo byed pa @154b ni bcos ma'i gser la sogs pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: nor la g-yo byed pa @154b ni bcos ma'i gser la sogs pa byed pa'o //
translated: Cheating with wealth is to make counterfeit gold and so on.

original: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba'i sems kyis bcings pa ni lcags sgrog la sogs pas bsdams pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas bslang ba'i sems kyis bcings pa ni lcags sgrog la sogs pas bsdams pa'o //
translated: The mind that is motivated by attachment, aversion, and confusion is bound by chains and so on.

original: gzung ba ni bcing ba'i gnas su bcug nas 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba ni bcing ba'i gnas su bcug nas 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Seizing is to be seized by the place of bondage.

original: rdeg pa ni dbyig pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rdeg pa ni dbyig pa la sogs pas so //
translated: Beating is with a stick, etc.

original: bsdigs pa ni 'di bzhin gyis shig / mi byed na khyod gnyen dang bcas pa 'chi bar bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bros par rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: bsdigs pa ni 'di bzhin gyis shig / mi byed na khyod gnyen dang bcas pa 'chi bar bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'bros par rtsom pa'o //
translated: Threatening is to say, Do it this way! or If you don't, I'll kill you and your relatives! and so on, when someone is about to flee.

original: gcad pa ni lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna la sogs pa la gcod pa'o //
analyzed: gcad pa ni lag pa dang / rkang pa dang / rna ba dang / sna la sogs pa la gcod pa'o //
translated: Cutting is to cut off hands, feet, ears, nose, etc.

original: dbug pa ni mdung la bskyon pa'o //
analyzed: dbug pa ni mdung la bskyon pa'o //
translated: Piercing is to impale someone on a stake.

original: zhe la gnon pas ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe la gnon pas ni gzhan gnod pa byed pa la mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Oppressing is to be intolerant of others' harm.

original: de dag las ldog pa ni lus kyi sdom pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las ldog pa ni lus kyi sdom pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Refraining from these is the restraint of body.

original: lag pa rgod pa dang rkang pa rgod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang don 'di nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lag pa rgod pa dang rkang pa rgod pa ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang don 'di nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: The same point is taught by not raising the hand or foot and so on.

original: bshad pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang lus kyi sdom pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa rnam pa gnyi ga yang lus kyi sdom pa ste /
translated: Both explanations are the restraint of body.

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhon nu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang gsungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhon nu sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to teach that it was also taught by the Tathagatas of the past, it is said, ‚ÄúYoung man, in the past, in times gone by‚Ä¶‚Äù and so forth.

original: lus kyi sdom pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor 'jug pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor 'jug pa tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The entrance into the samadhi of physical restraint was perfectly taught through the melody of verse.

original: ji ltar bar snang nam mkha' rnam dag ste //
analyzed: ji ltar bar snang nam mkha' rnam dag ste //
translated: Just as the sky in the middle of space is pure,

original: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni shin tu rnam par dag pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid can gyi sku ni shin tu rnam par dag pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: The body that has the nature of dharmata is extremely pure, naturally luminous.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par dag pa ni lus kyi sdom pa'o //
translated: Such purity is the restraint of the body.

original: de ni sgras bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni sgras bstan par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: That cannot be expressed through words,

original: tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi spyod yul las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is beyond the domain of speech.

original: ji ltar lus kyi sdom pa dben zhing stong pa yin pa ltar lus kyang stong pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi sdom pa dben zhing stong pa yin pa ltar lus kyang stong pa ste /
translated: Just as the restraint of the body is isolated and empty, the body is also empty.

original: lus kyi mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi mtshan nyid ni nam mkha'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the defining characteristic of the body is the defining characteristic of space.

original: lus dang sdom pa dag mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu nam mkha' zhes gdags pa'i tha snyad kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang sdom pa dag mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu nam mkha' zhes gdags pa'i tha snyad kyis 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The conventional designation ‚Äúspace‚Äù is used because the body and the vow have the same defining characteristic.

original: de bzhin du lus dang / sdom pa zhes bya ba'i gdags pa'i tha snyad kyang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus dang / sdom pa zhes bya ba'i gdags pa'i tha snyad kyang 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the same way, the conventional designation ‚Äúbody‚Äù and ‚Äúvow‚Äù are used.

original: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de 'drar sus shes pa //
analyzed: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de 'drar sus shes pa //
translated: Whoever knows the defining characteristic of the vow

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: in this way,

original: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu sus shes pa de la sdom pa nam yang med mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdom pa'i mtshan nyid 'di lta bu sus shes pa de la sdom pa nam yang med mi 'gyur te /
translated: for that person the vow will never cease to be.

original: nam yang sdom pa las ma gtogs pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam yang sdom pa las ma gtogs pa'i sdom pa ma yin pa rjes su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one never observes a non-vow apart from the vow.

original: @155a * // chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i zag pa med pa la nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: @155a * // chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i zag pa med pa la nyon mongs pa'i 'jug pa 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could the occurrence of the engagement of afflictions arise in the uncontaminated state, which is the attainment of the sameness of the nature of all phenomena?

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pas ni lus kyi sdom pa 'di mngon du shes par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pas ni lus kyi sdom pa 'di mngon du shes par mi nus te /
translated: Those who are under the influence of passion, hatred, and folly are not able to understand this restraint of the body.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa 'gal ba bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir lhan cig gnas pa 'gal ba bzlog par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Because it is opposed to passion, etc., it is difficult to overcome the opposition of their simultaneous presence.

original: zag pa med pa'i lus kyi sdom pa gang gis shes pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lus kyi sdom pa gang gis shes pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis 'khor bar skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the uncontaminated restraint of the body, one does not take birth in cyclic existence under the influence of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur kyang smon lam gyi dbang dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba len pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bar gyur kyang smon lam gyi dbang dang / bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba len pa la ni 'gal ba med do //
translated: Even though one is free from the afflictions, there is no contradiction in taking birth in existence through the power of vows and through intentional reincarnation.

original: dgra bcom pa yi chos ni de 'dra ste //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa yi chos ni de 'dra ste //
translated: The Dharma of the Arhats is like this.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this verse,

original: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis len par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du gang dag khams gsum la chags pa med pa de dag kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dgra bcom pa rnams las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis len par mi 'gyur ba bzhin du gang dag khams gsum la chags pa med pa de dag kyang de bzhin te /
translated: just as the Arhats do not take birth under the influence of karma and the afflictions, so also those who are free from attachment to the three realms are like that.

original: des lus kyi sdom pa shes pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: des lus kyi sdom pa shes pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: That is called the knowledge of the bodily restraint.

original: / lus kyi sdom pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / lus kyi sdom pa 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As for the line beginning ‚ÄúThis bodily restraint,‚Äù

original: don ni don dam pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: don ni don dam pa ste chos kyi sku'o //
translated: the meaning is the ultimate, which is the Dharma body.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yang dag pa gang yin pa ni yongs su gang ba'i phyir rab ni mchog ste sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes yang dag pa gang yin pa ni yongs su gang ba'i phyir rab ni mchog ste sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The supreme, which is the best, is called the restraint, because it is completely filled with the gnosis of the knowledge of all aspects, the equality of all phenomena.

original: don dam par ni tshig gis brjod du med pas ji ltar bshad par nus nas /
analyzed: don dam par ni tshig gis brjod du med pas ji ltar bshad par nus nas /
translated: But since it is inexpressible by words in the ultimate sense, how can it be explained?

original: ji ltar lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya zhe na /üîΩgsungs pa / don la zhugs la ngas ni don bstan te //
analyzed: ji ltar lus kyi sdom pa zhes bya zhe na / gsungs pa / don la zhugs la ngas ni don bstan te //
translated: How is it called the bodily restraint?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said:üîΩ‚ÄúI teach the meaning to those who are intent on the meaning.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob kyang rang gi ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa med pa don dam pa la zhugs pa rnams la ngas bstan te //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyang rang gi ngo bo la mngon par zhen pa med pa don dam pa la zhugs pa rnams la ngas bstan te //
translated: I teach the conventional to those who are intent on the ultimate, without clinging to their own entity.

original: chos kyi sku'i dbang gis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la bshad pa'i rnam pa'i snang ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku'i dbang gis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams la bshad pa'i rnam pa'i snang ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: By the power of the Dharma Body, the appearance of the teaching also arises for those who are fortunate.

original: don med rnam spangs don la gnas pa rnams //
analyzed: don med rnam spangs don la gnas pa rnams //
translated: Those who are established in the meaning, having abandoned the meaningless,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: and so on.

original: gang don dang mngon par ldan pa de don ma yin pa spangs nas lus kyi sdom pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang don dang mngon par ldan pa de don ma yin pa spangs nas lus kyi sdom pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are endowed with the meaning, having abandoned the meaningless, will be established in the restraint of the body.üîΩWhat is the meaning that is expressed in the Victor's teaching?

original: rgyal ba'i bstan la don du gang brjod dang // zhes bya ba ni blo dman pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i bstan la don du gang brjod dang // zhes bya ba ni blo dman pa rnams kyi the tshom bsal ba'i phyir dris pa /
translated: This is asked in order to dispel the doubts of those of lesser intelligence.

original: don ni gang zhig yin ji ltar ni shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni gang zhig yin ji ltar ni shes par bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the meaning? How is it to be known?

original: chos thams cad stong pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya bas de bzhin nyid kyi don ni don to //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba zhes bya bas de bzhin nyid kyi don ni don to //
translated: The meaning of suchness is the meaning, as stated in all phenomena are empty, luminous by nature.

original: ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na @155b ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar shes par 'gyur zhe na @155b ye shes kyi rang gi ngo bo bstan pa yin no //
translated: How is it to be known? The nature of wisdom is taught.

original: don tshul rang bzhin gang gis shes pa ni //
analyzed: don tshul rang bzhin gang gis shes pa ni //
translated: By what nature is the meaning known?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi don gyi tshul gyis rang bzhin shes pa de ni lus kyi sdom pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi don gyi tshul gyis rang bzhin shes pa de ni lus kyi sdom pa shes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, one who knows the nature of things knows the restraint of the body.

original: gang gis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa dang gsog shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo nas bdag med pa dang gsog shes par bya ste /
translated: By means of the doors of liberation, namely emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, one should know that all things are insubstantial and unreal.

original: des ni lus kyi sdom pa shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni lus kyi sdom pa shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one knows the restraint of the body.

original: dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo med pa gang rig par gyur pa de ni dngos po thams cad la chags par mi 'gyur te mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad kyi dngos po med pa'i ngo bo med pa gang rig par gyur pa de ni dngos po thams cad la chags par mi 'gyur te mngon par zhen par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who knows the nature of the insubstantiality of all things will not be attached to any thing, will not cling to anything.

original: de mngon par zhen pa med pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mngon par zhen pa med pas mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not cling, he attains the signless concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pas lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi gnas ngan len sdom pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he attains concentration, the unwholesome tendencies of body, speech, and mind, which are characterized by lack of restraint, do not arise.

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pas bzung nas mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log sgro btags pas sdom pa ma yin pa 'khor ba'i rgyu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams la mtshan mar 'dzin pas bzung nas mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log sgro btags pas sdom pa ma yin pa 'khor ba'i rgyu 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By apprehending the signs of form, sound, smell, taste, and touch, and by clinging to them, the cause of sa·πÉsƒÅra, which is not a vow, arises through mistaken superimposition.

original: grog ma kun gyis g-yos shing 'gul mi nus //
analyzed: grog ma kun gyis g-yos shing 'gul mi nus //
translated: Even if all the ants in the world were to try, they could not move it.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i tshul la rab tu gnas pa ri rab ltar mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can de la ji ltar grog mas ri rab ltar 'dod chags la sogs pas g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang dag pa'i tshul la rab tu gnas pa ri rab ltar mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin can de la ji ltar grog mas ri rab ltar 'dod chags la sogs pas g-yo bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, one who abides in the correct way, whose nature is immovable like Mount Meru, how could that one be moved by desire and so forth, like Mount Meru by ants?

original: mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir yongs su brtags pa nye bar bzung nas /
analyzed: mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir yongs su brtags pa nye bar bzung nas /
translated: In order to show the impossibility of that, he gives an example:

original: nam mkha' la ri mo bri bar nus shing /
analyzed: nam mkha' la ri mo bri bar nus shing /
translated: It is possible that one could paint a picture in the sky,üîΩand that one could grasp the sky with one's hand,

original: lag pas nam mkha' la bzung bar nus par 'gyur srid kyang ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas bskyod par mi nus so ;
analyzed: lag pas nam mkha' la bzung bar nus par 'gyur srid kyang ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pas bskyod par mi nus so ;
translated: but one abiding in samƒÅdhi cannot be moved by desire and so forth.

original: gang yang sems can thams cad kyi sgra thams cad sgrom du bcug nas bcings par nus kyang srid /
analyzed: gang yang sems can thams cad kyi sgra thams cad sgrom du bcug nas bcings par nus kyang srid /
translated: It is possible that all the sounds of all sentient beings could be put into a box and bound.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma'i 'od dang / glog dang / rlung rnams rgya'i nang du bzung nas bcings par nus kyang srid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni thams cad du mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no ;üîΩ/ spyod yul gang gnas lus kyi sdom pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma'i 'od dang / glog dang / rlung rnams rgya'i nang du bzung nas bcings par nus kyang srid ces bya ba la sogs pas ni thams cad du mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa yin no ; / spyod yul gang gnas lus kyi sdom pa ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Similarly, it is possible that the light of the sun, lightning, and the wind could be caught and bound inside a vase.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lus kyi sdom pa la gnas pa de la ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩdug dang mtshon la sogs pas kyang @156a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag lus kyi sdom pa la gnas pa de la ni 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro // dug dang mtshon la sogs pas kyang @156a * //
translated: The verse beginning ‚ÄúThe restraint of body, speech, and mind‚Äù teaches that the bodhisattvas who abide in the restraint of body, speech, and mind do not give rise to any worldly dharmas, afflictions, or secondary afflictions.

original: gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They are not harmed by poison, weapons, and so on.

original: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas 'jigs pa dang skrag pa thams cad spangs pa yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas 'jigs pa dang skrag pa thams cad spangs pa yin /
translated: Similarly, those who abide in meditative concentration have abandoned all fear and terror.

original: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus pa'i don byed pa yin /
translated: It is the benefit of all beings without exception.

original: zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang rab tu thob pa ni 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang kun nas 'khrugs pa dang ; phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: zhi ba dang rab tu zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang rab tu thob pa ni 'jigs pa dang / skrag pa dang kun nas 'khrugs pa dang ; phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: The attainment of mastery over the meditative concentrations of peace and complete peace is the liberation from the conceptual thoughts of the afflictions such as fear, terror, agitation, envy, and stinginess.

original: gang gi phyir lus kyi sdom pa la legs pa bslabs pa ni bdag dang bdag gi 'du shes dang bral zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus kyi sdom pa la legs pa bslabs pa ni bdag dang bdag gi 'du shes dang bral zhing /
translated: Because one who is well trained in the restraint of the body is free from the discriminations of self and other.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud bye ba brgya stong gis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral bas bdud bye ba brgya stong gis kyang bskyod par mi nus so //
translated: And because one is free from all fears, the hosts of mƒÅras cannot disturb him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan pa'i phyir sdom pa gang brjod pa ni gzhung gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan pa'i phyir sdom pa gang brjod pa ni gzhung gi sgo nas so //
translated: The restraint that is taught for the benefit of bodhisattvas is in terms of the text.

original: bshad pa ni bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi man ngag bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa ni bsgom pa'i khyad par gyi man ngag bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the teaching of the special instructions for meditation.

original: rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa pha rol rgol ba ma lus pas rab tu sbyar ba'i tshad ma ngan pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa ba'i gzhung gi 'dod pa la sbyor ba'i tshad ma dang ldan pa'i
analyzed: rab tu bstan pa zhes bya ba ni bdud dang mu stegs la sogs pa pha rol rgol ba ma lus pas rab tu sbyar ba'i tshad ma ngan pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa ba'i gzhung gi 'dod pa la sbyor ba'i tshad ma dang ldan pa'i
translated: ‚ÄúTeaching‚Äù means that, in order to refute the bad logic applied by all opponents such as MƒÅra and tƒ´rthikas, one should possess the logic that applies the assertions of the scriptures of the sugatas.

original: chos bdag med par rab tu bsgrubs nas gzhung dang / don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩchos rnams kun la ye shes thogs pa med //
analyzed: chos bdag med par rab tu bsgrubs nas gzhung dang / don rab tu bstan pa'i phyir / chos rnams kun la ye shes thogs pa med //
translated: Having thus established the selflessness of phenomena, in order to teach the scriptures and their meaning,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: the text says, ‚ÄúThe wisdom of all phenomena is unimpeded.‚Äù

original: thogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par byang chub nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgya cus brgyan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thun mong ma yin pa nges par sgrub par 'dod pas ji skad gsungs pa'i lus kyi sdom pa bsgom par bya'o ;
analyzed: thogs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par byang chub nas mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgya cus brgyan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thun mong ma yin pa nges par sgrub par 'dod pas ji skad gsungs pa'i lus kyi sdom pa bsgom par bya'o ;
translated: Having fully awakened to the omniscient wisdom of all aspects of all tathƒÅgatas, free from all obstructions, one should meditate on the vows of the body as they are taught, wishing to definitely accomplish the uncommon body of the tathƒÅgata, adorned with the thirty-two marks and the eighty minor marks.

original: / lus kyi sdom pa dang yang dag par ldan pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rnyed dka' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: / lus kyi sdom pa dang yang dag par ldan pa la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rnyed dka' ba ma yin no //
translated: And for one who is endowed with the restraint of the body, even unexcelled perfect enlightenment is not difficult to attain.

original: drang srong chen po'i chos 'di gang 'dod pa //
analyzed: drang srong chen po'i chos 'di gang 'dod pa //
translated: Those who desire this Dharma of the Great Sage

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rtogs par 'dod pa des kyang lus kyi sdom pa la bslabs na /
analyzed: gang dag sangs rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa rtogs par 'dod pa des kyang lus kyi sdom pa la bslabs na /
translated: Those who desire to realize the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha, if they train in the restraint of the body,

original: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur pas phyag bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi mchod rten du gyur pas phyag bya ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: they will become worthy of veneration as a caitya for the entire realm of sentient beings.

original: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha such as the ten powers have already been explained and should not be explained again.

original: 'di 'dra'i lus kyi sdom pa thos nas ni //
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i lus kyi sdom pa thos nas ni //
translated: Having heard this kind of restraint of the body

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: @156b rgyal po khyad par sems des lus kyi sdom pa thos nas dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba thob nas rab tu byung ngo //
analyzed: @156b rgyal po khyad par sems des lus kyi sdom pa thos nas dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba thob nas rab tu byung ngo //
translated: King Vi≈õe·π£acintin, having heard the restraint of the body, attained joy and delight and went forth.

original: rab tu byung nas kyang lo bye ba phrag bcu tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas kyang lo bye ba phrag bcu tshangs par spyod pa spyad do //
translated: And after going forth, he practiced pure conduct for ten million years.

original: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi yang bsgoms nas de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i gnas bzhi yang bsgoms nas de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa la bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: And after cultivating the four divine abodes, he served immeasurable Tathagatas.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa skyon med 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa skyon med 'gyur //
translated: And: ‚ÄúHis morality will be pure and faultless.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhon nu gzhan zhig yin nam sems gyur na //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / gzhon nu gzhan zhig yin nam sems gyur na //
translated: And: ‚ÄúYou may think, ‚ÄòWas he another?‚Äô

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i tshe de'i dus kyi rgyal po khyad par sems gang yin pa de ni gzhan zhig yin snyam na de ltar mi lta ste sh'akya thub pa nga nyid de'i tshe rgyal po khyad par sems zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungsüîΩso // de ni lus kyi sdom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de'i tshe de'i dus kyi rgyal po khyad par sems gang yin pa de ni gzhan zhig yin snyam na de ltar mi lta ste sh'akya thub pa nga nyid de'i tshe rgyal po khyad par sems zhes bya bar gyur to zhes gsungs so // de ni lus kyi sdom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: But you should not see it like that. I myself was the king Vi≈õe·π£a-cinti at that time.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag par bya'o zhes /
translated: And: ‚ÄúThen the Blessed One, in order to teach the benefits of the bodily restraint, said, ‚ÄòTherefore, the bodily conduct should be purified.‚Äô‚Äù

analyzed: gzhon nu khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i skye bo la ltos nas slobs shig ces bstan pa'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gi phyir lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa la kun du spyad par bya zhes som nyi za pa'i phyir lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' chen po ni sems can dmyal
translated: The phrase young man, you should train in this way is a teaching for those who are to be trained in the future.üîΩWhy is that? means why is it that you should train in the purity of bodily conduct?

original: ba dag la mi 'jigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ba dag la mi 'jigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because of doubt, the text says, The bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva who has pure bodily conduct has no fear of the hells, and so on.

original: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu yod pa ma yin no //

original: dug dang / me dang / chu dang / mtshon dang / seng ge dang / glang dang / stag dang / gnod sbyin dag gis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dug dang / me dang / chu dang / mtshon dang / seng ge dang / glang dang / stag dang / gnod sbyin dag gis kyang 'jigs par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: 'jigs pa'i rgyu mi dge ba med pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu dge ba'i rang bzhin gyis lus kyi sdom pa la mi dge ba phra mo tsam gyi gnas kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no cause for fear, and because there is no opportunity for even the slightest nonvirtue, since the nature of the body is exclusively virtuous.

analyzed: yang lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni /

analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di lag mthil tu bzhag ste /

original: ta la gcig tsam mam /
analyzed: ta la gcig tsam mam /
translated: or he can throw it even farther.

original: ta la bdun tsam gyi bar du steng du 'phen par byed do zhes bya bas ni stobs rnams kyi mthar thug pa thob pa'i bar yang lus kyi sdom pa legs par bsdams pa la rnyed dka' ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ta la bdun tsam gyi bar du steng du 'phen par byed do zhes bya bas ni stobs rnams kyi mthar thug pa thob pa'i bar yang lus kyi sdom pa legs par bsdams pa la rnyed dka' ba ma yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that even the attainment of the ultimate perfection of the powers is not difficult for one who is well restrained by the restraint of the body.

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang cho 'phrul mchog gi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te @157a * //

analyzed: zhes bya bas ni lus kyi sdom pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi rten nyid du brten pa yin no //

original: kun tshogs pas na rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: kun tshogs pas na rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: It is a miracle because it is a gathering of all.üîΩThe miracle is the various kinds of miracles that occur in connection with the miracle.üîΩThe miracle is the various kinds of miracles that occur in connection with the miracle.üîΩThe miracle is the various kinds of miracles that occur in connection with the miracle.

analyzed: rtsig pa dang / ra ba dang / brag la sogs pa la thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas rnams la thogs pa med par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The miracle is the various kinds of miracles that occur in connection with the miracle.üîΩThe miracle is the various kinds

analyzed: des na thams cad la thogs pa med par 'gro ba zhes bya'o // nam mkha' la yang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du 'gro bar byed la / sa la yang steng du 'byung bar byed /
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúone who goes everywhere without obstruction.‚ÄùüîΩHe goes through space as he wishes.üîΩHe goes through the earth as if through water.

analyzed: byi'u zul yang byed de / dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no //

analyzed: chu la yang sa la bya ba bzhin mi 'bying bar 'gro ba'o //
translated: For example, he goes through the water without sinking as if it were the earth.

original: cho 'phrul zung ston cing 'bar ba dang / char 'bebs pa'i mtshan nyid ston te ;
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung ston cing 'bar ba dang / char 'bebs pa'i mtshan nyid ston te ;
translated: He displays the miracles of the pairs, blazing with fire and raining from the clouds.

analyzed: bskal ba sreg pa'i me lta bu'i me'i phung po lus kyi phyogs gcig nas ston par byed do //
translated: He displays a mass of fire like the conflagration that consumes the world at the end of the cosmic age, from one side of his body.

analyzed: 'jig pa'i dus kyi sprin gyi char gyi rgyun bzhin du lus kyi phyogs gcig nas chu'i phung po 'bebs par byed do //

analyzed: bskal pa sreg pa'i me'i phung po gang yin pa yang kha'i dbugs gcig gis zhi bar byed do ;
translated: He extinguishes with a single breath from his mouth the mass of fire that consumes the world at the end of the cosmic age.

original: / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyi skyil mo krung gcig gis dbang sgyur ro //
analyzed: / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten gyi bar du lus kyi skyil mo krung gcig gis dbang sgyur ro //
translated: He has power over the entire world up to the Brahma world with a single bodily posture.

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: Having explained the miracle powers, now, in order to explain the divine ear and so forth, he says:üîΩTherefore, young man, the bodhisattva who has pure physical conduct,

original: gang thag ring ba dang gzhan dag kyang rung /
analyzed: gang thag ring ba dang gzhan dag kyang rung /
translated: whether far or near,

analyzed: phra ba dang rgya che ba yang thos so zhes bya ba'o //
