original: de bzhin du lha'i @157b sna'i dbang po /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i @157b sna'i dbang po /
translated: Likewise, with the divine sense of smell,

original: mi'i las 'das pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dri'i khyad par yid du 'ong ba dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu de dag thams cad tshor ro //
analyzed: mi'i las 'das pas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dri'i khyad par yid du 'ong ba dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba'i rgyu de dag thams cad tshor ro //
translated: Since it is beyond human, it smells all the pleasant smells in all the world systems, the causes of joy, happiness, and mental pleasure.

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams ni mnga' thob pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / yid kyi dbang po rnams ni mnga' thob pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: The faculties of eye, ear, and mind are obtained as having objects.

original: gsum ni gzhan no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan na ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i dri rnams sna'i dbang pos 'dzin par nus zhes zer na /
analyzed: gsum ni gzhan no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis bstan na ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa'i dri rnams sna'i dbang pos 'dzin par nus zhes zer na /
translated: When it is taught by the phrase, ‚ÄúThe other three are different,‚Äù how is it possible for the nose faculty to apprehend the smells of immeasurable world systems?

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan rnams kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan rnams kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is taught in terms of those other than the TathƒÅgatas and the great bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang po rnams ni yul thams cad kyi yul can te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang po rnams ni yul thams cad kyi yul can te /
translated: The faculties of the TathƒÅgatas are the objects of all objects.

original: don thams cad kyang spyod yul pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: don thams cad kyang spyod yul pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The phrase, ‚ÄúThey are the domain of all objects‚Äù teaches that.

original: sems tsam so sor snang ba la bar chad la sogs pa ni kun du rtog pa'i bzos bsgrubs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems tsam so sor snang ba la bar chad la sogs pa ni kun du rtog pa'i bzos bsgrubs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad tsam du zad kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: The CittamƒÅtra‚Äôs response to the objection that the sense faculties would cognize all objects, such as the nose faculty cognizing smell and taste, is that such faults are established by the power of conceptualization and are mere worldly conventions, but not ultimately.

original: sna'i dbang po dang / ro'i dbang po dang / reg pa'i dbang po rnams kyis thams cad shes zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po dang / ro'i dbang po dang / reg pa'i dbang po rnams kyis thams cad shes zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The sense faculties of the nose, taste, and touch cognize everything.

original: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi yul can yin pa nyid du gal te rnam par 'jog par byed na mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ro la sogs pa yang myong ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba'i lan gdab par dka'o zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi yul can yin pa nyid du gal te rnam par 'jog par byed na mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ro la sogs pa yang myong ba thob par 'gyur ro zhes rgol ba'i lan gdab par dka'o zhe na /
translated: If it is posited that all of them are subjects of all objects, then it would follow that one would experience the taste of feces and so on. It is difficult to respond to this objection.

original: rgol ba 'di ni lan gdab par 'os par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgol ba 'di ni lan gdab par 'os par yang ma yin te /
translated: This objection is not one that needs a response.

original: gzhon nu ma lan gyi tshig mi shes pas kun nas bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhon nu ma lan gyi tshig mi shes pas kun nas bskyed pa yin no //
translated: It is generated by a young woman who does not know how to respond.

original: de yang sgyu mas sprul pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du phan tshun sems rnam par 'khrul pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de yang sgyu mas sprul pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du phan tshun sems rnam par 'khrul pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Moreover, just as one experiences things emanated by an illusion, it is merely the mutual confusion of minds.

original: gang du cung zhig kyang nyams su myong ba ni med de /
analyzed: gang du cung zhig kyang nyams su myong ba ni med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that is experienced,

original: rdzas su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas su grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist substantially.

original: gzhan gyi rnam par rmongs pa bzlog pa tsam de'i dgongs pa yin no zhes pa de bzhin du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad gzung bar bya'i /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam par rmongs pa bzlog pa tsam de'i dgongs pa yin no zhes pa de bzhin du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir kun rdzob tu dngos po thams cad gzung bar bya'i /
translated: In order to teach that the intention is merely to eliminate the confusion of others, he says, ‚ÄúAll things should be understood as conventional,

original: don dam par ni gzod ma nas zhi ba skye ba med pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: don dam par ni gzod ma nas zhi ba skye ba med pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: but ultimately they are primordially peaceful and unarisen.‚Äù

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa ;
translated: In order to teach the knowledge of the categories of mind, he says,

original: sems can pha rol dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can pha rol dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of the minds of other sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can pha rol zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi spyi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can pha rol zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi spyi bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, ‚Äúother sentient beings‚Äù indicates the general category of sentient beings.

original: gang zag pha rol zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi khyad par ro //üîΩsems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya @158a * //
analyzed: gang zag pha rol zhes bya ba ni so sor nges pa'i sems can gyi khyad par ro // sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang dpyod pa yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te zhes bya @158a * //
translated: ‚ÄúOther persons‚Äù indicates the specific instances of individual sentient beings.

original: ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúOne knows correctly and exactly the conceptual thoughts and mental processes of other sentient beings,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / zhe sdang dang bral ba dang / gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: with attachment, without attachment, with aversion, without aversion, with delusion, without delusion, with afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: without afflictions, and so on up to: with a mind that is not liberated, with a mind that is liberated.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon par shes pa gsungs pa /
translated: The superknowledge of the recollection of past lives is explained:

original: des sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
analyzed: des sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran te /
translated: He recollects his various past lives.

original: skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i skye ba'i bar du yang rjes su dran no //
analyzed: skye ba gcig kyang rjes su dran pas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i skye ba'i bar du yang rjes su dran no //
translated: He recollects one birth, and so on up to: he recollects many hundreds of thousands of ko·π≠is of niyutas of hundreds of thousands of past lives.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal ba dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa gcig nas 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du yang rjes su dran te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal ba dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa gcig nas 'jig pa dang / 'chags pa'i bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma'i bar du yang rjes su dran te /
translated: They recall one eon of destruction and formation, and they recall many eons of destruction and formation, up to many quintillions of eons of destruction and formation.

original: bdag sngon gnas che ge mo zhig tu skyes te ming ni 'di zhes bya /üîΩrus ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: bdag sngon gnas che ge mo zhig tu skyes te ming ni 'di zhes bya / rus ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: They recall: ‚ÄúI was born in such and such a place. My name was such and such.üîΩMy family was such and such.

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya /
translated: My caste was such and such.

original: kha dog ni 'di 'dra ba zhig / zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: kha dog ni 'di 'dra ba zhig / zas ni 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: My color was such and such. I ate such and such food.

original: bdag gi 'tsho ba ni 'di 'dra /üîΩtshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam zhig thub /
analyzed: bdag gi 'tsho ba ni 'di 'dra / tshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam zhig thub /
translated: My life was such and such.üîΩMy lifespan was such and such.

original: yun ni 'di srid gcig tu gnas gnas /
analyzed: yun ni 'di srid gcig tu gnas gnas /
translated: I lived for such and such a long time.

original: bde pa dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong myong /
analyzed: bde pa dang sdug bsngal ni 'di lta bu zhig myong myong /
translated: I experienced such and such happiness and suffering.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas ni tshe go mo zhig tu skyes /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas ni tshe go mo zhig tu skyes /
translated: After I died there, I was reborn in such and such a place.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas ni 'dir skyes so zhes rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / yul phyogs dang bcas pa dang / gzhi ci las gyur pa dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no zhes bya ba ni rtogs sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas ni 'dir skyes so zhes rnam pa dang bcas pa dang / yul phyogs dang bcas pa dang / gzhi ci las gyur pa dang bcas par sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no zhes bya ba ni rtogs sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: Thus, with respect to the past, he recollects many aspects of his former abodes, together with their characteristics, their places, and the reasons for which they came to be.

original: lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa gsungs pa /üîΩde lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho pa dang / skye ba yang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i mig gi mngon par shes pa gsungs pa / de lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las 'das pas sems can 'chi 'pho pa dang / skye ba yang 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa rnam par dag pa'i khyad par gyis mthong ngo //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye is explained.

original: kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa la sogs pa yang ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: kha dog bzang ba dang / kha dog ngan pa la sogs pa yang ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag par rab tu shes so //
translated: By means of the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings dying and being born, inferior and superior, beautiful and ugly, fortunate and unfortunate, according to the consequences of their deeds.

original: sems can 'di rnams ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: sems can 'di rnams ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He understands correctly that these beings, who have been endowed with bad bodily actions,

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: with bad verbal actions,

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and with bad mental actions,üîΩhave, on account of these causes, on account of these conditions,

original: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lus kyi nyes par spyod pa yang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: There are three kinds of bodily misconduct.

original: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: ngag gi nyes par spyod pa ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four kinds of verbal misconduct.

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of mental misconduct.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pa ste bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang yang dag par ldan pa ste bcas pa'o //
translated: This is the complete explanation of the ten kinds of unwholesome action.

original: 'phags pa la skur pa ni 'phags pa'i lam su na 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa ni 'phags pa'i lam su na 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: Denigration of the noble ones is the rejection of the noble path.

original: log par lta ba ni las dang 'bras bu @158b med par lta ba la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni las dang 'bras bu @158b med par lta ba la zhugs pa'o //
translated: Wrong view is the belief that there is no action and no result.

original: log par lta ba'i chos kyi las yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i chos kyi las yang dag par 'dzin pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the cause of taking up the Dharma of wrong view, when the body breaks up and dies, one is born in the lower realms, in the hells.

original: de dag las bzlog pa'i lam lan na tan byas pas ni bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa'i lam lan na tan byas pas ni bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten lha rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By practicing the path that is the opposite of those, one is born in the happy realms, in the heavens.

original: mngon par shes pa lnga'i 'go rims 'chol ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga'i 'go rims 'chol ba ni /
translated: The order of the five superknowledges is mixed up.

original: 'dir mdo ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa yin pas brtag par bya ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir mdo ji lta ba bzhin du bshad pa yin pas brtag par bya ba med do //
translated: Here, since it is explained just as in the sutra, there is nothing to analyze.

original: de ltar rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa nges par bstan nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar rim gyis mngon par rtogs pa nges par bstan nas skad cig gcig gis mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Thus, having taught the realization in stages, in order to teach the realization of complete enlightenment in a single moment,üîΩthe sutra says:

original: gzhon nu lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis gang cung zad shes par bya ba dang / blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba dang /
analyzed: gzhon nu lus kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'i shes rab kyis gang cung zad shes par bya ba dang / blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba dang /
translated: Prince, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva whose physical conduct is pure, with the praj√±ƒÅ that arises in a single moment, knows, hears,üîΩsees, and fully realizes all that is to be known, seen, heard,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya ba dang / rnam par 'phrul par bya ba de thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par bya ba dang / rnam par 'phrul par bya ba de thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: fully realized, and manifested, just as it is.

original: thos so // mthong ngo //
analyzed: thos so // mthong ngo //
translated: He hears, sees,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and fully realizes.

original: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa //
analyzed: don de dag nyid tshigs su bcad pas gsungs pa //
translated: He fully realizes those very topics.

original: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' skyob pa yi //
translated: The bodhisattva, the protector,

original: mngon par shes pa'i rim pa bstan //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rim pa bstan // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The stages of the higher perceptions are taught.

original: mngon par shes pa'i rim pa nges par bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa la mkhas pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa'i rim pa nges par bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa la mkhas pa shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Here, the teaching on the stages of the higher perceptions is for the sake of understanding the bodhisattva's expertise in realization.

original: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas na //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas na //
translated: By abiding in concentration,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes kyang bya //
translated: one is also called a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig la gnas pas kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin na yang gang yang rna bas kyang rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig la gnas pas kyang de la byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba yin na yang gang yang rna bas kyang rnam par sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: If one is called a bodhisattva by merely abiding in concentration, then in order to purify the ear,

original: de dag rna ba rnam sbyangs te //
analyzed: de dag rna ba rnam sbyangs te //
translated: they purify the ear,

original: lha yi rna ba bsam mi khyab //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lha yi rna ba bsam mi khyab // ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and the divine ear is inconceivable.

original: de lha'i rna bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos nyan to //
analyzed: de lha'i rna bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gsungs pa'i chos nyan to //
translated: There, by the divine ear, one hears the Dharma spoken by all the buddhas.

original: de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dri'i khyad par rnams ji ltar 'di na 'dug pa bzhin du lha'i snas snom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dri'i khyad par rnams ji ltar 'di na 'dug pa bzhin du lha'i snas snom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: He smells the various scents of the great trichiliocosm, just as they are, with his divine nose.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i ye shes pa rnams skad cig gcig dan ldan pa'i shes pa sa lus kyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa la gnas nas nges par sgrub par byed do //üîΩma lus rnam dag nam @159a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i ye shes pa rnams skad cig gcig dan ldan pa'i shes pa sa lus kyi sdom pa rnam par dag pa la gnas nas nges par sgrub par byed do // ma lus rnam dag nam @159a * //
translated: Similarly, the knowledge of the minds of others and the knowledge of recollecting past lives are accomplished in one moment of knowledge, based on the pure bodily vow.

original: mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi lus //
analyzed: mkha' lta bu'i chos kyi lus //
translated: The body of Dharma, which is like space,

original: bdag nyid rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi sku ru gsungs //
analyzed: bdag nyid rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi sku ru gsungs //
translated: is said to be the body of perfect Buddhahood.

original: de yi sdom pa byang chub mchog gtso rtogs gyur pa //
analyzed: de yi sdom pa byang chub mchog gtso rtogs gyur pa //
translated: The vow of that is the supreme enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas zhes bstan de ni chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bstan de ni chos kyi dbyings //
translated: which is taught to be the Buddha, the realm of Dharma.

original: lus kyi sdom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i le'u ste sum cu rtsa dgu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the commentary to the thirty-ninth chapter, showing the benefits of the vow of the body.

original: lus kyi sdom pa'i rjes la ngag gi sdom par btu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa'i rjes la ngag gi sdom par btu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand the verbal vow after the bodily vow,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúThen the BhagavƒÅn said,‚Äù and so forth.

original: gzhon nu de la ngag gi sdom pa gang zhe na /üîΩngag gi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: gzhon nu de la ngag gi sdom pa gang zhe na / ngag gi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa drug cu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung dbyangs thogs pa med pa /
translated: ‚ÄúYoung man, what is the verbal vow?üîΩBy possessing the verbal vow, the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva will attain the unobstructed,

original: bsam gyis mi khyad pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyad pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: inconceivable buddha speech endowed with sixty aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad nges par sgrub pa'i phyir dang ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste 'di dag ni lus kyi sdom pa'i skabs su rgyas pa bshad pas yang bshad pa ma byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad nges par sgrub pa'i phyir dang ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste 'di dag ni lus kyi sdom pa'i skabs su rgyas pa bshad pas yang bshad pa ma byas so //
translated: Since these are explained extensively in the context of physical vows, they are not explained again.

original: gzhan yang ngag gi sdom pa gang dang ldan pas byang chub sems dpa' srog gcod pa spong bar 'gyur ba dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma'i tshig dang / tshig rtsub po dang /

translated: Moreover, what is the verbal vow that bodhisattvas possess that causes them to abandon taking life, taking what is not given, engaging in impure conduct, lying, divisive speech, harsh speech,

original: 'khyal par smra ba spangs par gyur pa dang / pha ma dang slob dpon gang smra bar bya bar bya ba ma yin pa'i tshig mi smra ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mi smod pa dang / tshig gzhan gang nyes pa dang ldan pa'i tshig de dag spangs pa yin te tshig de dag la yang mi dmigs te mi rtog / rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: 'khyal par smra ba spangs par gyur pa dang / pha ma dang slob dpon gang smra bar bya bar bya ba ma yin pa'i tshig mi smra ba dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mi smod pa dang / tshig gzhan gang nyes pa dang ldan pa'i tshig de dag spangs pa yin te tshig de dag la yang mi dmigs te mi rtog / rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: They avoid speaking nonsense, and do not speak words that are inappropriate to their parents and teachers. They do not criticize the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, and they avoid other words that are faulty. They do not focus on those words, do not conceptualize them, and do not think of them.

original: mi lta / mngon par chags par mi byed de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: mi lta / mngon par chags par mi byed de zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They do not look at them, and do not become attached to them.

original: gang gi phyir brag ca lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang ; smig rgyu lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes shes nas dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar de dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brag ca lta bu dang / sprul pa lta bu dang ; smig rgyu lta bu dang / mig yor lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes shes nas dngos po med pa nyid kyi phyir nye bar de dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they know that they are like an echo, like a magical creation, like a mirage, like an optical aberration, and like an illusion, they do not focus on them because they are non-existent.

original: mi rtog pas na mngon par mi zhen pas de dag gi sdom pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mi rtog pas na mngon par mi zhen pas de dag gi sdom pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Since they do not conceptualize them, they do not become attached to them. Therefore, they are called ‚Äòtheir restraint.‚Äô

original: dag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ngan song thams cad kyis mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dag gi spyod pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni ngan song thams cad kyis mi 'jigs zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattva whose conduct is pure is not afraid of any bad migrations.

original: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstan pa ni go sla bsam bkrol lo //
analyzed: don 'di dag nyid tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis bstan pa ni go sla bsam bkrol lo //
translated: The meaning of these is taught in verses that are easy to understand.

original: chos kyi nges tshig rtog pa ngag gi sdom pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi nges tshig rtog pa ngag gi sdom pa ste /
translated: The definition of phenomena is the restraint of speech.üîΩAll the words of the Buddha are pure.

original: sangs rgyas gsung rnams thams cad rnam par dag / ting 'dzin rang bzhin ting nge 'dzin dngos por gsungs //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung rnams thams cad rnam par dag / ting 'dzin rang bzhin ting nge 'dzin dngos por gsungs //
translated: Concentration is said to be the nature of concentration.

original: gang phyir @160a * //
analyzed: gang phyir @160a * //
translated: Because

analyzed: tshig gis bstan pas rnam par spros //

original: ngag gi sdom pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: ngag gi sdom pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /

original: // / ngag gi sdom pa'i rjes la yid kyi sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / ngag gi sdom pa'i rjes la yid kyi sdom pa bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /

original: gzhon nu de lta bas na yid kyi sdom pas bsdam par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhon nu de lta bas na yid kyi sdom pas bsdam par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, prince, you should be restrained by the restraint of mind.‚Äù

original: yid kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa gang dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mi 'jigs pa thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa thams cad dang bral ba ni chos kyi sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The mental vow is the one by which the bodhisattva attains fearlessness with regard to the qualities of the Buddha.

original: chos ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin can gyi chos so //
analyzed: chos ni sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin can gyi chos so //
translated: The qualities are the qualities of the Buddha-nature.

original: 'thob par 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par 'gyur ba ni mngon sum du byed pa'o //
translated: Attains means actualizes.

original: mi 'khrugs pa'i sems rnam par grol ba rab tu thob par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / bdud dang rnam par rtog pas bskyod par mi nus pas rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa'i sems rnam par grol ba rab tu thob par gyur pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / bdud dang rnam par rtog pas bskyod par mi nus pas rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The mind of perfect liberation is unshakable, because it cannot be disturbed by afflictions, demons, or discursive thought.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mthar thug pa thob par gyur pa la yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi mthar thug pa thob par gyur pa la yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The attainment of the ultimate, which is characterized by the abandonment of all afflictions, is called the mental vow.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The vajra-like samadhi is the one by which the bodhisattva attains the destruction of the outflows.

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas bdud la sogs pas mi phyed cing mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas pas bdud la sogs pas mi phyed cing mi bskyod pa ste /

original: de bzhin du pha dang / ma dang / slob dpon rnams la g-yo'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha dang / ma dang / slob dpon rnams la g-yo'i sems mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: In the same way, he does not arouse a deceitful mind toward his father, mother, or teachers.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems mi bskyed pa ste chags par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems mi bskyed pa ste chags par mi byed do //
translated: He does not arouse a mind of desire, hatred, or ignorance. He does not act out of attachment.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi 'grogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems gtang bar mi bya ba dang / lhag pa'i sems kyang 'khrugs par mi byed pa ni phyin ci log tu sgro btags pas mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa dang mi 'grogs pa dang / byang chub kyi sems gtang bar mi bya ba dang / lhag pa'i sems kyang 'khrugs par mi byed pa ni phyin ci log tu sgro btags pas mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: He does not associate with those who are attached, and so on. He does not give up the thought of awakening, and he does not disturb the higher mind. He is unshakable by false imputation.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i kun du rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad dang yang dag par ldan pa'i kun du rtog pa spang bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: He abandons the conceptualization that is associated with all the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: de ni yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the restraint of the mind.

original: yid de yang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byis pa rnams rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir de lta bu'i byis pa rnams khams gsum pa 'di
analyzed: yid de yang sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes bya ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par rmongs pa'i rang bzhin can gyi byis pa rnams rang gi rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i shes rab dang bral ba'i phyir de lta bu'i byis pa rnams khams gsum pa 'di
translated: This is how the thought occurs to those childish beings who are ignorant of the nature of mind, because they lack the wisdom that apprehends its nature.üîΩThose childish beings think that these three realms

original: dag ni sems tsam mo zhes blo 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: dag ni sems tsam mo zhes blo 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: are mind only.

original: sems kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba ma shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they do not understand the nature of mind.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni ji ltar sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ni ji ltar sgyu ma'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni ma skyes pa'o //
translated: But the great bodhisattvas understand that the nature of an illusion is unborn.

original: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de ni skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa de ni skye ba med pa 'gag pa med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: That which is unborn by nature is neither produced nor does it cease, and it has no essence.

original: gang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: That which has no essence has no intrinsic nature.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dmigs su med de shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dmigs su med de shes pa zhes bya ba'am /
translated: Because it has no intrinsic nature, it is not apprehended as being either consciousness

original: rnam par shes bzhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: rnam par shes bzhes bya ba 'am /
translated: or mental cognition.

original: mi shes pa zhes bya ba'am /üîΩyod ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: mi shes pa zhes bya ba'am / yod ces bya ba 'am /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI do not know‚Äù does not occur,

original: med ces bya bar rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: med ces bya bar rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: nor the thought ‚ÄúIt exists‚Äù or ‚ÄúIt does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na @161a * //üîΩtha snyad gzhag pa ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na @161a * // tha snyad gzhag pa ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is like that,üîΩhow can there be any conventional usage?

original: tha snyad la brtags pas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
analyzed: tha snyad la brtags pas dgos pa ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the point of investigating conventional usage?

original: gal ter tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa med par gnas par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: gal ter tha snyad rnam par gzhag pa med par gnas par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: If you say that without the establishment of conventional usage, nothing can be established,

original: de ltan skye ba dang 'gag pa ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
analyzed: de ltan skye ba dang 'gag pa ni rmi lam lta bu'o //
translated: then birth and cessation are like a dream.

original: chu ltar snang ba ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu ltar snang ba ni smig rgyu lta bu'o //
translated: The appearance of water is like a mirage.

original: bu dang bu mo la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bu dang bu mo la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni sprul pa lta bu'o //
translated: The conventional usage of sons and daughters and so on is like a magical creation.

original: de dag thams cad kyang gnang nas kyang 'ongs pa med /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang gnang nas kyang 'ongs pa med /
translated: All of these are allowed, and yet they do not come from anywhere,

original: gar yang 'gro ba med la de lta na yang gzhi med bzhin du tha snyad nyid zhugs par gyur cing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gar yang 'gro ba med la de lta na yang gzhi med bzhin du tha snyad nyid zhugs par gyur cing 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and they do not go anywhere. And yet, even though they are groundless, conventional usage occurs and will occur.

original: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad kyang khyad par med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par shes pa'i tha snyad kyang khyad par med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, you should see that the conventional usage of consciousness is also not different.

original: yid kyi sdom pas yang dag par bsdams pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yid de yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pas yang dag par bsdams pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yid de yang mi dmigs so //
translated: The mind of the bodhisattva who is restrained by the restraint of mind is not even apprehended.

original: de'i phyir mi rtog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi rtog go //
translated: Therefore, it is non-conceptual.

original: de'i phyir rlom sems su mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rlom sems su mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, it does not falsely project.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it does not even become an objective support.

original: gang gi phyir cung zad tsam yang mi mthon ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir cung zad tsam yang mi mthon ngo //
translated: Because it does not see even the slightest thing.

original: des na thams cad la mngon par mi zhen te /
analyzed: des na thams cad la mngon par mi zhen te /
translated: Therefore, it does not settle down on anything at all.

original: kun rdzob tu ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo las mi g-yo ba ni yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo las mi g-yo ba ni yid kyi sdom pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du brjod pa'o //
translated: In conventional terms, not moving from the essence of the dharma-dhƒÅtu is called the restraint of mind. This is the conventional expression.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams la ni lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams la ni lhag pa med pas ma bshad do //
translated: In the verses, there is no redundancy, so it is not explained.

original: sangs rgyas yon tan yongs su rdzogs par sdom pa la zhugs shing //
analyzed: sangs rgyas yon tan yongs su rdzogs par sdom pa la zhugs shing //
translated: Engaged in the restraint that is the perfection of the qualities of the Buddha,

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ldan rtogs pa 'di ni rab 'dod cing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas kyi gzugs ldan rtogs pa 'di ni rab 'dod cing //
translated: Desiring this realization that has the form of perfect buddhahood,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyi ma'i 'od kyi tshogs kyi dkyil zhugs na //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i nyi ma'i 'od kyi tshogs kyi dkyil zhugs na //
translated: Having entered the circle of the mass of light rays of the sun of omniscience,

original: sgrib pa ma lus rnam par bsal nas rab tu sad pa'i sems //
analyzed: sgrib pa ma lus rnam par bsal nas rab tu sad pa'i sems //
translated: The mind is fully awakened, having cleared away all obscurations without exception.

original: yid sdom pa zhes de bshad chos rnams thams cad legs bsdus bas //
analyzed: yid sdom pa zhes de bshad chos rnams thams cad legs bsdus bas //
translated: The mind is restrained, having well gathered all phenomena.

original: chos nyid las gzhan min gzugs phyir ni sdom pa chos kyi sku //
analyzed: chos nyid las gzhan min gzugs phyir ni sdom pa chos kyi sku //
translated: The restraint of the mind is the dharmakƒÅya, because form is not different from reality.

original: yid kyi sdom pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa'i le'u ste bzhi bcu rtsa gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the forty-first chapter, on the restraint of the mind.

original: // / tshig sum brgya po 'di dag ni gleng gzhi'i le'ur bshad pas yang brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: // / tshig sum brgya po 'di dag ni gleng gzhi'i le'ur bshad pas yang brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: These three hundred verses have been explained in the chapter on the introduction, so they should not be repeated again.

original: rgya che ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Vast means the vastness of the Buddha's teachings.

original: ste ni gang gi phyir te gang gi phyir rgya che ba de'i phyir bstan pa yang rgya che ba ste tshul sna tshogs dang / sgo sna tshogs nas bstan pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa byang chub chen po la rab tu bkod nas dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes 'thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni nam mkha' bzhin rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: ste ni gang gi phyir te gang gi phyir rgya che ba de'i phyir bstan pa yang rgya che ba ste tshul sna tshogs dang / sgo sna tshogs nas bstan pas sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa byang chub chen po la rab tu bkod nas dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes 'thob par 'gyur bas 'di ni nam mkha' bzhin rgya che ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äútherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor what reason?‚Äù It means that because it is vast, the teaching is also vast, because it is taught in various ways and through various doors, and because it establishes the immeasurable realm of sentient beings in great enlightenment, and they attain immeasurable merit and gnosis. This is the vastness of the teaching, which is like space.

original: rin chen 'od zer rgya che @161b gang ;
analyzed: rin chen 'od zer rgya che @161b gang ;
translated: The vastness of the jewel is the vastness of the light rays of the jewel.

original: / zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams dpag tu med pa'i spyod pa rgya che ba dang / bstan pa rgya che ba ni rgya che ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dkon mchog dang / chos dkon mchog dang / dge 'dun dkon mchog rnams dpag tu med pa'i spyod pa rgya che ba dang / bstan pa rgya che ba ni rgya che ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The vastness of the jewel refers to the vastness of the immeasurable activity and the vastness of the immeasurable teaching of the jewel of the Buddha, the jewel of the Dharma, and the jewel of the Sa·πÖgha.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa na skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du kha cig ni byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin nges par bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bcom ldan 'das kyis bshad pa na skal pa ji lta ba bzhin du kha cig ni byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: When the Blessed One taught this Dharma discourse that reveals the samƒÅdhi, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, some generated the mind set on awakening in accordance with their fortune.

original: kha cig ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni phyir mi ldog pa nyid du'o //
translated: Some reached the stage of irreversibility.

original: gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: Others generated the mind set on the awakening of a buddha.üîΩOthers attained the fruit of arhatship.

original: yang gzhan dag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob par gyur te zhes bya bas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bstan pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is taught that the Blessed One‚Äôs Dharma teaching is fruitful.üîΩThis trichiliocosm shook in six ways:

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos shing ltas chen po bco brgyad du g-yos pa ni /üîΩg-yos so // rab tu g-yos so ;
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di yang rnam pa drug tu g-yos shing ltas chen po bco brgyad du g-yos pa ni / g-yos so // rab tu g-yos so ;
translated: it trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely;

original: / kun du g-yos so //
analyzed: / kun du g-yos so //
translated: it quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely;

original: 'gul to // rab tu 'gul to //
analyzed: 'gul to // rab tu 'gul to //
translated: it shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely;

original: kun du rab tu 'gul to //
analyzed: kun du rab tu 'gul to //
translated: and it shook all around.üîΩ

original: ldeg go // rab tu ldeg go //üîΩkun du rab tu ldeg go //üîΩ'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: ldeg go // rab tu ldeg go // kun du rab tu ldeg go // 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: It shook, shook strongly, and shook intensely.

original: kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //üîΩchem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: kun du rab tu 'ur 'ur ro // chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: It quivered, quivered strongly, and quivered intensely.üîΩIt trembled, trembled strongly, and trembled intensely.üîΩIt quaked, quaked strongly, and quaked intensely.

original: kun du rab tu chem chem mo //
analyzed: kun du rab tu chem chem mo //
translated: It roared, roared strongly, and roared intensely.üîΩIt crashed, crashed strongly, and crashed intensely.

original: shig shig / rab tu shig shig //üîΩkun du rab tu shig shig go zhes bya ba ni de la rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: shig shig / rab tu shig shig // kun du rab tu shig shig go zhes bya ba ni de la rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa ni g-yo ba dang / mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / steng du 'gro ba dang / 'og tu 'gro ba dang / sgra rjes su sgrogs pa'o //
translated: It split, split strongly, and split intensely.

original: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni drug po de dag nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas go ri mas ji lta ba bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: ltas chen po bco brgyad ni drug po de dag nyid kyi rnam par 'gyur ba rnams kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas go ri mas ji lta ba bzhin du rigs par bya'o //
translated: These eighteen great signs are to be understood as the lesser, middling, and greater shaking, etc., of the six kinds of shaking, etc., by their respective transformations.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: The world of the environment is also twofold:

original: 'dus byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: the created and the uncreated.

original: sems can gyi 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems can gyi 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The world of sentient beings is also twofold:üîΩthe world of sentient beings who practice nonvirtue and the world of sentient beings who practice virtue.üîΩThe world of sentient beings who practice nonvirtue is of three types: small, medium, and great.üîΩThe world of sentient beings who practice virtue is also of three types: small, medium, and great.

original: sems can mi dge ba la spyod pa dang / lha tshogs la mos pa dang / nga rgyal can dang rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas g-yo so zhes bya ba nas kun du shig shig ces bya ba'i bar du tshig bco brgyad kyis don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o //üîΩyang na gzhan du @162a * //üîΩbshad par bya ste /üîΩrnam pa drug tu g-yos pa dang / ltas chen po bco brgyad ces bya ba ni g-yos pa dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / chem chem pa dang / 'ur 'ur ba dang / shig shig pa ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: sems can mi dge ba la spyod pa dang / lha tshogs la mos pa dang / nga rgyal can dang rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dbang du byas nas chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas g-yo so zhes bya ba nas kun du shig shig ces bya ba'i bar du tshig bco brgyad kyis don bstan pa yin par shes par bya'o // yang na gzhan du @162a * // bshad par bya ste / rnam pa drug tu g-yos pa dang / ltas chen po bco brgyad ces bya ba ni g-yos pa dang / 'gul ba dang / ldeg pa dang / chem chem pa dang / 'ur 'ur ba dang / shig shig pa ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: The world of sentient beings who practice nonvirtue is of eighteen types, based on the eighteen terms from ‚Äútrembling‚Äù up to ‚Äúquaking violently.‚ÄùüîΩThe world of sentient beings who practice virtue is also of eighteen types, based on the eighteen terms from ‚Äútrembling‚Äù up to ‚Äúquaking violently.‚Äù

original: de dag nyid so sor chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas phye na ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag nyid so sor chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i dbye bas phye na ltas chen po bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: The eighteen great signs are the six types of trembling, trembling, shaking, quaking, trembling violently, and quaking violently, each of which is divided into three types: small, medium, and great.

original: phyogs drug la mtho ba dang / dma' ba'i dbye bas phyogs kyi 'gyur ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur la /
analyzed: phyogs drug la mtho ba dang / dma' ba'i dbye bas phyogs kyi 'gyur ba bcu gnyis su 'gyur la /
translated: The twelve changes of direction are due to the division into high and low in the six directions.

original: de dag kyang sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag kyang sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And these have already been explained above.

original: de la rgyu gnyis kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rgyu gnyis kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa 'di dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are two causes for these movements, etc.

original: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyis dam pa'i chos thos pa las byung ba'i dga' ba rab kyi mthar thug par gyur pa las byung bas kun du 'khor bar gyur pa las 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i lha rnams kyis dam pa'i chos thos pa las byung ba'i dga' ba rab kyi mthar thug par gyur pa las byung bas kun du 'khor bar gyur pa las 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The gods who possess great power are agitated by the ultimate joy that arises from hearing the holy Dharma, and by the agitation of the wheel.

original: brtan pa'i 'jig rten yang thams cad las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang por gyur ba nyid du bstan pa dang ; chos nyid kyi mthus chos kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtan pa'i 'jig rten yang thams cad las 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang por gyur ba nyid du bstan pa dang ; chos nyid kyi mthus chos kyi bdag nyid kyi che ba khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The steadfast world is taught as the lord of the Dharma that is the teaching of the TathƒÅgata who has transcended all, and in order to understand the greatness of the nature of the Dharma through the power of the Dharma.

original: de la phyogs gcig par bar du 'gul ba ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la phyogs gcig par bar du 'gul ba ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: Among them, movement is the shaking of one part.

original: shing rnams bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad g-yo ba ni 'gul ba'o //
analyzed: shing rnams bzhin du bdag nyid thams cad g-yo ba ni 'gul ba'o //
translated: Shaking is the trembling of all the earth.üîΩRocking is the trembling of all the trees.

original: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba ni ldeg pa'o //üîΩchem chem pa ni sgra rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o //üîΩ'ur 'ur ni 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: mgal me'i 'khor lo bzhin du 'khor ba ni ldeg pa'o // chem chem pa ni sgra rgyun chags su 'byung ba'o // 'ur 'ur ni 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: Quaking is the trembling of all the mountains.üîΩRumbling is the continuous sound of the divine drum.üîΩRoaring is the sound of the ocean.

original: shig shig pa ni shin tu zab pa'i sgra'o //
analyzed: shig shig pa ni shin tu zab pa'i sgra'o //
translated: Rattling is the sound of thunder.

original: yang na g-yo ba ni sa'o //
analyzed: yang na g-yo ba ni sa'o //
translated: Alternatively, shaking is the earth.

original: 'gul ba ni shing thams cad do //
analyzed: 'gul ba ni shing thams cad do //
translated: Rocking is all the trees.

original: ldeg pa ni ri thams cad do //
analyzed: ldeg pa ni ri thams cad do //
translated: Quaking is all the mountains.

original: chem chem pa ni lha'i rnga'i sgra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chem chem pa ni lha'i rnga'i sgra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Rumbling is the sound of the divine drum, and so on.

original: 'ur 'ur ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'ur 'ur ba ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Roaring is the sound of the ocean, and so on.

original: / shig shig pa ni 'brug gi sgra ltar sgrogs pa'o //üîΩde dag kyang dang po'i gnas skabs tsam pa'i dus na ni chung bar 'byung la /üîΩbar du ni 'bring du 'byung /
analyzed: / shig shig pa ni 'brug gi sgra ltar sgrogs pa'o // de dag kyang dang po'i gnas skabs tsam pa'i dus na ni chung bar 'byung la / bar du ni 'bring du 'byung /
translated: Rattling is the sound of thunder.üîΩThese are said to be eighteen, since they occur in a small, medium, and great form in the first period of time,üîΩin a medium form in the middle period,

original: tha mar ni che bar 'byung ngo zhes bya bas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mar ni che bar 'byung ngo zhes bya bas bco brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: and in a great form in the final period.

original: phyogs thams cad du yang mtho ba dang / dma' ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu mnyam du 'byung bar 'gyur na ni bcad nas gtor ba bzhin du shin tu 'khrugs par 'gyur na rim gyis mtho ba dang / dma' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du yang mtho ba dang / dma' ba la sogs pa rnam pa gcig tu mnyam du 'byung bar 'gyur na ni bcad nas gtor ba bzhin du shin tu 'khrugs par 'gyur na rim gyis mtho ba dang / dma' ba la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the entire region were to rise and fall at the same time, it would be extremely disturbed, as if cut and thrown.

original: de la gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi sa chen po ri dang shing du bcas pa shin tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho @162b ba lta bur snang ba 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe shar phyogs kyi sa chen po ri dang shing du bcas pa shin tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe shar phyogs mtho @162b ba lta bur snang ba 'gyur ro //
translated: When the great eastern region, with its mountains and trees, is extremely disturbed, then the east appears to rise.

original: de'i tshe nub phyogs rang gi rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba lta bur snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe nub phyogs rang gi rang bzhin du gnas kyang dma' ba lta bur snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, even though the west remains in its own nature, it appears to fall.

original: de'i phyir shar phyogs mtho na nub phyogs dma' ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shar phyogs mtho na nub phyogs dma' ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when the east rises, the west appears to fall.

original: gang gi tshe nub phyogs kyis chen po ri dang shing du bcas pa shin tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe nub phyogs kyis chen po ri dang shing du bcas pa shin tu 'khrugs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the great western region, with its mountains and trees, is extremely disturbed,

original: nub phyogs mtho ba ltar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nub phyogs mtho ba ltar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The west appears to be rising. This should be applied everywhere.

original: cho 'phrul dang bcas par bstan pa yang cho 'phrul bstan pas sems can rnams 'dul ba ni dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: cho 'phrul dang bcas par bstan pa yang cho 'phrul bstan pas sems can rnams 'dul ba ni dgos pa yin no //
translated: The teaching with miracles is for the purpose of taming beings through the display of miracles.

original: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa yin no zhes shes nas chos kyi de kho na nyid goms par bya ba la rtag tu nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid kyis g-yo ba la sogs pa yin no zhes shes nas chos kyi de kho na nyid goms par bya ba la rtag tu nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Knowing that it is the greatness of the nature of phenomena that moves and so forth, one should always strive in cultivating the reality of phenomena.

original: gzhan yang lha'i me tog la sogs pa'i char 'bab pa la sogs pa rnams kyang chos nyid kyi stobs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha'i me tog la sogs pa'i char 'bab pa la sogs pa rnams kyang chos nyid kyi stobs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the rain of divine flowers and so forth should be seen as the power of the nature of phenomena.

original: kun dga' bo chos kyi rnam grangs 'di khyod kyis zung zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag par gtod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: kun dga' bo chos kyi rnam grangs 'di khyod kyis zung zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas ni yang dag par gtod par byed pa yin no //
translated: By saying ƒÄnanda, you should uphold this Dharma discourse, and so forth, it is a proper entrustment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable ƒÄnanda said to the Blessed One, Blessed One, this Dharma discourse is called The Teaching of Vimalagarbha and MƒÅmakƒ´.

original: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags zhes bya ba ni ming gzung ba tsam gyis bsod nams kyi phung po chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i ming ci lags zhes bya ba ni ming gzung ba tsam gyis bsod nams kyi phung po chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that merely by holding its name, one will attain a great heap of merit.üîΩ How should it be held?

original: ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du byed pa'i dus su the tshom med par tha snyad du bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni tha snyad du byed pa'i dus su the tshom med par tha snyad du bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that at the time of making a convention, one should make a convention without doubt.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Blessed One said:üîΩHold it as 'The Entry into Great Compassion.'

original: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba ni 'dis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nges par byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la 'jug pa zhes bya bar zung shig ces bya ba ni 'dis dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje chen po'i ngo bo nges par byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that by this, the nature of non-referential great compassion is ascertained.

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya bar yang zung zhig ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya bar yang zung zhig ces bya ba ni /
translated: Hold it also as 'The SamƒÅdhi of the Equal Nature of All Dharmas, Elaborated.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni shin tu 'da' bar dka'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' ni shin tu 'da' bar dka'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata's word is extremely difficult to transgress.üîΩ

original: kun dga' bos gsol ba bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bdag gis bzung lags so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa kun dga' bos khas blangs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' bos gsol ba bcom ldan 'das chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bdag gis bzung lags so zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa kun dga' bos khas blangs par gyur pa'o //
translated: Ananda said, ‚ÄúBlessed One, I have taken up this Dharma discourse.‚Äù This is the noble Ananda‚Äôs acceptance.üîΩWhen the Blessed One had said this,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gsungs par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde 'di gsungs par gyur pa na'o //
translated: means when this sutra had been taught.

original: yi rangs pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas @163a * //
analyzed: yi rangs pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pas @163a * //
translated: Delighted means that the intentions and higher intentions of the disciples were fulfilled.

original: shin tu yang bzung bas yi rangs pas bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rangs pa'o //üîΩzla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa yang yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang bzung bas yi rangs pas bcom ldan 'das kyang thugs rangs pa'o // zla 'od gzhon nur gyur pa yang yi rangs pa'o //
translated: Since they were very pleased to have taken it up, the Blessed One was also pleased.üîΩThe youthful Candraprabha was also pleased.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yang yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yang yi rangs pa'o //
translated: The venerable Ananda was also pleased.

original: 'khor bzhi po de dag kyang yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po de dag kyang yi rangs pa'o //
translated: The four retinues were also pleased.

original: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i bu du ma yang yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i bu du ma yang yi rangs pa'o //
translated: Many gods of the Pure Abodes were also pleased.

original: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang yi rangs pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang lha ma yin dang dri zar bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams kyang yi rangs pa'o //
translated: The world with its gods, men, asuras, and gandharvas rejoices.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis yang dag par mnyes par byas pa gang yin pa de thams cad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni legs so legs so legs par gsungs so zhes bya bas
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs phyin ci ma log pa'i sems kyis yang dag par mnyes par byas pa gang yin pa de thams cad bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do zhes bya ba ni legs so legs so legs par gsungs so zhes bya bas
translated: All of them praise the speech of the Blessed One, which is pleasing due to the Blessed One's mind being free from error.

original: mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: This is the praise with rejoicing.üîΩThe assembly of very pleasant and very sweet words,

original: shin tu yid 'ong shin tu snyan pa'i tshig gi tshogs kyi 'od zer dang // 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi zhabs kyi padma rnam bsnyen 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: shin tu yid 'ong shin tu snyan pa'i tshig gi tshogs kyi 'od zer dang // 'jam pa'i dbyangs kyi zhabs kyi padma rnam bsnyen 'gro ba yi //
translated: and the light rays of the lotus feet of Ma√±jugho·π£a,

analyzed: srid par gtogs pa'i rab rib tshogs rnams ma lus sel byed pa //
translated: completely remove the mass of darkness belonging to existence.

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i tshul gyis gnas gyur rnam par 'grel la rab mkhas shing /
translated: Skilled in fully explaining the transformation through the method of the Sugata,

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos rnams bsgom bya ma lus bsgoms gyur gang yin pas /

analyzed: tshul rnams sna tshogs brnyes pa'i gnyen dang ma chags pa dag gis //

analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsungs gi snying por gyur pa rab gnas pa //
translated: The one who is well-established in the essence of the Sugata's speech,

analyzed: ma bkrol bzhag pa bdag la skal ba cung zad tsam zhig yod pa yin //
translated: I have a little bit of fortune in the one who is not liberated and is placed.

original: sems can don la brtson pa'i sems ldan snying rje rnam par 'phro ba sems can gnyen gcig pa //
analyzed: sems can don la brtson pa'i sems ldan snying rje rnam par 'phro ba sems can gnyen gcig pa //
translated: The one who has a mind striving for the benefit of sentient beings, the one who is compassionate and has a mind of love for sentient beings,

analyzed: sa stengs rigs mang ldan par grags pa 'jam dpal grags pa zhes bya ba rtul zhugs can //

analyzed: des ni mdo sde rin po che 'di'i 'grel pa grags pa'i phreng ba zhes bya byas //

original: de ni bsgom bya bsgoms na bde gshegs kyis gsungs de nyid gcig tu zhi ba snang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni bsgom bya bsgoms na bde gshegs kyis gsungs de nyid gcig tu zhi ba snang bar 'gyur //

original: chos rnams thams cad mnyam nyid rnam spros pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad mnyam nyid rnam spros pa //
translated: The one who has the equality of all phenomena,

analyzed: ting 'dzin rgyal po de nyid 'jam dbyangs mchog / chos rnams kun gyi lugs la mkhas gyur ba //
translated: The supreme Manjushri, the king of samadhis, the one who is skilled in the system of all dharmas,

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'i chos sku mchog / rgyal ba'i yon tan kun gyis brgyan pa'i mdo sde'i rgyal po'i 'grel ba ji bzhin byas pa las //
translated: From this commentary on the King of Sutras, adorned with all the qualities of the Victorious Ones,

analyzed: bsod nams mkha' ltar mtha' med ston @163b ka'i skar ma'i bdag po'i ma dangs 'dra bdag gis gang thob pa //
translated: Whatever merit I have gained, like the pure essence of the lord of the stars in the autumn sky,

original: de dag gis ni 'khrul ba med pa'i sems kyis gcig tu gzhan phan sems can kun gyi don byas nas //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'khrul ba med pa'i sems kyis gcig tu gzhan phan sems can kun gyi don byas nas //
translated: With that, may they, with minds free from error, always benefit others and accomplish the welfare of all beings.üîΩMay they attain the state of bodhisattvas, the supreme heirs of the Victorious Ones, renowned as Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´, and may they attain buddhahood.

translated: By the blessings of Ma√±jugho·π£a, may their fame spread far and wide,

analyzed: nam mkha' dri med steng nas 'gro ba'i nyi ma'i 'od kyis mun pa sel zhing rab rgyas pa //

analyzed: sangs rgyas gdung la gcig tu zhen pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i rten gyi sar gyur 'di yi 'grel byas pas //
translated: By this commentary on this ground, which is the basis of omniscience,üîΩMay the explanation remain to the end of time and space.üîΩThe commentary on the SamaÃÑdhiraÃÑja called ‚ÄúThe Garland of Fame‚Äù is
